original: @96a # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @96a # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: pr'a k'a sham n'a ma shr'i he badzra s'a dha nam /
analyzed: pr'a k'a sham n'a ma shr'i he badzra s'a dha nam /
translated: Prakaśa-nāma-śrī-hevajra-sādhana

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: dpal kye rdo rje'i sgrub thabs rab tu gsal ba zhes bya ba /
analyzed: dpal kye rdo rje'i sgrub thabs rab tu gsal ba zhes bya ba /
translated: The glorious Hevajra's practice called The Clear Light

original: dpal he ru ka la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: dpal he ru ka la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the glorious Heruka.

original: mgon po stong dang stong min gyi //
analyzed: mgon po stong dang stong min gyi //
translated: The lord, with the nature of a thousand and not a thousand,

original: rang bzhin phyag gnyis lhan cig skyes //
analyzed: rang bzhin phyag gnyis lhan cig skyes //
translated: is the innate with two arms.

original: sku mdog dkar zhing zhal gcig la //
analyzed: sku mdog dkar zhing zhal gcig la //
translated: White in color, with one face,

original: he ru ka dpal phyag byas nas //
analyzed: he ru ka dpal phyag byas nas //
translated: having paid homage to the glorious Heruka,

original: de las yongs gyur rnam pa ni //
analyzed: de las yongs gyur rnam pa ni //
translated: from that, the form is transformed,

original: bcu drug pa dang phyag drug sogs //
analyzed: bcu drug pa dang phyag drug sogs //
translated: with sixteen faces, six arms, and so forth.

original: de bzhin du yang bdag med ma //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang bdag med ma //
translated: Likewise, also Nairātmyā,

original: sngags pas de rnams sgrub thabs brjod //
analyzed: sngags pas de rnams sgrub thabs brjod //
translated: the mantrin should recite their sādhana.

original: de la dpal ldan slob dpon mtsho skyes zhabs kyis mdzad pa'i sna tshogs pa'i kye rdo rje'i sgrub thabs kyi mdor bsdus pa rdo rje sgron ma zhes bya ba dpal dz'a landha ri ba'i zhabs kyis mdzad do //
analyzed: de la dpal ldan slob dpon mtsho skyes zhabs kyis mdzad pa'i sna tshogs pa'i kye rdo rje'i sgrub thabs kyi mdor bsdus pa rdo rje sgron ma zhes bya ba dpal dz'a landha ri ba'i zhabs kyis mdzad do //
translated: Regarding that, the brief vajra lamp called The Clear Light was composed by the glorious master Padmāṅkaḥ, the glorious Jālandharipāda, of the various Hevajra sādhanas.

original: 'di nyid bzang po'i zhabs kyis zhe sdang rdo rje'i sgrub pa'i thabs mdzad pa de dang de'i don gsal ba kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid bzang po'i zhabs kyis zhe sdang rdo rje'i sgrub pa'i thabs mdzad pa de dang de'i don gsal ba kho na'o //
translated: This is the very same as the method of accomplishing Hevajra composed by the venerable Bhavyakīrti, and it is only the clarification of its meaning.

original: de lta na yang blo zhan pa dag gis de thos nas bsgom par bya bar mi nus so zhes rnam par bsams nas /
analyzed: de lta na yang blo zhan pa dag gis de thos nas bsgom par bya bar mi nus so zhes rnam par bsams nas /
translated: Even so, thinking that those of weak intellect, having heard it, will be unable to meditate upon it,

original: de bsgrub pa'i thabs dang / mdor bsdus pa dang / zhe sdang rdo rje'i sgrub pa'i thabs rnams las yang dag par drangs te blo zhan pa dag gi rang gi yid ches bya ba'i phyir du bdag gis rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'brang nas bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i sgrub pa'i thabs bsre bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bsgrub pa'i thabs dang / mdor bsdus pa dang / zhe sdang rdo rje'i sgrub pa'i thabs rnams las yang dag par drangs te blo zhan pa dag gi rang gi yid ches bya ba'i phyir du bdag gis rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'brang nas bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i sgrub pa'i thabs bsre bar bya'o //
translated: I will mix the method of accomplishing it, which is drawn from the Compendium of Practice and the Hevajra Sadhana, with the method of accomplishment of the creation and completion stages, following the root tantra, in order to create confidence in those of weak intellect.🔽The two stages are taught

original: kye rdo rjer yang dag gsungs pa //
analyzed: kye rdo rjer yang dag gsungs pa //
translated: in the Hevajra Tantra:🔽The stage of creation

original: bskyed pa yi ni rim pa dang // rdzogs pa yi yang rim pa nyid //🔽rim gnyis mtshungs pa la brten nas //
analyzed: bskyed pa yi ni rim pa dang // rdzogs pa yi yang rim pa nyid // rim gnyis mtshungs pa la brten nas //
translated: and the stage of completion.

original: rdo rje can gyis chos bstan to //
analyzed: rdo rje can gyis chos bstan to //
translated: The vajra holder teaches the dharma🔽in dependence upon the equality of the two stages.

original: zhes pa'o // de la rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i sgrub pa'i thabs ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa mdo gzhan gyi rjes su 'brangs nas kyang khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // de la rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i sgrub pa'i thabs ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa mdo gzhan gyi rjes su 'brangs nas kyang khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Therein, the means of achieving the perfection stage should be understood by following other sūtras such as the Perfection of Wisdom.

original: de la skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis rnam par dag pa'i sgrub pa'i thabs kyi mdo ni sum cu rtsa gnyis su dz'a landha ri pa'i zhabs kyis gsungs /
analyzed: de la skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis rnam par dag pa'i sgrub pa'i thabs kyi mdo ni sum cu rtsa gnyis su dz'a landha ri pa'i zhabs kyis gsungs /
translated: Therein, the sūtra on the means of achieving the thirty-two marks of a great being was taught in thirty-two chapters by the venerable Jālandharipāda.

original: de yang rim gyis 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang rim gyis 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: That will be explained in due course.

original: dang por re zhig sdig pa bshags pa dang // gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba dang // @96b gso sbyong gi bar du bzung nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug la legs par bslabs pa /
analyzed: dang por re zhig sdig pa bshags pa dang // gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba dang // @96b gso sbyong gi bar du bzung nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug la legs par bslabs pa /
translated: First, having confessed one’s sins, gone for refuge to the Three Jewels, and taken up the purificatory fast, one should train well in the six perfections.

original: rdo rje'i bla ma mnyes par byas nas dpal kye rdo rjer gsungs shing ji skad du bshad pa'i tshogs dkyil 'khor du zhugs shing rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su dbang bskur ba /
analyzed: rdo rje'i bla ma mnyes par byas nas dpal kye rdo rjer gsungs shing ji skad du bshad pa'i tshogs dkyil 'khor du zhugs shing rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su dbang bskur ba /
translated: Having pleased the vajra guru, one should enter the glorious Hevajra-taught assembly mandala and be fully initiated in the proper sequence.

original: slar yang bla ma rje btsun yang dag par bsnyen pa /
analyzed: slar yang bla ma rje btsun yang dag par bsnyen pa /
translated: Again, the venerable guru is perfectly propitiated.

original: 'di'i rgyud thos nas yang dag pa'i de kho na nyid stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i byang chub kyi sems thob cing /
analyzed: 'di'i rgyud thos nas yang dag pa'i de kho na nyid stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i byang chub kyi sems thob cing /
translated: Having heard this tantra, one obtains the mind of enlightenment, which is the indivisibility of emptiness and compassion, the perfect thatness.

original: kye rdo rje bsgom par bya'o zhes bla ma'i rjes su gnang ba thob pa /
analyzed: kye rdo rje bsgom par bya'o zhes bla ma'i rjes su gnang ba thob pa /
translated: One obtains the guru's permission, thinking, I will meditate on Hevajra.

original: sems can thams cad kyi don la brtson pa'i blos /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don la brtson pa'i blos /
translated: With a mind that is dedicated to the welfare of all sentient beings,

original: dpal kye rdo rje'i sgrub pa byed par 'dod pa'i rnal 'byor pas /
analyzed: dpal kye rdo rje'i sgrub pa byed par 'dod pa'i rnal 'byor pas /
translated: the yogī who wishes to perform the sādhana of glorious Hevajra

original: yid dang rjes su mthun pa'i sbas pa'i gnas su //
analyzed: yid dang rjes su mthun pa'i sbas pa'i gnas su //
translated: should go to a secluded place that is pleasing to the mind.

original: sna tshogs rdo rjes mtshan pa'i bde ba'i stan gyi dbus su rdo rje'i skyil mo krung gis 'dug nas /
analyzed: sna tshogs rdo rjes mtshan pa'i bde ba'i stan gyi dbus su rdo rje'i skyil mo krung gis 'dug nas /
translated: In the center of a comfortable seat marked with a crossed vajra, he should sit in the vajra posture

original: drod thob par gyur pa ji srid par dpal kye rdo rje bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: drod thob par gyur pa ji srid par dpal kye rdo rje bsgom par bya'o //
translated: and meditate on glorious Hevajra for as long as he has attained warmth.

original: drod cung zad yang dag par thob pa na bdud rtsi lnga la sogs pa'i dam tshig bsten cing /
analyzed: drod cung zad yang dag par thob pa na bdud rtsi lnga la sogs pa'i dam tshig bsten cing /
translated: When he has perfectly attained a little warmth, he should rely on the pledges of the five nectars and so forth.

original: shes rab mtshan ma thob pa bkug la yang dag par bzung nas rang gi 'dod pa'i lha bsgrub par bya'o //🔽shr'i he ru ka ham zhes brjod nas 'chad par 'gyur pa'i rang gi 'dod pa'i lhar dmigs te rang gi snying ga'i padma re pha yongs su gyur pa'i nyi ma la /
analyzed: shes rab mtshan ma thob pa bkug la yang dag par bzung nas rang gi 'dod pa'i lha bsgrub par bya'o // shr'i he ru ka ham zhes brjod nas 'chad par 'gyur pa'i rang gi 'dod pa'i lhar dmigs te rang gi snying ga'i padma re pha yongs su gyur pa'i nyi ma la /
translated: Having summoned the wisdom-being who has attained the sign, and having taken him up, one should accomplish one's desired deity.

original: h'um yig sngon po 'od zer lnga dang ldan pa blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: h'um yig sngon po 'od zer lnga dang ldan pa blta bar bya'o //
translated: Having uttered Shrī Heruka I am, one should visualize oneself as one's desired deity, as will be explained, and one should see the blue syllable hūṃ endowed with five lights on a sun that is the transformation of a lotus and the syllable re at one's heart.

original: de las rnam par 'phros pa'i 'od zer rnam lnga rnams kyis mtha' yas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams snang bar byas nas /
analyzed: de las rnam par 'phros pa'i 'od zer rnam lnga rnams kyis mtha' yas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams snang bar byas nas /
translated: From that, one should see five-colored light rays radiating, illuminating infinite world systems,

original: goo r'i la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor ma'i 'khor los yongs su bskor ba'i rang gi 'dod pa'i lha dang / bla ma dang / sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang spyan drangs te /
analyzed: goo r'i la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor ma'i 'khor los yongs su bskor ba'i rang gi 'dod pa'i lha dang / bla ma dang / sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang spyan drangs te /
translated: and inviting one's desired deity surrounded by the wheel of yoginīs beginning with Gaurī, as well as the gurus, buddhas, and bodhisattvas.

original: mdun gyi nam mkhar bsams nas /
analyzed: mdun gyi nam mkhar bsams nas /
translated: Having imagined them in the space in front,

original: phyi dang gsang ba dang / de kho na nyid kyi mchod pa'i khyad par rnams kyis yang dag par mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi dang gsang ba dang / de kho na nyid kyi mchod pa'i khyad par rnams kyis yang dag par mchod par bya'o //
translated: One should make offerings with the special outer, secret, and suchness offerings.

original: de la rang gi sa bon las rnam par spros pa'i pi wang ma la sogs pa chos ma'i mthar thug pa'i lha mo bcu drug po 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rang rang gi rnam pa dang phyag dang mtshan ma dang zhabs rnams kyis so zhes pa phyi'i mchod pa'o🔽// de'i 'khor @97a * //
analyzed: de la rang gi sa bon las rnam par spros pa'i pi wang ma la sogs pa chos ma'i mthar thug pa'i lha mo bcu drug po 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rang rang gi rnam pa dang phyag dang mtshan ma dang zhabs rnams kyis so zhes pa phyi'i mchod pa'o // de'i 'khor @97a * //
translated: There, the sixteen goddesses from vīṇā-māṇḍravīṇā, who emanate from their own seed syllables, have the aspects, hands, and implements, and feet, as will be explained.

original: lor gnas pa'i goo r'i la sogs pa'i lha mo phyag na dam tshig gi rdzas stobs pa bsgom pa ni gsang ba'i mchod pa'o //
analyzed: lor gnas pa'i goo r'i la sogs pa'i lha mo phyag na dam tshig gi rdzas stobs pa bsgom pa ni gsang ba'i mchod pa'o //
translated: The meditation on the goddesses Gaurī, etc., who reside in the retinue of the wheel and who hold the pledge substances in their hands, is the secret offering.

original: bdag med ma rang snyoms par zhugs pa'i bde ba rjes su myong ba las spro ba dang sdud pa'i de kho na nyid de /
analyzed: bdag med ma rang snyoms par zhugs pa'i bde ba rjes su myong ba las spro ba dang sdud pa'i de kho na nyid de /
translated: The suchness is the experience of the bliss of one’s own union with Nairātmya, from which emanation and gathering emanate.

original: de nyid de kho na nyid kyi mchod pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid de kho na nyid kyi mchod pa'o //
translated: That is the suchness offering.

original: yang dag par mchod nas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par mchod nas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: Having made offerings in this way, one should confess one’s sins and so forth in the presence of the Blessed One.🔽Whatever sins I have committed,🔽caused others to commit, or have rejoiced in,🔽in the course of my cyclic existence🔽throughout beginningless time,

original: thog ma med pa dang ldan pa'i 'khor bar skye ba brgyud pa rnams su 'khor ba na sdig pa'i las gang zhig byas pa dang byed du bcug pa dang / rjes su yi rang ba ni bshags par bgyi ste ;
analyzed: thog ma med pa dang ldan pa'i 'khor bar skye ba brgyud pa rnams su 'khor ba na sdig pa'i las gang zhig byas pa dang byed du bcug pa dang / rjes su yi rang ba ni bshags par bgyi ste ;
translated: I confess them all,🔽each and every one,🔽in the presence of those who see things as they are.

original: nyid kyis de thams cad slan chad nges par mi bgyi'o //
analyzed: nyid kyis de thams cad slan chad nges par mi bgyi'o //
translated: I will not commit them again.🔽I rejoice in the merit of all beings,🔽and likewise in that of the world’s protectors,🔽the Buddhas who are rhinoceros-like,

original: skye bo thams cad dang / de bzhin du 'jig rten pa'i lha rnams dang / bse ru ltar spyod pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi bsod nams dang nyan thos kyi sangs rgyas dang / rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas skyob pa rnams kyi bsod nams la ngo bo nyid kyis rjes su yi rang ngo //
analyzed: skye bo thams cad dang / de bzhin du 'jig rten pa'i lha rnams dang / bse ru ltar spyod pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi bsod nams dang nyan thos kyi sangs rgyas dang / rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas skyob pa rnams kyi bsod nams la ngo bo nyid kyis rjes su yi rang ngo //
translated: and in the merit of the hearers and the perfect Buddhas, the protectors.

original: gang zhig rjes su yi rang ba dang / lhan cig tu gyur pa'i bsod nams kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub gang yin par bsngo bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: gang zhig rjes su yi rang ba dang / lhan cig tu gyur pa'i bsod nams kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub gang yin par bsngo bar bgyi'o //
translated: I dedicate the merit of rejoicing in and being in union with that to unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment.

original: sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i slad du lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i bde ba'i khang par bcom ldan 'das rnams gsum po gcig pa'i sku dpal ldan he ru ka dpa' bo sangs rgyas dang / des bstan pa'i dkyil 'khor dang sngags dang phyag rgya la sogs pa'i chos dang /
analyzed: sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i slad du lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i bde ba'i khang par bcom ldan 'das rnams gsum po gcig pa'i sku dpal ldan he ru ka dpa' bo sangs rgyas dang / des bstan pa'i dkyil 'khor dang sngags dang phyag rgya la sogs pa'i chos dang /
translated: For the sake of generating the enlightenment mind of the heroes, in the palace of the bliss of coemergent joy, the three Bhagavans are one body, glorious Heruka, the hero of the buddhas, and the dharma of the maṇḍala, mantra, mudra, and so on that he teaches,

original: de'i 'khor lor gnas pa'i goo r'i la sogs pa'i lha mo'i tshogs kyi dge 'dun la yang byang chub kyi snying po ji srid par skyabs su mchi'o //
analyzed: de'i 'khor lor gnas pa'i goo r'i la sogs pa'i lha mo'i tshogs kyi dge 'dun la yang byang chub kyi snying po ji srid par skyabs su mchi'o //
translated: and the saṅgha of the assembly of goddesses such as Gaurī who abide in his maṇḍala—I go for refuge in them until the essence of enlightenment.

original: sems can thams cad kyi don byed pa'i rgyur gyur pa rnams thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i byang chub kyi sems bskyed par bgyi'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don byed pa'i rgyur gyur pa rnams thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i byang chub kyi sems bskyed par bgyi'o //
translated: I will generate the mind of awakening, which is the inseparability of emptiness and compassion, in the perfect, complete awakening to buddhahood, which has the characteristic of emptiness endowed with the supreme of all aspects, for the sake of all sentient beings.

original: bla na med pa'i lam la brten par bgyi ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i lam la brten par bgyi ste /
translated: I will rely on the unsurpassed path.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: rdo rje theg pa la'o //
analyzed: rdo rje theg pa la'o //
translated: [I will rely on] the Vajra Vehicle.

original: slar yang sems can de rnams thams cad bde bar bya ba'i phyir du bdag dang bdag gis sbyin par bgyi'o //
analyzed: slar yang sems can de rnams thams cad bde bar bya ba'i phyir du bdag dang bdag gis sbyin par bgyi'o //
translated: Moreover, for the sake of bringing about the happiness of all sentient beings, I will give myself and everything I have.

original: mchod pa'i 'khor lo zhes bya ba @97b mdo dang po'o /
analyzed: mchod pa'i 'khor lo zhes bya ba @97b mdo dang po'o /
translated: The first chapter of the mandala of offerings.

original: // / kye yi rdo rje yang gsungs pa //
analyzed: // / kye yi rdo rje yang gsungs pa //
translated: Also, Hevajra said:

original: nam mkhar rje btsun bltas nas ni //
analyzed: nam mkhar rje btsun bltas nas ni //
translated: Gazing at the venerable one in the sky,

original: rdo rje skye ba snying rje che //
analyzed: rdo rje skye ba snying rje che //
translated: the vajra-born one, great compassion,

original: rgyan rnams thams cad 'dzin pa yi //
analyzed: rgyan rnams thams cad 'dzin pa yi //
translated: holding all the ornaments,

original: lha mo brgyad rnams kyis mchod bya //
analyzed: lha mo brgyad rnams kyis mchod bya //
translated: is worshipped by the eight goddesses.

original: de la / goo r'i ri dags mtshan ma 'dzin //
analyzed: de la / goo r'i ri dags mtshan ma 'dzin //
translated: There, Gauri holds the sign of the deer.

original: chom rkun ma ni nyi ma'i snod //
analyzed: chom rkun ma ni nyi ma'i snod //
translated: The thief holds the sun-vessel.

original: ro langs ma ni chu lag ma //
analyzed: ro langs ma ni chu lag ma //
translated: The zombie holds the water-vessel.

original: ghasma r'i ma sman 'dzin zhing //
analyzed: ghasma r'i ma sman 'dzin zhing //
translated: The ghoul holds the medicine.

original: pukka s'i yi lag na stobs //
analyzed: pukka s'i yi lag na stobs //
translated: The Pukkasī holds the strength.

original: ri khrod ma ni ro 'dzin gyur //
analyzed: ri khrod ma ni ro 'dzin gyur //
translated: The forest-dwelling woman holds the corpse.

original: tsanda l'i ni cang te'u brdung //
analyzed: tsanda l'i ni cang te'u brdung //
translated: The Caṇḍālī rings the bell.

original: g-yung mos 'khyud par rab ston bya //
analyzed: g-yung mos 'khyud par rab ston bya //
translated: The outcaste woman displays the embrace.

original: zhes so // slar yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes so // slar yang gsungs pa /
translated: Again it is said:

original: gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa rnams kyis mchod par bya'o zhes pa la sogs pa rgyas par ro //
analyzed: gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa rnams kyis mchod par bya'o zhes pa la sogs pa rgyas par ro //
translated: “One should worship with the goddesses beginning with Rūpavajrā.”

original: de'i rjes su thog ma med pa'i srid pa'i 'khor lor 'khor ba rnams su sems can thams cad bdag gi ma dang bcas spun dang srid mo la sogs pa'i rang bzhin no zhes yongs su brtags nas /
analyzed: de'i rjes su thog ma med pa'i srid pa'i 'khor lor 'khor ba rnams su sems can thams cad bdag gi ma dang bcas spun dang srid mo la sogs pa'i rang bzhin no zhes yongs su brtags nas /
translated: After that, one should contemplate all sentient beings as one’s mother, brother, sister, and so on, in the cycle of existence in beginningless time.

original: de rnams la bu gcig pa ltar dga' ba'i mtshan nyid kyi byams pa chen po bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams la bu gcig pa ltar dga' ba'i mtshan nyid kyi byams pa chen po bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Then one should cultivate great love, which is characterized by affection, as if for one’s only child.

original: de nas de thams cad 'khor ba'i rgya mtshor lhung zhing skyabs med par mthong nas mchi ma cher 'khrug cing sdug bsngal gyi rgyu las 'don par mngon par 'dod pa'i rang bzhin gyi snying rje chen po bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas de thams cad 'khor ba'i rgya mtshor lhung zhing skyabs med par mthong nas mchi ma cher 'khrug cing sdug bsngal gyi rgyu las 'don par mngon par 'dod pa'i rang bzhin gyi snying rje chen po bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Then, having seen that all of them have fallen into the ocean of cyclic existence and are without refuge, one should cultivate great compassion, whose nature is the desire to liberate them from the cause of suffering, with tears streaming down one's face.

original: de nas yang dga' ba thob pa'i rnal 'byor pas dpal he ru ka la sogs pa khyad par 'phags pa'i thabs mthong ba las bde ba thams cad stobs pa'i rang bzhin gyi dga' ba chen po bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas yang dga' ba thob pa'i rnal 'byor pas dpal he ru ka la sogs pa khyad par 'phags pa'i thabs mthong ba las bde ba thams cad stobs pa'i rang bzhin gyi dga' ba chen po bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Then, the yogi who has attained joy should cultivate great joy, whose nature is the bestowal of all bliss, from seeing the special means such as glorious Heruka.

original: de'i rjes su grub pa'i bdag nyid dpal he ru ka'i rnam par byas nas rnyed pa sogs par 'dzin pa ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid kyi btang snyoms chen po yang bzhi par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes su grub pa'i bdag nyid dpal he ru ka'i rnam par byas nas rnyed pa sogs par 'dzin pa ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid kyi btang snyoms chen po yang bzhi par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: After that, having made oneself into the nature of the accomplished glorious Heruka, one should cultivate great equanimity, whose characteristic is freedom from the eight worldly dharmas, thinking that it is not right to grasp at gain and so forth.

original: tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi'o //
translated: The four divine abodes.

original: de dang bar med par tha mal pa'i lus med par bltas nas ye shes kyi snang ba rdo rje'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rnal 'byor gyis /
analyzed: de dang bar med par tha mal pa'i lus med par bltas nas ye shes kyi snang ba rdo rje'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rnal 'byor gyis /
translated: Without any space between the two, visualize that the ordinary body is gone and that the appearance of timeless awareness is present.🔽

original: shr'i he ru ka zhes pa'i yi ge bzhi'i don la mngon du phyogs shing bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: shr'i he ru ka zhes pa'i yi ge bzhi'i don la mngon du phyogs shing bsgom pa ste /
translated: Having seen that there is no ordinary body in between, one should meditate facing the meaning of the four syllables of the vajra samādhi yoga of the appearance of pristine consciousness.

original: dam pa'i man ngag las so //
analyzed: dam pa'i man ngag las so //
translated: This is the oral instruction of the sublime one.

original: 'di nyid mi gtsang ba med pa'o zhes pa mchog go //
analyzed: 'di nyid mi gtsang ba med pa'o zhes pa mchog go //
translated: This is the supreme one, “free from impurity.”

original: de ltar ni dz'a landha ri pa'i zhabs kyis rnam par bshad pa mdor bsdus pa rdo rje sgron ma las /
analyzed: de ltar ni dz'a landha ri pa'i zhabs kyis rnam par bshad pa mdor bsdus pa rdo rje sgron ma las /
translated: Thus, the venerable Jālandharipa explains in the Vajra Lamp, a summary commentary:

original: 'di ltar @98a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar @98a * //
translated: In this way,

original: gyur pa'i sngags pa mchog gi bsgrub pa las brtsams nas /🔽mkhas pa chos dbyings bdag nyid kyi //
analyzed: gyur pa'i sngags pa mchog gi bsgrub pa las brtsams nas / mkhas pa chos dbyings bdag nyid kyi //
translated: having begun the practice of the supreme mantra,🔽the wise one should meditate on the corpse

original: ro ni dang por bsgom par bya'o //🔽de yi steng du rnal 'byor pa //
analyzed: ro ni dang por bsgom par bya'o // de yi steng du rnal 'byor pa //
translated: that is the nature of the dharmadhātu.🔽The yogi/nī should meditate on Heruka

original: gnas nas he ru ka nyid bsgom //
analyzed: gnas nas he ru ka nyid bsgom //
translated: while abiding on top of that.

original: 'di'i don ni der gnas nas shr'i he ru ka badzra zhes pa'i yi ge drug gi don la mngon du phyogs par bya zhing /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni der gnas nas shr'i he ru ka badzra zhes pa'i yi ge drug gi don la mngon du phyogs par bya zhing /
translated: The meaning of this is that, having abided there, one should face the meaning of the six syllables of ŚRĪ HERUKA VAJRA.

original: de nas dam pa'i man ngag las //
analyzed: de nas dam pa'i man ngag las //
translated: Then, according to the precepts of the holy ones,

original: shr'i he ru ka zhes pa'i yi ge bzhi'i don ye shes kyi snang ba rdo rje'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rnal 'byor mngon par bsgom par bya zhes pa ni mchog go //
analyzed: shr'i he ru ka zhes pa'i yi ge bzhi'i don ye shes kyi snang ba rdo rje'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rnal 'byor mngon par bsgom par bya zhes pa ni mchog go //
translated: one should meditate on the yoga of the vajra-concentration of the appearance of intuition, which is the meaning of the four syllables of the name of Śrī Heruka.

original: de nas lhan cig skyes pa'i mgon por bzhengs par bsams te /
analyzed: de nas lhan cig skyes pa'i mgon por bzhengs par bsams te /
translated: Then, having imagined that one has arisen as the lord of the innate,

original: skad cig gis sangs rgyas kyi khang pa'i dbus su bam gyi yi ges brjod pa'i rdo rje sems dpa' dkar po zhi ba chen po ral pa'i cod pan can rdo rje'i skyil mo krung dang chos kyi phyag rgya dang ldan pa'i phyag gnyis pa /
analyzed: skad cig gis sangs rgyas kyi khang pa'i dbus su bam gyi yi ges brjod pa'i rdo rje sems dpa' dkar po zhi ba chen po ral pa'i cod pan can rdo rje'i skyil mo krung dang chos kyi phyag rgya dang ldan pa'i phyag gnyis pa /
translated: in an instant, in the center of the house of the Buddha, one should meditate on the innate Heruka, white Vajrasattva, who is expressed by the syllable BĀM, peaceful, with a crown of matted hair, in vajra posture, with two hands in the dharmacakra gesture,

original: mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis 'dzin zhing dpe byad brgyad cus rnam par spras /
analyzed: mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis 'dzin zhing dpe byad brgyad cus rnam par spras /
translated: holding the thirty-two marks, and adorned with the eighty minor marks.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i he ru ka rnam par bsgom mo //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i he ru ka rnam par bsgom mo //
translated: One should meditate on the innate Heruka.

original: de'i dkar po nyid la sogs pa'i gzugs su ci ltar rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de'i dkar po nyid la sogs pa'i gzugs su ci ltar rig par bya zhe na /
translated: How should one understand his whiteness, etc., and his form?

original: mtshams zhal sogs snga ma bzhin //
analyzed: mtshams zhal sogs snga ma bzhin //
translated: The corner faces, etc., are as before.

original: zla ba chu shel nor bu'i 'od //
analyzed: zla ba chu shel nor bu'i 'od //
translated: The light of the moon, water crystal gem,

original: ces le'u brgyad par gsungs pa las so //
analyzed: ces le'u brgyad par gsungs pa las so //
translated: as it is said in the eighth chapter.

original: sngon bzhin zhes pa ni /
analyzed: sngon bzhin zhes pa ni /
translated: As before means

original: ji ltar ma rig pa'i bag chags yongs su gyur pa las srab pa la sogs pa'i rnam par bskal pa dang po pa rnams kyi gzugs te /
analyzed: ji ltar ma rig pa'i bag chags yongs su gyur pa las srab pa la sogs pa'i rnam par bskal pa dang po pa rnams kyi gzugs te /
translated: just as form in the first eon of those who are subtle and so on is a transformation of the latent tendencies of ignorance,

original: de lta bu yin no zhes pa lhan cig skyes pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu yin no zhes pa lhan cig skyes pa'o //
translated: so it is, which is connate.

original: 'dir zla ba grags pa'i zhabs kyis rdo rje sems dpa' rdzogs pa'i mdor yang gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir zla ba grags pa'i zhabs kyis rdo rje sems dpa' rdzogs pa'i mdor yang gsungs te /
translated: Here, the glorious Candrakīrti also says in the Vajrasattva Sādhana:

original: stong pa nyid du mos pas tha mal pa'i lus kyi nga rgyal dor nas skad cig gis bdag nyid rdo rje 'chang chen po'i gzugs mdog dkar por mos par bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid du mos pas tha mal pa'i lus kyi nga rgyal dor nas skad cig gis bdag nyid rdo rje 'chang chen po'i gzugs mdog dkar por mos par bya'o //
translated: Having abandoned the pride of the ordinary body through devotion to emptiness, one should imagine oneself in an instant as white Vajradhara.

original: 'di'i mdo ni dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i le'u gsum pa las /🔽nam mkha'i dbyings kyi dbus bzhugs par //
analyzed: 'di'i mdo ni dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i le'u gsum pa las / nam mkha'i dbyings kyi dbus bzhugs par //
translated: The source for this is the third chapter of the glorious Guhyasamāja Tantra:🔽Meditate on the maṇḍala of the buddhas

original: sangs rgyas dkyil 'khor bsgom par bya //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dkyil 'khor bsgom par bya //
translated: residing in the middle of the realm of space.

original: 'od zer sprin gyi bkod pa che //
analyzed: 'od zer sprin gyi bkod pa che //
translated: The great array of clouds of light

original: sangs rgyas 'bar ba'i 'od dang mnyam //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'bar ba'i 'od dang mnyam //
translated: And equal to the blazing light of the Buddha.

original: zhes so // 'di nyid du yang bcom ldan 'das kyis le'u brgyad pa las gsungs te /🔽a'a li k'a li mnyam sbyor ba //
analyzed: zhes so // 'di nyid du yang bcom ldan 'das kyis le'u brgyad pa las gsungs te / a'a li k'a li mnyam sbyor ba //
translated: And in this very tantra, the Blessed One has taught in the eighth chapter:🔽The union of the vowels and consonants

original: rdo rje sems dpa' yi ni gdan//🔽@98b zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' yi ni gdan// @98b zhes pa'o //
translated: Is the seat of Vajrasattva.

original: 'dir 'di'i don brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir 'di'i don brjod par bya ste /
translated: Here, its meaning should be stated.

original: a'a li k'a li'i ni zla ba dang nyi ma ste gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag tu bla ma'i man ngag dang lung las kyang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: a'a li k'a li'i ni zla ba dang nyi ma ste gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag tu bla ma'i man ngag dang lung las kyang shes par bya'o //
translated: The vowels and consonants are the moon and sun, to be known from the guru's instructions and scriptures as the object and subject.

original: de dag gi mnyam par sbyor ba ni 'dres nas 'dzin pa ma rig pa zhes pa'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: de dag gi mnyam par sbyor ba ni 'dres nas 'dzin pa ma rig pa zhes pa'i tha tshig ste /
translated: Their union is their mixing, which is the meaning of grasping ignorance.

original: de med phyir na de yang med //
analyzed: de med phyir na de yang med //
translated: Because that does not exist, this also does not exist.

original: ces pa'i nus pa nyid las so //
analyzed: ces pa'i nus pa nyid las so //
translated: This is the power of the negation.

original: med par dgag pa'i 'jug pas thams cad stong pa nyid gdan te /
analyzed: med par dgag pa'i 'jug pas thams cad stong pa nyid gdan te /
translated: By the engagement of absolute negation, everything is emptiness, the seat.

original: gdan dang / gzhi dang / bskyed pa'i gnas so zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gdan dang / gzhi dang / bskyed pa'i gnas so zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is the seat, the basis, and the place of origination.

original: slar yang kye rdo rjer gsungs pa /
analyzed: slar yang kye rdo rjer gsungs pa /
translated: Again, it is taught in the Hevajra Tantra:

original: 'gyur med las byung sku yi ni //
analyzed: 'gyur med las byung sku yi ni //
translated: The body arises from the unchanging.

original: h'u% phat yi ge 'ang 'dod mi bya //
analyzed: h'u% phat yi ge 'ang 'dod mi bya //
translated: One should not desire the syllable HŪṀ PHAT.

original: zhes so // 'di'i don ni 'di yin te //
analyzed: zhes so // 'di'i don ni 'di yin te //
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:

original: 'gyur ba'i rnam par nyams pa ste //
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i rnam par nyams pa ste //
translated: The degeneration of the form of change,

original: 'gyur med ni rnam par nyams pa med pa thams cad stong pa mi gtsang ba'i lus med pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyur med ni rnam par nyams pa med pa thams cad stong pa mi gtsang ba'i lus med pa'o //
translated: the unchanging is the non-degeneration, the emptiness of all, the non-existence of the impure body.

original: de ltar na de las byung ba yang de yin la sku yang de yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na de las byung ba yang de yin la sku yang de yin te /
translated: Thus, it is that which arises from that, and it is the body.

original: de lta bu'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'o //
translated: It is like that.

original: 'od gsal ba las byung ba yi //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba las byung ba yi //
translated: Arisen from the clear light,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' de yi ni //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' de yi ni //
translated: that Vajrasattva,

original: h'u% phat yi ge'ang 'dod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: h'u% phat yi ge'ang 'dod par mi bya ste /
translated: one should not desire the syllable HŪṀ PHAT.

original: bdag gi phyir 'od gsal ba dor nas gzhan h'u% yig la sogs pa rnams ni rgyu nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag gi phyir 'od gsal ba dor nas gzhan h'u% yig la sogs pa rnams ni rgyu nyid ma yin no //
translated: Having abandoned the clear light for the sake of oneself, the other syllables HŪṀ and so forth are not the cause.

original: rdzogs pa'i gzugs nyid kyi phyir //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i gzugs nyid kyi phyir //
translated: Because of the complete form,

original: de'i ste bcom ldan 'das kyi'o zhes pa ni mngon par 'dod pa'i don to //
analyzed: de'i ste bcom ldan 'das kyi'o zhes pa ni mngon par 'dod pa'i don to //
translated: that of the Blessed One is the intended meaning.

original: slar yang dz'a landha ri pa'i zhabs kyis gsungs te /
analyzed: slar yang dz'a landha ri pa'i zhabs kyis gsungs te /
translated: Again, it is stated by the venerable Jālandhari:

original: a'a li k'a li mnyam sbyor ba ni rang bzhin med pa'i gnas mchog ste ro zhes pa'i don to mchog ni rdo rje sems dpa'i rdo rje gdan no //
analyzed: a'a li k'a li mnyam sbyor ba ni rang bzhin med pa'i gnas mchog ste ro zhes pa'i don to mchog ni rdo rje sems dpa'i rdo rje gdan no //
translated: The supreme is the vajra seat of Vajrasattva.

original: de ltar ni 'phags pa lha'i zhabs kyis /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'phags pa lha'i zhabs kyis /
translated: Thus, the Arya-Lali-ta-pada says:

original: sems ni rang las byung thim bya //
analyzed: sems ni rang las byung thim bya //
translated: The mind arises from itself and dissolves into itself.

original: sems byung ma rig pa la ste //
analyzed: sems byung ma rig pa la ste //
translated: The mind’s arising is ignorance.

original: de yang 'od gsal bar 'gro la //
analyzed: de yang 'od gsal bar 'gro la //
translated: That also goes into clear light.

original: srid pa gsum po 'dir 'gag go //
analyzed: srid pa gsum po 'dir 'gag go //
translated: Here, the three worlds cease.

original: 'od gsal ba las stong pa che //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba las stong pa che //
translated: From clear light, great emptiness.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa rgyas par ro //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa rgyas par ro //
translated: And so on extensively.

original: 'phags pa brgyad stong par yang gsungs te /🔽gang chos thams cad la nye bar dmigs pa med pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste de nyid sangs rgyas kyi /
analyzed: 'phags pa brgyad stong par yang gsungs te / gang chos thams cad la nye bar dmigs pa med pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste de nyid sangs rgyas kyi /
translated: The Arya-Astasahasrika also says:

original: skyed par byed pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa'o zhes so //
translated: That which is the non-apprehension of all dharmas is the perfection of wisdom, and that itself is the generator of the Buddhas.

original: 'dis ni mchog dang lhan cig skyes pa yang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni mchog dang lhan cig skyes pa yang bshad pa yin no //
translated: This also explains the supreme and the innate.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i phyogs la ni h'u% yig la sogs pa rnams kyang rgyud nyid de /
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i phyogs la ni h'u% yig la sogs pa rnams kyang rgyud nyid de /
translated: In the case of the stage of generation, the syllables such as HŪM and so on are the tantra itself.

original: h'u% gi yi ge gyur bltas nas //
analyzed: h'u% gi yi ge gyur bltas nas //
translated: and the syllable hūṃ, and then

original: zhe sdang bdag nyid rnam bsgom @99a * //
analyzed: zhe sdang bdag nyid rnam bsgom @99a * //
translated: contemplate the nature of hatred.

original: bya // zhes lha'i le'u las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya // zhes lha'i le'u las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is stated in the chapter on the deity.

original: 'dir bskyed pa'i rim pa la brten nas ji ltar rigs par rdzogs pa'i rim pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir bskyed pa'i rim pa la brten nas ji ltar rigs par rdzogs pa'i rim pa ste /
translated: Here, in dependence on the stage of generation, one should understand the stage of completion as appropriate.

original: de'i phyir som nyi mi bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir som nyi mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should not doubt this.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ni skal pa med pa'i sems can rnams la brten nas man ngag sbas pa'i don du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ni skal pa med pa'i sems can rnams la brten nas man ngag sbas pa'i don du bstan pa yin no //
translated: The Bhagavān taught for the purpose of concealing the instructions for those sentient beings who are not vessels.

original: sgra la sogs pa rnams kyi rnam pa gzhan du bstan pa las te 'di dang 'dis de go bar bya'o //
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa rnams kyi rnam pa gzhan du bstan pa las te 'di dang 'dis de go bar bya'o //
translated: [The instructions] are taught in another form, such as with the words, “This and this should be understood by that.”

original: shr'i he ru ka badzra zhes pa'i yi ge drug po 'di ni bam yig gis nges par bshad pa ste /
analyzed: shr'i he ru ka badzra zhes pa'i yi ge drug po 'di ni bam yig gis nges par bshad pa ste /
translated: The six syllables of Śrī Heruka Vajra are explained by the syllable vaṃ.

original: mchog las rdo rje sems dpa' lhan cig skyes pa he ru kar bshad do ;
analyzed: mchog las rdo rje sems dpa' lhan cig skyes pa he ru kar bshad do ;
translated: From the supreme, Vajrasattva is explained as the coemergent Heruka.

original: / de'i snying kar dzram yig ste /
analyzed: / de'i snying kar dzram yig ste /
translated: In his heart is the syllable jraṃ.

original: yi ge ra yongs su gyur pa las nyi ma'o //
analyzed: yi ge ra yongs su gyur pa las nyi ma'o //
translated: The syllable raṃ is completely transformed into the sun.

original: de'i zla phyed dang yi ge aa yongs su gyur pa las yongs su rdzogs pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: de'i zla phyed dang yi ge aa yongs su gyur pa las yongs su rdzogs pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor te /
translated: Its half-moon and the letter A transform into a complete moon disk.

original: de'i dbus su skye 'gro skye ba'i sa bon dza yig ni h'u% yig tu bsgyur bar bstan to //
analyzed: de'i dbus su skye 'gro skye ba'i sa bon dza yig ni h'u% yig tu bsgyur bar bstan to //
translated: In its center, the seed syllable of living beings, Ja, is taught to transform into the syllable Huṃ.

original: kha dog nag po 'jigs pa chen po bltas nas h'u% yongs su gyur pa las rdo rje'o //
analyzed: kha dog nag po 'jigs pa chen po bltas nas h'u% yongs su gyur pa las rdo rje'o //
translated: It is black in color and very frightening. Having seen it, the Huṃ transforms into a vajra.

original: de'i lte bar gnas pa'i h'um gi de kho na nyid bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i lte bar gnas pa'i h'um gi de kho na nyid bsgom par bya'o //
translated: In its center, one should meditate on the reality of the syllable Huṃ.

original: de'i rjes su nyi ma la sogs pa'i h'u% yongs su gyur pas zla ba'i gzugs brnyan tsam du bsgoms te /
analyzed: de'i rjes su nyi ma la sogs pa'i h'u% yongs su gyur pas zla ba'i gzugs brnyan tsam du bsgoms te /
translated: After that, the Huṃ on the sun and so forth transforms into a mere reflection of the moon.🔽Having seen it, one should meditate on the great fear of the vajra of hatred.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i man ngag gis /🔽de las rnam par spros pa'i zhe sdang rdo rje 'jigs pa chen po nam mkha' la bltas nas /
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i man ngag gis / de las rnam par spros pa'i zhe sdang rdo rje 'jigs pa chen po nam mkha' la bltas nas /
translated: By the esoteric instructions that will be explained,🔽one should emanate from that the great fear of the vajra of hatred.

original: de zhugs pa las rang gi 'dod pa'i lha'i gzugs su gnas par bya ste gtso bo'o //
analyzed: de zhugs pa las rang gi 'dod pa'i lha'i gzugs su gnas par bya ste gtso bo'o //
translated: Having seen it in the sky, one should transform it into the form of one’s chosen deity. That is the principal.

original: de ltar yang bzang po'i zhabs kyis kye rdo rje'i rgyud las phyung nas gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar yang bzang po'i zhabs kyis kye rdo rje'i rgyud las phyung nas gsungs te /
translated: Thus, Bhavyakīrti, having extracted it from the Hevajra Tantra, teaches:

original: rang gi snying gar re pha bsgom //
analyzed: rang gi snying gar re pha bsgom //
translated: Meditate on the letter RE in your heart.

original: de las byung ba'i nyi dkyil 'khor //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i nyi dkyil 'khor //
translated: From that, a sun mandala arises.

original: de nyid du ni h'u% nyid kyang //
analyzed: de nyid du ni h'u% nyid kyang //
translated: In that very place, the letter HŪṃ

original: thabs dang shes rab rang bzhin can //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab rang bzhin can //
translated: has the nature of method and wisdom.

original: kha dog nag po 'jigs chen po //
analyzed: kha dog nag po 'jigs chen po //
translated: It is black in color and very frightening.

original: h'u% yig las ni rdo rjer gyur //
analyzed: h'u% yig las ni rdo rjer gyur //
translated: From the letter HŪṃ, a vajra arises.

original: rdo rje lte ba'i dbus gnas par //
analyzed: rdo rje lte ba'i dbus gnas par //
translated: In the center of the vajra’s hub,

original: h'u% gi de nyid slar bsgom bya //
analyzed: h'u% gi de nyid slar bsgom bya //
translated: meditate on the letter HŪṃ.

original: 'di dag thams cad yongs su gyur pas man ngag ji lta bas zla ba'i gzugs brnyan bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad yongs su gyur pas man ngag ji lta bas zla ba'i gzugs brnyan bsgom par bya ste /
translated: Through the complete transformation of all of these, meditate on the reflection of the moon, just as in the esoteric instructions.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i man ngag gis //
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i man ngag gis //
translated: Through the esoteric instructions that will be explained,

original: de las spros nas steng du rdo rje can 'jigs pa chen po nam mkha' la bltas nas rab tu zhugs pas rang gi 'dod pa'i lha'i bdag nyid du gyur ces so //
analyzed: de las spros nas steng du rdo rje can 'jigs pa chen po nam mkha' la bltas nas rab tu zhugs pas rang gi 'dod pa'i lha'i bdag nyid du gyur ces so //
translated: having emanated from that, the vajra-holder, very frightening, looks into the sky and descends, becoming the nature of one’s chosen deity.

original: dz'a landha ri pa'i zhabs kyis kyang rtsa ba'i rgyud las phyung nas @99b gsungs te /
analyzed: dz'a landha ri pa'i zhabs kyis kyang rtsa ba'i rgyud las phyung nas @99b gsungs te /
translated: The venerable Jalandhari also extracted it from the Root Tantra:🔽“Meditate on the lord of the maṇḍala

original: sems dpa'i gzugs brnyan las byung ba'i //🔽dkyil 'khor dbang po bsgom par bya //
analyzed: sems dpa'i gzugs brnyan las byung ba'i // dkyil 'khor dbang po bsgom par bya //
translated: arisen from the reflection of the sattva.”

original: zhes so // zhes pa rang gi 'dod pa'i lha'o //
analyzed: zhes so // zhes pa rang gi 'dod pa'i lha'o //
translated: Thus, one’s desire deity.

original: de ltar zhal brgyad la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa chen po zhe sdang rdo rje bsgom par byas nas h'u% las byung ba'i 'bar ba'i phreng ba 'khrugs pa'i khro bo bcu po rnams shar la sogs pa'i phyogs thams cad du spro bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar zhal brgyad la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa chen po zhe sdang rdo rje bsgom par byas nas h'u% las byung ba'i 'bar ba'i phreng ba 'khrugs pa'i khro bo bcu po rnams shar la sogs pa'i phyogs thams cad du spro bar bya ste /
translated: Having meditated on the great fear of eight faces, and so on, of Hatred Vajra, one should emanate the ten wrathful ones, arisen from the syllable hūṃ, blazing with a garland of flames, in all directions, east, and so on.

original: de la shar du gshin rje mthar byed rnam par snang mdzad kyi dbu rgyan nag po chen po phyag na rdo rje tho ba'o //
analyzed: de la shar du gshin rje mthar byed rnam par snang mdzad kyi dbu rgyan nag po chen po phyag na rdo rje tho ba'o //
translated: In the east, Yamāntaka is crowned with Vairocana, and Mahābala holds a hammer.

original: lhor shes rab mthar byed rin chen 'byung ldan gyi dbu rgyan can dkar po chen po dbyug pa dkar po 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: lhor shes rab mthar byed rin chen 'byung ldan gyi dbu rgyan can dkar po chen po dbyug pa dkar po 'dzin pa'o //
translated: In the south, Prajñāntaka is crowned with Ratnasaṃbhava, and Mahābala holds a white club.

original: nub tu padma mthar byed 'od dpag med kyi dbu rgyan can dmar po chen po chu skyes dmar po 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: nub tu padma mthar byed 'od dpag med kyi dbu rgyan can dmar po chen po chu skyes dmar po 'dzin pa'o //
translated: In the west is Padmanateśvara, with a crown of Amitābha, red, holding a red lotus.

original: byang du bgegs mthar byed mi bskyod pa'i dbu rgyan can sngon po chen po kha gyes pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: byang du bgegs mthar byed mi bskyod pa'i dbu rgyan can sngon po chen po kha gyes pa'i rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: In the north is Vighnāntakṛt, with a crown of Akṣobhya, blue, holding a vajra with open prongs.

original: dbang ldan du mi g-yo ba nag po chen po ral gri 'dzin pa'o //🔽mer 'dod pa'i rgyal po nag po chen po rdo rje lcags kyu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: dbang ldan du mi g-yo ba nag po chen po ral gri 'dzin pa'o // mer 'dod pa'i rgyal po nag po chen po rdo rje lcags kyu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: In the northeast is Acalanātha, black, holding a sword.🔽In the southeast is Kāmarāja, black, holding a vajra hook.

original: bden bral du dbyug pa sngon po nag po chen po dbyug pa sngon po 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: bden bral du dbyug pa sngon po nag po chen po dbyug pa sngon po 'dzin pa'o //
translated: In the southwest is Nīladaṇḍa, black, holding a blue staff.

original: rlung du stobs chen po nag po chen po rtse gsum 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: rlung du stobs chen po nag po chen po rtse gsum 'dzin pa ste /
translated: In the northwest is Mahābala, black, holding a trident.

original: mi g-yo ba la sogs pa rnams ni mi bskyod pa'i dbu rgyan can no //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba la sogs pa rnams ni mi bskyod pa'i dbu rgyan can no //
translated: Acalanātha and so forth have crowns of Akṣobhya.

original: steng du gtsug tor 'khor los sgyur ba ser po bdag po rnam par snang mdzad de 'khor lo ser po 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: steng du gtsug tor 'khor los sgyur ba ser po bdag po rnam par snang mdzad de 'khor lo ser po 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Above is Uṣṇīṣa Cakravartin, yellow, with a crown of Vairocana, holding a yellow wheel.

original: 'og tu gnod mdzes rgyal po du ba'i mdog can thugs kyi dbang pos dbu brgyan pa gtun shing 'dzin pa 'jigs par byed pa bsam par bya ste /
analyzed: 'og tu gnod mdzes rgyal po du ba'i mdog can thugs kyi dbang pos dbu brgyan pa gtun shing 'dzin pa 'jigs par byed pa bsam par bya ste /
translated: One should imagine that below is the king of wrathful ones, Ucchuṣma, the color of smoke, with a mind-born head ornament, holding a pestle, terrifying.

original: khro bo rnams spyan gsum pa skra ser skya gyen du brdzes pa /
analyzed: khro bo rnams spyan gsum pa skra ser skya gyen du brdzes pa /
translated: The wrathful ones have three eyes, tawny hair bristling upward,

original: sna tshogs pa'i sprul gyis brgyan pa //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i sprul gyis brgyan pa //
translated: adorned with various snakes,

original: phyag gnyis pa /
analyzed: phyag gnyis pa /
translated: two arms,

original: zhal gcig pa /
analyzed: zhal gcig pa /
translated: one face,

original: thung zhing gsus khyim che ba /
analyzed: thung zhing gsus khyim che ba /
translated: short and with a large belly,

original: g-yon pa na sdigs mdzub dang bcas pa'i zhags pa 'dzin pa /
analyzed: g-yon pa na sdigs mdzub dang bcas pa'i zhags pa 'dzin pa /
translated: holding a lasso with a threatening forefinger in the left hand,

original: rnam par 'gyur ba'i zhal can bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba'i zhal can bsam par bya'o //
translated: with a contorted face.

original: 'on kyang 'dod pa can dang / mi g-yo ba ni rol pa ste lha'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dod pa can dang / mi g-yo ba ni rol pa ste lha'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa'o //
translated: However, the desire and immovable [wrathful ones] are playful, adorned with divine ornaments.

original: slar thams cad sna tshogs padma dang nyi ma la g-yon brgyad pa'i stabs kyis gnas par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: slar thams cad sna tshogs padma dang nyi ma la g-yon brgyad pa'i stabs kyis gnas par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Again, all of them should be seen standing on variegated lotuses and suns in the ālīḍha posture.

original: de ltar khro bo'i rgyal po bcu po rnams mtshungs par rang rang gi gnas su sprul pa'i bdag @100a * //
analyzed: de ltar khro bo'i rgyal po bcu po rnams mtshungs par rang rang gi gnas su sprul pa'i bdag @100a * //
translated: Thus, the ten kings of wrathful ones are equal, emanated in their own places, with their own retinues.

original: nyid gshin rje mthar byed la sogs pa'i khro bo bcu'i gzugs su bkod nas mngon du phyogs par gyur pas thal mo sbyor ba byas nas rkang pa brgyad pa dang snying po dang nye ba'i sngags kyis sngon du gtad de //🔽bdag cag rnams kyis ci zhig bgyi //
analyzed: nyid gshin rje mthar byed la sogs pa'i khro bo bcu'i gzugs su bkod nas mngon du phyogs par gyur pas thal mo sbyor ba byas nas rkang pa brgyad pa dang snying po dang nye ba'i sngags kyis sngon du gtad de // bdag cag rnams kyis ci zhig bgyi //
translated: Having arranged himself in the form of the ten wrathful ones such as Yamântaka, he should face them, and having joined his palms, he should offer them the eight-line praise, the essence mantra, and the near essence mantra.

original: zhes smra ba blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes smra ba blta bar bya'o //
translated: They should be seen to say, What should we do?

original: de nas zhi ba la sogs pa'i las kyi dbye bas bka' sbyin te /🔽aom sumbha ni sumbha h'u%/🔽grihna grihna h'u%/ grihn'a pa ya grihn'a pa ya h'u%/
analyzed: de nas zhi ba la sogs pa'i las kyi dbye bas bka' sbyin te / aom sumbha ni sumbha h'u%/ grihna grihna h'u%/ grihn'a pa ya grihn'a pa ya h'u%/
translated: Then, by the division of the rites of pacification and so forth, he should give the command.

original: a'a na ya ho:bha ga w'ana bady'i r'a dza h'u% phat ces mkha' 'gro ma rdo rje gur las gsungs pa'i sngags kyis bka' sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: a'a na ya ho:bha ga w'ana bady'i r'a dza h'u% phat ces mkha' 'gro ma rdo rje gur las gsungs pa'i sngags kyis bka' sbyin par bya'o //
translated: With the mantra taught in the Vajrapañjara Tantra, Oṃ, sumbha nisumbha hūṃ / gṛhṇa gṛhṇa hūṃ / gṛhṇāpaya gṛhṇāpaya hūṃ / ānayaho bhagavān vidyārāja hūṃ phaṭ, he should give the command.

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa'i bka' yang dag bzung nas de dang der rang nyid song ste /
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa'i bka' yang dag bzung nas de dang der rang nyid song ste /
translated: Having taken the true command of the vajra holder, he should go there and there.

original: dbang po la sogs pa'i bgegs kyi tshogs rnams mgrin pa rdo rje'i zhags pas bcings shing rang rang gi mtshon cha rnams kyis skrag bzhin du bzung nas phyogs bcu'i sprul pa rnams la gtad de rdo rje 'dzin pa la mngon du phyogs nas gnas par blta'o //
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa'i bgegs kyi tshogs rnams mgrin pa rdo rje'i zhags pas bcings shing rang rang gi mtshon cha rnams kyis skrag bzhin du bzung nas phyogs bcu'i sprul pa rnams la gtad de rdo rje 'dzin pa la mngon du phyogs nas gnas par blta'o //
translated: One should see them standing facing Vajradhara.

original: de la bgegs kyi tshogs 'di rnams ni dbang po dkar pos srung dkar po la zhon pa /
analyzed: de la bgegs kyi tshogs 'di rnams ni dbang po dkar pos srung dkar po la zhon pa /
translated: Among them, the host of obstructors is Indra, who is white and rides a white elephant.

original: mig stong pa lus mdzes pa rin po che'i cod pan no //
analyzed: mig stong pa lus mdzes pa rin po che'i cod pan no //
translated: He has a thousand eyes, a beautiful body, and a jeweled crown.

original: gshin rje nag po ma he la zhon pa skra ser skye gyen du rjes pa thung zhing gsus khyim che ba'o//
analyzed: gshin rje nag po ma he la zhon pa skra ser skye gyen du rjes pa thung zhing gsus khyim che ba'o//
translated: Yama is black, rides a water buffalo, has tawny hair bristling upward, and is short with a large belly.

original: chu lha dkar po nam mkha'i mdog can gyis rus sbal la zhon pa lus mdzes shing mgo bor gdengs ka dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: chu lha dkar po nam mkha'i mdog can gyis rus sbal la zhon pa lus mdzes shing mgo bor gdengs ka dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Varuna is white, the color of the sky, rides a turtle, has a beautiful body, and has a hood on his head.

original: lus ngan ser po mi la zhon pa lus mdzes pa rin po che'i cod pan can no //
analyzed: lus ngan ser po mi la zhon pa lus mdzes pa rin po che'i cod pan can no //
translated: Kubera is yellow, rides a man, has a beautiful body, and has a jeweled crown.

original: dbang ldan dkar po glang la zhon pa ral pa'i cod pan can thung zhing gsus pa che ba'o //
analyzed: dbang ldan dkar po glang la zhon pa ral pa'i cod pan can thung zhing gsus pa che ba'o //
translated: Indra is white, mounted on an elephant, with a topknot of hair, short, and with a large belly.

original: me lha dmar po ra la gnas pa mgo bor ral pa'i cod pan can lus thung pa'o //
analyzed: me lha dmar po ra la gnas pa mgo bor ral pa'i cod pan can lus thung pa'o //
translated: The fire god is red, mounted on a ram, with a topknot of hair on his head, and his body is short.

original: srin po du ba'i mdog can ro la gnas shing skra grol ba thung ba'o //
analyzed: srin po du ba'i mdog can ro la gnas shing skra grol ba thung ba'o //
translated: The rakshasa is the color of smoke, mounted on a corpse, with loose hair, and short.

original: rlung lha sngo bsangs kha sha ser po la gnas pa rin po che'i cod pan can lus mdzes pa'o //
analyzed: rlung lha sngo bsangs kha sha ser po la gnas pa rin po che'i cod pan can lus mdzes pa'o //
translated: The wind god is pale blue, mounted on a yellow antelope, with a jeweled topknot, and his body is beautiful.

original: steng du mes po ser po dad pa la zhon pa ral pa'i cod pan can thung zhing gsus khyim che ba'o //
analyzed: steng du mes po ser po dad pa la zhon pa ral pa'i cod pan can thung zhing gsus khyim che ba'o //
translated: Above is the grandfather, yellow, mounted on a bull, with a topknot of hair, short, and with a large belly.

original: 'og tu sa'i lha mo ser mo 'dam skyes la gnas pa lus mdzes ma rin po che'i cod pan can no //
analyzed: 'og tu sa'i lha mo ser mo 'dam skyes la gnas pa lus mdzes ma rin po che'i cod pan can no //
translated: Below is the earth goddess, yellow, mounted on a lotus, with a beautiful body and a jeweled topknot.

original: bgegs 'di rnams ni gshin rje la sogs pa rnams kyis bzung ba las bred sha 'thon te @100b gzhan du skyabs tshol bar blta'o //
analyzed: bgegs 'di rnams ni gshin rje la sogs pa rnams kyis bzung ba las bred sha 'thon te @100b gzhan du skyabs tshol bar blta'o //
translated: These obstructors should be seen as terrified and seeking refuge elsewhere due to being seized by Yama and so forth.

original: de'i rjes su rang gi snying ga'i sa bon las khro bo smad mdung gi rnam pa sku mdog nag po 'jigs pa chen po 'jig dus kyi me ltar bzod par dka' ba stod bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i rnam pa can spros te bgegs kyi tshogs kyi mgo bor bsams
analyzed: de'i rjes su rang gi snying ga'i sa bon las khro bo smad mdung gi rnam pa sku mdog nag po 'jigs pa chen po 'jig dus kyi me ltar bzod par dka' ba stod bdud rtsi 'khyil pa'i rnam pa can spros te bgegs kyi tshogs kyi mgo bor bsams
translated: After that, one should emanate from the seed syllable at one's heart a wrathful one in the form of a lower-pointed dagger, black in color, very frightening, like the fire at the time of the destruction of the world, difficult to bear, the upper part in the form of Amṛtakuṇḍali, and imagine it at the head of the host of obstructors.

original: nas bka' bsgos pa las /
analyzed: nas bka' bsgos pa las /
translated: Having given the command,🔽one should drive in the dagger with the mantra:

original: aom gha gha /
analyzed: aom gha gha /
translated: oṃ gha gha /

original: gh'a ta ya gh'a ta ya sarba dusht'an /
analyzed: gh'a ta ya gh'a ta ya sarba dusht'an /
translated: ghātaya ghātaya sarvaduṣṭān /

original: k'i la ya k'i la ya /
analyzed: k'i la ya k'i la ya /
translated: kilāya kilāya /

original: sarba p'a pam /
analyzed: sarba p'a pam /
translated: sarvapāpān /

original: h'u% h'u% badzra k'i la badzra dha ro da aa dzny'a pa ya ti /🔽sarba dusht'am bighn'am k'a ya w'a ga tsitta badzra k'i la ya h'u% h'u% phat phat ces pa'i sngags kyis phur bu gdab po //
analyzed: h'u% h'u% badzra k'i la badzra dha ro da aa dzny'a pa ya ti / sarba dusht'am bighn'am k'a ya w'a ga tsitta badzra k'i la ya h'u% h'u% phat phat ces pa'i sngags kyis phur bu gdab po //
translated: hūṃ hūṃ vajrakīla vajradhara ojāpāyaya sarvaduṣṭavighnān kāyavākcittavajrakīलय hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ phaṭ.

original: de'i rjes su khro bo thams cad kyi bdag nyid kyi mtshan ma yongs su gyur pa'i rdo rje tho bas brdung ngo //
analyzed: de'i rjes su khro bo thams cad kyi bdag nyid kyi mtshan ma yongs su gyur pa'i rdo rje tho bas brdung ngo //
translated: After that, one should strike with a vajra hammer, which is the transformation of the sign of the nature of all wrathful ones.

original: aom badzra mungga ra badzra k'i la ya aa ko ta ya ko ta ya h'u% phat ces pa brdung ba'i sngags te /
analyzed: aom badzra mungga ra badzra k'i la ya aa ko ta ya ko ta ya h'u% phat ces pa brdung ba'i sngags te /
translated: Oṃ vajra-muṃ-kāra vajra-kālaya akoda-yâkaoda-ya hūṃ phaṭ is the mantra for striking.

original: sngags 'dis phur bu 'di ji srid 'dzin pa'i mthil du son par gyur par gdab pa ste phur bu'o //
analyzed: sngags 'dis phur bu 'di ji srid 'dzin pa'i mthil du son par gyur par gdab pa ste phur bu'o //
translated: With this mantra, one should strike the kīla as long as it reaches the palm of the holder.

original: de nas rang rang gi sprul pa rnams kyis lhan cig tu khro bo spros pa'i me rnams kyis bgegs 'khor dang bcas pa bsregs te /
analyzed: de nas rang rang gi sprul pa rnams kyis lhan cig tu khro bo spros pa'i me rnams kyis bgegs 'khor dang bcas pa bsregs te /
translated: Then, together with their emanations, the wrathful ones burn the obstructors and their retinue with the fire of wrath.

original: lhag ma med par byas par blta'o //
analyzed: lhag ma med par byas par blta'o //
translated: One should view them as being incinerated without remainder.

original: de ltar brdungs nas lhag ma med par byas te bgegs med par gyur pa'i phyi nas /
analyzed: de ltar brdungs nas lhag ma med par byas te bgegs med par gyur pa'i phyi nas /
translated: Having struck in that way, one should view them as being incinerated without remainder and as being free of obstructors.

original: sngon du re phas nyi ma rnam bsgoms nas /
analyzed: sngon du re phas nyi ma rnam bsgoms nas /
translated: After that, one should visualize a sun with a ray in front.

original: nyi der h'u% byung sna tshogs rdo rje che //
analyzed: nyi der h'u% byung sna tshogs rdo rje che //
translated: From that sun, a hūṃ arises, which becomes a great vajra cross.

original: rdo rje de nyid kyis ni ra ba dang // gur bcing ba yang rnam par bsgom par bya //
analyzed: rdo rje de nyid kyis ni ra ba dang // gur bcing ba yang rnam par bsgom par bya //
translated: With that vajra cross, one should visualize a fence, a tent, and a binding.

original: 'dir yang na h'u% yig gis rdo rje mda' dang / dra ba dang / rdo rje'i bla re dang / rdo rje'i rang bzhin gyi sa gzhi yang ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang na h'u% yig gis rdo rje mda' dang / dra ba dang / rdo rje'i bla re dang / rdo rje'i rang bzhin gyi sa gzhi yang ste /
translated: Here also, with the syllable NAMAḤ, one should imagine the vajra-arrow, the net, the vajra-canopy, and the vajra-nature of the ground,🔽reaching down to the bottom of the ocean-perimeter.

original: rgya mtsho'i mtshams kyi mthil la thug par bsam par bya'o zhes pa srung ba'i 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: rgya mtsho'i mtshams kyi mthil la thug par bsam par bya'o zhes pa srung ba'i 'khor lo'o //
translated: This is the protection wheel.

original: de nas 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rim gyis //🔽gang phyir yid kyis mi bsgom par //
analyzed: de nas 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rim gyis // gang phyir yid kyis mi bsgom par //
translated: Then, by the process to be explained,

original: 'gro ba thams cad bsgom par bya //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pas bsrung ba chen po stong pa nyid rnam par bsgoms nas aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a w'atma ko& ham /
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad bsgom par bya // zhes bya ba la sogs pas bsrung ba chen po stong pa nyid rnam par bsgoms nas aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a w'atma ko& ham /
translated: one should meditate on all beings,🔽without mentally meditating on them.

original: zhes pa dngos po ma lus pa'i snying po bsdus pa'i sngags brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa dngos po ma lus pa'i snying po bsdus pa'i sngags brjod par bya'o //
translated: Here, one should recite the mantra that collects the essence of all things,🔽Oṃ śūnyatā-jñāna-vajra-svabhāvātmako ’haṃ.

original: de nas srung ba'i 'khor lo dang / khams gsum po dang / ra ba la sogs pa snang ba med par bsgom de'i dbus su nam mkha' khyab pa'i shes rab @101a * //
analyzed: de nas srung ba'i 'khor lo dang / khams gsum po dang / ra ba la sogs pa snang ba med par bsgom de'i dbus su nam mkha' khyab pa'i shes rab @101a * //
translated: Then, one should meditate on the protection wheel, the three realms, the walls, and so on, as devoid of appearance. In the middle of that, one should meditate on the syllable A, the nature of wind,

original: ae yig gi rnam pa can dkar po bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: ae yig gi rnam pa can dkar po bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on the white form of the letter E.

original: de'i dbus su sna tshogs rdo rje'i stegs bu'i dbus su ya% yig las skyes pa'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor sngo po zla ba phyed pa'i rnam pa //
analyzed: de'i dbus su sna tshogs rdo rje'i stegs bu'i dbus su ya% yig las skyes pa'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor sngo po zla ba phyed pa'i rnam pa //
translated: In its center, on a platform of a crossed vajra, from the letter YA arises a blue wind mandala in the shape of a half-moon.

original: de nas ra% yig las skyes pa'i me'i dkyil 'khor dmar po gru gsum pa //
analyzed: de nas ra% yig las skyes pa'i me'i dkyil 'khor dmar po gru gsum pa //
translated: Then, from the letter RA arises a red fire mandala in the shape of a triangle.

original: de nas bam yig las skyes pa'i chu'i dkyil 'khor dkar po zlum po //
analyzed: de nas bam yig las skyes pa'i chu'i dkyil 'khor dkar po zlum po //
translated: Then, from the letter VA arises a white water mandala in the shape of a circle.

original: de'i steng du lam yig las skyes pa'i sa'i dkyil 'khor ser po gru bzhi pa //
analyzed: de'i steng du lam yig las skyes pa'i sa'i dkyil 'khor ser po gru bzhi pa //
translated: Upon that, from the letter LAM arises a yellow earth mandala in the shape of a square.

original: de'i dbus su 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rig par byas nas 'byung ba chen po'i dkyil 'khor de thams cad yongs su gyur pa las skad cig gis khang pa brtsegs pa dur khrod brgyad kyis brgyan pa bsam par bya ste /🔽de la go rims ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: de'i dbus su 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rig par byas nas 'byung ba chen po'i dkyil 'khor de thams cad yongs su gyur pa las skad cig gis khang pa brtsegs pa dur khrod brgyad kyis brgyan pa bsam par bya ste /🔽de la go rims ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: Having understood that the consciousness entering there is the all-base consciousness, one should imagine that all those mandalas of the great elements transform instantly into a multistoried palace adorned with eight charnel grounds.🔽In that palace, in the center of the earth mandala, is the letter A.

original: shing dang / gnod sbyin dang / phyogs skyong dang / klu dang / sprin dang / ri dang / mchod rten dang ldan pa'i dur khrod brgyad bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: shing dang / gnod sbyin dang / phyogs skyong dang / klu dang / sprin dang / ri dang / mchod rten dang ldan pa'i dur khrod brgyad bshad par bya ste /
translated: The eight charnel grounds are explained as being endowed with trees, yakshas, directional guardians, nagas, clouds, mountains, and stupas.

original: shar du gtum drag ces bya ba'i dur khrod do //
analyzed: shar du gtum drag ces bya ba'i dur khrod do //
translated: In the east is the charnel ground called Caityaka.

original: der shing shi ri sha dang / gnod sbyin glang po'i gdong dkar po dang / phyogs skyong brgya byin dkar po dang / klu nor rgyas ser po dang / sprin sgrogs pa zhes bya ba kha dog sna tshogs pa dang / ri rab gru bzhi pa rin po che'i rang bzhin dang /
analyzed: der shing shi ri sha dang / gnod sbyin glang po'i gdong dkar po dang / phyogs skyong brgya byin dkar po dang / klu nor rgyas ser po dang / sprin sgrogs pa zhes bya ba kha dog sna tshogs pa dang / ri rab gru bzhi pa rin po che'i rang bzhin dang /
translated: There are the shirisha tree, the white elephant yaksha, the white directional guardian Indra, the yellow naga Vaisravana, the cloud called Roaring, which is multicolored, the square Meru mountain, which is made of jewels,

original: mchod rten dkar po rdo rje zhes bya ba gnas so //
analyzed: mchod rten dkar po rdo rje zhes bya ba gnas so //
translated: and the white stupa called Vajra.

original: lhor lhag ma zhes bya ba'i dur khrod chen po'o //
analyzed: lhor lhag ma zhes bya ba'i dur khrod chen po'o //
translated: In the south is the great charnel ground called Remainder.

original: der shing tsu ta dang / gnod sbyin ma he'i gdong pa can nag po dang / phyogs skyong gshin rje nag po dang / klu padma dkar po dang / sprin 'khyil ba kha dog sna tshogs pa dang / ri ma la ya dkar po dang /
analyzed: der shing tsu ta dang / gnod sbyin ma he'i gdong pa can nag po dang / phyogs skyong gshin rje nag po dang / klu padma dkar po dang / sprin 'khyil ba kha dog sna tshogs pa dang / ri ma la ya dkar po dang /
translated: There are the following features: the tree is the cuta, the yakṣa is black and has the face of a buffalo, the directional guardian is black and is Yama, the nāga is white and is Padma, the cloud is multicolored and is a swirling mass, the mountain is white and is Malaya,

original: mchod rten nag po rdo rje zhes bya ba gnas so //
analyzed: mchod rten nag po rdo rje zhes bya ba gnas so //
translated: and the stūpa is black and is called Vajra.

original: nub tu 'bar zhing 'khrugs pa zhes bya ba'i dur khrod chen po'o //
analyzed: nub tu 'bar zhing 'khrugs pa zhes bya ba'i dur khrod chen po'o //
translated: In the west is the great charnel ground called Blazing and Roiling.

original: der shing mya ngan med dang / gnod sbyin chu srin gyi gdong pa can dkar po dang / phyogs skyong chu lha dkar po dang / klu karko ta dmar po dang / sprin 'jigs pa zhes bya ba kha dog sna tshogs pa dang / ri kee la sha dkar po dang /
analyzed: der shing mya ngan med dang / gnod sbyin chu srin gyi gdong pa can dkar po dang / phyogs skyong chu lha dkar po dang / klu karko ta dmar po dang / sprin 'jigs pa zhes bya ba kha dog sna tshogs pa dang / ri kee la sha dkar po dang /
translated: There are the following features: the tree is the aśoka, the yakṣa is white and has the face of a crocodile, the directional guardian is white and is Varuṇa, the nāga is red and is Kārtṛka, the cloud is multicolored and is called “frightening,” the mountain is white and is Kailash,

original: mchod rten dkar po chags pa'i rdo rje zhes bya ba gnas so //
analyzed: mchod rten dkar po chags pa'i rdo rje zhes bya ba gnas so //
translated: and the stūpa is white and is called Vajra of Passion.

original: byang du ri bo'i phug ces bya ba'i dur khrod chen po'o //
analyzed: byang du ri bo'i phug ces bya ba'i dur khrod chen po'o //
translated: In the north is the great charnel ground called Cave of the Mountain.

original: der shing aa shvattha dang / gnod sbyin mi'i gdong pa can dkar po dang / phyogs skyong lus ngan ser po dang / klu @101b 'jog po nag po dang / sprin 'ur 'ur sgrogs pa kha dog sna tshogs pa dang / ri manda ra ljang ru dang /
analyzed: der shing aa shvattha dang / gnod sbyin mi'i gdong pa can dkar po dang / phyogs skyong lus ngan ser po dang / klu @101b 'jog po nag po dang / sprin 'ur 'ur sgrogs pa kha dog sna tshogs pa dang / ri manda ra ljang ru dang /
translated: There are the trees aśvattha, the white yakṣa with a human face, the yellow Vaiśravaṇa, the black Nāga Takṣaka, the multicolored cloud that roars, and the green Mandara mountain.

original: mchod rten dkar po 'du byed rdo rje zhes bya ba gnas so //
analyzed: mchod rten dkar po 'du byed rdo rje zhes bya ba gnas so //
translated: The white stūpa called “Karma Vajra” is located there.

original: dbang ldan du dpal mo'i nags zhes bya ba'i dur khrod chen po'o //
analyzed: dbang ldan du dpal mo'i nags zhes bya ba'i dur khrod chen po'o //
translated: In the northeast is the great charnel ground called “Śrīmatī Forest.”

original: der shing n+ya gro dha dang / gnod sbyin pa glang gi gdong pa can dkar po dang / phyogs skyong dbang phyug chen po dkar po dang / klu dung skyong zhes pa ser po dang / sprin gtum po zhes bya ba kha dog sna tshogs pa dang /
analyzed: der shing n+ya gro dha dang / gnod sbyin pa glang gi gdong pa can dkar po dang / phyogs skyong dbang phyug chen po dkar po dang / klu dung skyong zhes pa ser po dang / sprin gtum po zhes bya ba kha dog sna tshogs pa dang /
translated: There are the trees nyagrodha, the white yakṣa with an elephant face, the white Maheśvara, the yellow Nāga Takṣaka, the multicolored cloud called “violent,”

original: ri dbang chen nag po dang / mchod rten dkar po thugs rdo rje zhes bya ba gnas so //
analyzed: ri dbang chen nag po dang / mchod rten dkar po thugs rdo rje zhes bya ba gnas so //
translated: the black Mahendra mountain, and the white stūpa called “Mind Vajra.”

original: mer drag tu dgod pa zhes bya ba'i dur khrod chen po'o //
analyzed: mer drag tu dgod pa zhes bya ba'i dur khrod chen po'o //
translated: The great charnel ground is called Laughing with Fierce Fire.

original: der shing ka ra nydza ka dang / gnod sbyin ra'i gdong pa can dmar po dang // phyogs skyong me lha dmar po dang / klu padma chen po sngo bsangs dang / sprin stag po zhes bya ba kha dog sna tshogs pa dang / ri spos ngad ldan pa ser po dang /
analyzed: der shing ka ra nydza ka dang / gnod sbyin ra'i gdong pa can dmar po dang // phyogs skyong me lha dmar po dang / klu padma chen po sngo bsangs dang / sprin stag po zhes bya ba kha dog sna tshogs pa dang / ri spos ngad ldan pa ser po dang /
translated: There are the trees karṇajātaka, the red yakṣa with a bear's face, the red directional guardian Agni, the dark blue nāga Mahāpadma, the cloud called Tiger, of various colors, and the yellow mountain Gandhamādana.

original: mchod rten dmar po sku rdo rje zhes bya ba gnas so //
analyzed: mchod rten dmar po sku rdo rje zhes bya ba gnas so //
translated: The red stūpa called Kāyavajra is located there.

original: bden bral du 'jigs pa'i mun pa zhes bya ba'i dur khrod chen po'o //
analyzed: bden bral du 'jigs pa'i mun pa zhes bya ba'i dur khrod chen po'o //
translated: In the southwest is the great charnel ground called Terrifying Darkness.

original: der shing la t'a parka ti dang / gnod sbyin nag po dom gyi gdong pa can dang / phyogs skyong srin po nag po dang / klu mtha' yas zhes bya ba dkar po dang // sprin gang ba can zhes bya ba kha dog sna tshogs pa dang /
analyzed: der shing la t'a parka ti dang / gnod sbyin nag po dom gyi gdong pa can dang / phyogs skyong srin po nag po dang / klu mtha' yas zhes bya ba dkar po dang // sprin gang ba can zhes bya ba kha dog sna tshogs pa dang /
translated: There are the trees lābuparaktaka, the black yakṣa with a bear's face, the black directional guardian Rākṣasa, the white nāga called Ananta, and the cloud called Filled, of various colors.

original: ri gser zhes bya ba dang / mchod rten dkar po rin chen rdo rje zhes bya ba gnas so //
analyzed: ri gser zhes bya ba dang / mchod rten dkar po rin chen rdo rje zhes bya ba gnas so //
translated: The mountain called Gold and the white stupa called Jewel Vajra are located there.

original: rlung du k'i li k'i li sgrogs pa'i dur khrod chen po'o //
analyzed: rlung du k'i li k'i li sgrogs pa'i dur khrod chen po'o //
translated: In the wind direction is the great charnel ground called Kilikili Proclamation.

original: der shing aa rdzun dang / gnod sbyin ljang gu ri dags kyi gdong ba can zhes bya ba dang / phyogs skyong rlung lha sngo bsangs dang / klu rigs ldan khro bo dang / sprin char 'bebs zhes bya ba kha dog sna tshogs pa dang /
analyzed: der shing aa rdzun dang / gnod sbyin ljang gu ri dags kyi gdong ba can zhes bya ba dang / phyogs skyong rlung lha sngo bsangs dang / klu rigs ldan khro bo dang / sprin char 'bebs zhes bya ba kha dog sna tshogs pa dang /
translated: There are the trees arjuna and the yaksha called Green-faced Deer, the blue wind god who protects the directions, the naga called Angry Kalaya, and the cloud called Rain-maker, all of various colors.

original: ri dpal gyi ri zhes bya ba sngon po dang / mchod rten ljang gu chos kyi rdo rje zhes bya ba gnas so //
analyzed: ri dpal gyi ri zhes bya ba sngon po dang / mchod rten ljang gu chos kyi rdo rje zhes bya ba gnas so //
translated: The mountain called Glory Mountain is blue, and the green stupa called Dharma Vajra is located there.

original: gnod sbyin 'di rnams ni rdzu 'phrul chen po can zhal gcig pa phyag gcig phyag gnyis pa shing las lus phyed 'thon pa dag ste /
analyzed: gnod sbyin 'di rnams ni rdzu 'phrul chen po can zhal gcig pa phyag gcig phyag gnyis pa shing las lus phyed 'thon pa dag ste /

original: phyag g-yon pa rnams na khrag gis yongs su gang ba'i mi'i thod pa 'dzin zhing g-yas pa'i phyag gi padmas ro sna tshogs pa 'dzin pa'i rnam par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: phyag g-yon pa rnams na khrag gis yongs su gang ba'i mi'i thod pa 'dzin zhing g-yas pa'i phyag gi padmas ro sna tshogs pa 'dzin pa'i rnam par bsam par bya'o //
translated: In the left hands one should imagine that they hold human skulls filled with blood and that with the lotus in the right hand they hold various corpses.

original: 'di rnams ni rtsva ljang gu dang / shing sna tshogs pa stug po dang / myu gu dang / 'dab ma dang / @102a * //
analyzed: 'di rnams ni rtsva ljang gu dang / shing sna tshogs pa stug po dang / myu gu dang / 'dab ma dang / @102a * //
