translated: and flowers.🔽They are beautified by various flocks of birds such as crows, peacocks, owls, parrots, shrikes, cuckoos, and vultures.

original: seng ge dang / spyang ki dang / stag dang / dom dang / phag la sogs pa'i ri dags sna tshogs pas yongs su gang ba /
analyzed: seng ge dang / spyang ki dang / stag dang / dom dang / phag la sogs pa'i ri dags sna tshogs pas yongs su gang ba /
translated: They are filled with various animals such as lions, wolves, tigers, bears, and boars.

original: dri bzang po can gyi me tog sna tshogs pa'i dri zhim pos 'khrigs par byas pa /
analyzed: dri bzang po can gyi me tog sna tshogs pa'i dri zhim pos 'khrigs par byas pa /
translated: They are filled with the sweet fragrance of various fragrant flowers.

original: sprul pa sna tshogs pa'i lang long gis 'jigs par byed pa /
analyzed: sprul pa sna tshogs pa'i lang long gis 'jigs par byed pa /
translated: It is terrifying with the commotion of various emanations.🔽It is adorned with various places, such as bones, heads, skeletons, skulls, corpses, and so on.

original: rus pa dang / mgo bo dang / keng rus dang / thod pa dang / ro la sogs pa rnams kyis gnas sna tshogs pa'i yul so sor brgyan zhing slar yang yul so so rnams su lha khang dang / gtsug lag khang dang / bsam gtan gyi khang pa dang /
analyzed: rus pa dang / mgo bo dang / keng rus dang / thod pa dang / ro la sogs pa rnams kyis gnas sna tshogs pa'i yul so sor brgyan zhing slar yang yul so so rnams su lha khang dang / gtsug lag khang dang / bsam gtan gyi khang pa dang /
translated: Moreover, the individual places are adorned with temples, monasteries, meditation huts,

original: rdzing bu rnams kyis nye bar brgyan pa //
analyzed: rdzing bu rnams kyis nye bar brgyan pa //
translated: and ponds.

original: dam tshig gis brda dang ldan pa'i sems kyis tshogs pa'i aa ba dh'u t'i dang / aa wa dh'u t'i mo dang / bsam gtam pa dang / bsam gtan ma dang / gnod sbyin dang / gnod sbyin mo dang / yi dags dang / yi dags mo dang /
analyzed: dam tshig gis brda dang ldan pa'i sems kyis tshogs pa'i aa ba dh'u t'i dang / aa wa dh'u t'i mo dang / bsam gtam pa dang / bsam gtan ma dang / gnod sbyin dang / gnod sbyin mo dang / yi dags dang / yi dags mo dang /
translated: The mind that possesses the symbolic gesture of samaya is the assembly of the avadhūti men and avadhūti women, the meditators and meditator women, the yakṣa and yakṣiṇī, the pretas and pretīs,🔽and the piśāca and piśācī.

original: srin po dang / srin mo dang / grul bum dang / grul bum mo dang / 'byung po dang / 'byung mo dang / mkha' 'gro dang ; mkha' 'gro ma dang / dpa' bo dang / dpa' mo dang ldan pa /
analyzed: srin po dang / srin mo dang / grul bum dang / grul bum mo dang / 'byung po dang / 'byung mo dang / mkha' 'gro dang ; mkha' 'gro ma dang / dpa' bo dang / dpa' mo dang ldan pa /
translated: It is filled with the assembly of ḍākas and ḍākinīs, such as the rākṣasas and rākṣasīs, the kumbhāṇḍas and kumbhāṇḍīs, the bhūtas and bhūtīs, the ḍākas and ḍākinīs, the heroes and heroines,

original: dgod pa dang / sgeg ma dang / rnam par sgeg pa dang / 'khyud pa dang / 'o byed pa dang / sen mos 'debs pa'i kun du dga' ba la sogs pa thob pa'i mkha' 'gro dang / mkha' 'gro ma'i tshogs rnams kyis yongs su gang ba //
analyzed: dgod pa dang / sgeg ma dang / rnam par sgeg pa dang / 'khyud pa dang / 'o byed pa dang / sen mos 'debs pa'i kun du dga' ba la sogs pa thob pa'i mkha' 'gro dang / mkha' 'gro ma'i tshogs rnams kyis yongs su gang ba //
translated: who are endowed with laughter, flirtation, playfulness, embracing, kissing, scratching, and so forth.

original: de'i rjes su kun du dga' ba'i sems kyis kha cig rdo rje'i rkang pas gar byed do //
analyzed: de'i rjes su kun du dga' ba'i sems kyis kha cig rdo rje'i rkang pas gar byed do //
translated: After that, some, with a mind of joy, dance with vajra steps.

original: kha cig ni rdo rje'i glu len no //
analyzed: kha cig ni rdo rje'i glu len no //
translated: Some sing vajra songs.

original: kha cig ni sna tshogs pa'i dam tshig gi kun du spyod pa la kun spyod do //
analyzed: kha cig ni sna tshogs pa'i dam tshig gi kun du spyod pa la kun spyod do //
translated: Some engage in conduct in the conduct of the various pledges.

original: kha cig ni bdud rtsi lnga dang sgrol ma lnga za bar byed do //
analyzed: kha cig ni bdud rtsi lnga dang sgrol ma lnga za bar byed do //
translated: Some eat the five ambrosias and the five nectars.

original: kha cig ni sna tshogs pa'i gos stobs par byed do //
analyzed: kha cig ni sna tshogs pa'i gos stobs par byed do //
translated: Some wear various garments.

original: kha cig ni sna tshogs pa'i sems can rnams skrag par byed do //
analyzed: kha cig ni sna tshogs pa'i sems can rnams skrag par byed do //
translated: Some frighten the various beings.

original: kha cig chang 'thung bar byed pa yang 'dir blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: kha cig chang 'thung bar byed pa yang 'dir blta bar bya'o //
translated: Some drink alcohol.

original: gzhan yang / rnga dr'a ka dang / da ma ru dang / rnga pa ta ha dang / rnga marda la dang / rnga dzha dzha ra dang / @102b pi wang dang / gling bu dang / cha lang la sogs pa'i sil snyan sna tshogs pa rnams sil snyan 'khrol bar byed pa /
analyzed: gzhan yang / rnga dr'a ka dang / da ma ru dang / rnga pa ta ha dang / rnga marda la dang / rnga dzha dzha ra dang / @102b pi wang dang / gling bu dang / cha lang la sogs pa'i sil snyan sna tshogs pa rnams sil snyan 'khrol bar byed pa /
translated: Moreover, there are various musical instruments such as drums, damarus, paṭaha drums, mṛdaṅga drums, jhajjhara drums, lutes, flutes, cymbals, and so on, which are played as musical instruments.

original: slar grub pa dang / rig pa 'dzin pa dang / rigs 'dzin ma dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi 'am ci dang / mi 'am ci mo dang / dri za dang / dri za mo la sogs pa du ma dang / lha dang /
analyzed: slar grub pa dang / rig pa 'dzin pa dang / rigs 'dzin ma dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi 'am ci dang / mi 'am ci mo dang / dri za dang / dri za mo la sogs pa du ma dang / lha dang /
translated: There are many accomplished [vidyādharas], knowledge holders, female knowledge holders, mahoragas, kinnaras, kinnara females, gandharvas, gandharva females, and so on, as well as hosts of gods,

original: lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding gi tshogs rnams 'khrigs shing k'i li k'i li'i sgra dang / 'jigs shing 'ur 'ur sgrogs par shin tu 'jigs par byed pa //
analyzed: lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding gi tshogs rnams 'khrigs shing k'i li k'i li'i sgra dang / 'jigs shing 'ur 'ur sgrogs par shin tu 'jigs par byed pa //
translated: demigods, and garuḍas, who are agitated and make terrifying sounds such as kilikili and jhajjhara.

original: de nas yang gar gyi ro dgus yid 'phrog par byed pa /
analyzed: de nas yang gar gyi ro dgus yid 'phrog par byed pa /
translated: Then, it is captivating with the nine dramatic sentiments.

original: ro langs dang 'byung po'i tshogs dang ldan pa'i dur khrod chen po brgyad po rnams ni /
analyzed: ro langs dang 'byung po'i tshogs dang ldan pa'i dur khrod chen po brgyad po rnams ni /
translated: The eight great charnel grounds, endowed with the hosts of zombies and bhūta spirits,

original: rnam par shes pa brgyad rnam par dag par bsam par bya'o zhes pa /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa brgyad rnam par dag par bsam par bya'o zhes pa /
translated: are the eight consciousnesses, which are considered to be pure.

original: dz'a landh'a ri pa'i zhabs kyis gsungs pa bris pa ste dur khrod do //
analyzed: dz'a landh'a ri pa'i zhabs kyis gsungs pa bris pa ste dur khrod do //
translated: This is written according to the teachings of Jālandharipā.

original: de'i dbus su bshad pa'i rlung la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi yongs su gyur pa las khang pa brtsegs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i dbus su bshad pa'i rlung la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi yongs su gyur pa las khang pa brtsegs pa ste /
translated: In the center of that, the four great elements, such as wind and so on, transform into a celestial mansion.

original: 'di'i gru bzhi nyid dang / rdo rje'i thig ni dbang po lnga rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i gru bzhi nyid dang / rdo rje'i thig ni dbang po lnga rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: Its four corners and vajra lines are the purity of the five sense organs.

original: sgo bzhi ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: sgo bzhi ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The four doors are the purity of the four foundations of mindfulness.

original: rta babs bzhi ni yang dag par spong ba bzhi rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: rta babs bzhi ni yang dag par spong ba bzhi rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The four porticos are the purity of the four correct exertions.

original: stegs bu bzhi ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: stegs bu bzhi ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The four terraces are the purity of the four supports of miraculous abilities.

original: grva bzhi dang / de shal phyed pa ni stobs lnga rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: grva bzhi dang / de shal phyed pa ni stobs lnga rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The four corners and the half-pendants are the purity of the five powers.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad rnam par dag pa las ka ba brgyad du rab tu brtags so //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad rnam par dag pa las ka ba brgyad du rab tu brtags so //
translated: From the purity of the eightfold noble path, the eight pillars are imagined.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun rnam par dag pa las sgo logs dang mda' yab dang / gdugs dang rnga yab dang bla re dang dril bu dang ba dan rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun rnam par dag pa las sgo logs dang mda' yab dang / gdugs dang rnga yab dang bla re dang dril bu dang ba dan rnams kyang ngo //
translated: From the purity of the seven factors of enlightenment, the side walls, the parapets, the parasol, the yak-tail fans, the canopies, the bells, and the banners are also [imagined].

original: de ltar byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun rnam par dag pa las rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba thar pa chen po'i grong rnam par snang mdzad rnam par dag pa 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin te rtse mo bcu gnyis pa'i sna tshogs rdo rje'i
analyzed: de ltar byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun rnam par dag pa las rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba thar pa chen po'i grong rnam par snang mdzad rnam par dag pa 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin te rtse mo bcu gnyis pa'i sna tshogs rdo rje'i
translated: Thus, from the purity of the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, the city of great liberation, dependent origination, Vairocana, the nature of clear light, is the top, the vajra cross with twelve spokes,

original: stegs bu'i steng du bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: stegs bu'i steng du bsam par bya'o //
translated: which should be imagined above the platform.

original: de la shar gyi rtse mo gsum ni dkar po dang / lho ser po dang / nub dmar po dang / byang ljang gu dang / stegs bu'i dbus kyi kha dog ni sngon por bsam par bya'o //🔽gru bzhi @103a * //
analyzed: de la shar gyi rtse mo gsum ni dkar po dang / lho ser po dang / nub dmar po dang / byang ljang gu dang / stegs bu'i dbus kyi kha dog ni sngon por bsam par bya'o // gru bzhi @103a * //
translated: The three eastern peaks are white, the southern one is yellow, the western one is red, the northern one is green, and the color of the center of the platform is thought to be blue.

original: dang thig la sogs pa rnams ni dz'a lanbha ri ba'i zhabs kyis mdzad pa'i rnam par bshad pa las khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: dang thig la sogs pa rnams ni dz'a lanbha ri ba'i zhabs kyis mdzad pa'i rnam par bshad pa las khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The four corners, the lines, and so forth should be understood from the commentary composed by Jālangharipa.

original: da ni lha mo bcu drug po rnams rnam par dgod pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni lha mo bcu drug po rnams rnam par dgod pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the arrangement of the sixteen goddesses should be stated.

original: rdo rje'i thig nyid dang / rtsig pa lnga po de rnams las phyi rol gyi lha'i snam bu la sgo'i rtsa ba nas brtsams te logs gnyis gnyis su g-yas skor gyi rjes su rim pas zla ba dang nyi ma'i gdan gnyis gnyis kyi dbus su son pa'i rang rang gi ming gi yi ge
analyzed: rdo rje'i thig nyid dang / rtsig pa lnga po de rnams las phyi rol gyi lha'i snam bu la sgo'i rtsa ba nas brtsams te logs gnyis gnyis su g-yas skor gyi rjes su rim pas zla ba dang nyi ma'i gdan gnyis gnyis kyi dbus su son pa'i rang rang gi ming gi yi ge
translated: From among those vajra lines and the five walls, on the outer celestial mansion platform, beginning from the base of the door, on each of the two sides, in sequence, following the clockwise order, in the center of two moon and sun seats each, the first letter of their respective names

original: dang po zla tshes dang thig le dang ldan pa'i sa bon las rdzogs pa'i mchod pa'i lha mo rnams rang rang gi ming gi rnam pa can du gnas pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dang po zla tshes dang thig le dang ldan pa'i sa bon las rdzogs pa'i mchod pa'i lha mo rnams rang rang gi ming gi rnam pa can du gnas pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: First, the seed syllables with the moon, drop and nada squiggle are complete as the offering goddesses abiding in the form of their individual names.

original: pi wang ma ni ser mo dang / gling bu ma ni dmar po dang / rnga zlum ma ni du ba'i mdog dang / rdza rnga ma ni dkar mo dang / bzhad ma ni ser mo dang / sgeg mo ni dmar mo dang / glu ma ni dmar po dang /
analyzed: pi wang ma ni ser mo dang / gling bu ma ni dmar po dang / rnga zlum ma ni du ba'i mdog dang / rdza rnga ma ni dkar mo dang / bzhad ma ni ser mo dang / sgeg mo ni dmar mo dang / glu ma ni dmar po dang /
translated: They are: the lute goddess who is yellow, the flute goddess who is red, the small drum goddess who is the color of smoke, the clay drum goddess who is white, the smiling goddess who is yellow, the flirtatious goddess who is red, the singing goddess who is red,

original: gar ma ni kha dog sna tshogs ma dang / me tog ma ni dkar mo dang / bdug spos ma ni nag mo dang / mar me ma ni gser lta bu dang / dri ma ni ser mo dang / me long ma ni dkar mo dang /
analyzed: gar ma ni kha dog sna tshogs ma dang / me tog ma ni dkar mo dang / bdug spos ma ni nag mo dang / mar me ma ni gser lta bu dang / dri ma ni ser mo dang / me long ma ni dkar mo dang /
translated: the dancing goddess who is multicolored, the flower goddess who is white, the incense goddess who is black, the lamp goddess who is golden, the scent goddess who is yellow, the mirror goddess who is white,

original: ro ma ni dmar mo dang / reg bya ma ni ljang gu dang / chos ma ni dkar mo ste 'di rnams thams cad zla ba'i gdan la gnas pa cha bcu drug rnam par dag pa blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ro ma ni dmar mo dang / reg bya ma ni ljang gu dang / chos ma ni dkar mo ste 'di rnams thams cad zla ba'i gdan la gnas pa cha bcu drug rnam par dag pa blta bar bya'o //
translated: the taste goddess who is red, the touch goddess who is green, and the dharma goddess who is white. All of them should be seen as abiding on moon seats, the complete purity of the sixteen aspects.

original: 'di rnams kyis brgyan pa'o zhes pa khang pa brtsegs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyis brgyan pa'o zhes pa khang pa brtsegs pa'o //
translated: These are the ornaments of the palace.

original: de'i rjes su khang pa brtsegs pa'i dbus su 'dab ma sna tshogs pa'i padma'i ze'u 'bru'i steng du bdud bzhi gan rgyal du g-yas dang g-yos du mgo bo ste /
analyzed: de'i rjes su khang pa brtsegs pa'i dbus su 'dab ma sna tshogs pa'i padma'i ze'u 'bru'i steng du bdud bzhi gan rgyal du g-yas dang g-yos du mgo bo ste /
translated: After that, in the center of the palace, on the pericarp of a lotus with variegated petals, one should visualize the four prostrate Maras, with their heads to the right and left,

original: phung po dang / nyon mongs pa dang / 'chi bdag dang / lha'i bur mngon par brjod pa rnams blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: phung po dang / nyon mongs pa dang / 'chi bdag dang / lha'i bur mngon par brjod pa rnams blta bar bya'o //
translated: namely, the aggregates, the afflictions, the Lord of Death, and the son of heaven.

original: de la phung po'i bdud ni tshangs pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i bdud ni khyab 'jug dang / 'chi bdag gi bdud ni dbang phyug chen po dang / lha'i bu'i bdud ni lha'i dbang po ste /
analyzed: de la phung po'i bdud ni tshangs pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i bdud ni khyab 'jug dang / 'chi bdag gi bdud ni dbang phyug chen po dang / lha'i bu'i bdud ni lha'i dbang po ste /
translated: The Mara of the aggregates is Brahma, the Mara of the afflictions is Vishnu, the Mara of the Lord of Death is Mahesvara, and the Mara of the son of heaven is Indra.

original: bdud bzhi po rnams kyi snying gar nyi mas mnan pa'o //
analyzed: bdud bzhi po rnams kyi snying gar nyi mas mnan pa'o //
translated: All four Maras are pressed down by the sun.

original: shar la sogs pa'i phyogs kyi 'dab ma rnams su tshangs pa dang / dbang po dang / nye dbang dang / drag po rnams so //
analyzed: shar la sogs pa'i phyogs kyi 'dab ma rnams su tshangs pa dang / dbang po dang / nye dbang dang / drag po rnams so //
translated: On the petals in the east and so forth are Brahma, Indra, Upendra, and Rudra.

original: dbang ldan la sog pa'i phyogs bral gyi 'dab ma rnams su gshin rje dang / lus ngan dang / bden bral dang / thags bzang ris kyang ngo//
analyzed: dbang ldan la sog pa'i phyogs bral gyi 'dab ma rnams su gshin rje dang / lus ngan dang / bden bral dang / thags bzang ris kyang ngo//
translated: In the petals of the directions beginning with the northeast, Yama, Virūpākṣa, Nirṛti, and Vemacitrin.

original: @103b 'di rnams kyi snying gar yang zla ba brgyad kyis mnan pa ste /
analyzed: @103b 'di rnams kyi snying gar yang zla ba brgyad kyis mnan pa ste /
translated: And on their hearts, the eight moons are trodden down.

original: 'dab ma sna tshogs pa'i padma la sogs pa nas thags bzangs ris kyi mthar thug pa ni khang pa brtsegs pa rdzogs pa'i dus nyid du rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dab ma sna tshogs pa'i padma la sogs pa nas thags bzangs ris kyi mthar thug pa ni khang pa brtsegs pa rdzogs pa'i dus nyid du rdzogs pa'o //
translated: From the variegated lotus up to Vemacitrin, the palace is complete at the time of completion.

original: gang gi phyir na rten cing 'brel bar 'gyur ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir na rten cing 'brel bar 'gyur ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of the inconceivability of dependent origination.

original: snying gar nyi ma'i steng du aa yig la sogs pa'i dbyangs nyis 'gyur yongs su gyur pas mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis gsal bar byed pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: snying gar nyi ma'i steng du aa yig la sogs pa'i dbyangs nyis 'gyur yongs su gyur pas mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis gsal bar byed pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: On the heart, on a sun, the vowels a and so on, doubled, transform into the moon mandala which illuminates the thirty-two marks, the nature of mirror-like primordial wisdom.

original: de'i steng du ka la sogs pa'i yi ge sum cu rtsa bzhi da dha da dha ya la zhes pa'i yi ge drug dang bcas pa lugs su 'byung ba dang lugs las bzlog pas nyis 'gyur du byas nas yi ge brgyad cu yongs su gyur pa las nyi
analyzed: de'i steng du ka la sogs pa'i yi ge sum cu rtsa bzhi da dha da dha ya la zhes pa'i yi ge drug dang bcas pa lugs su 'byung ba dang lugs las bzlog pas nyis 'gyur du byas nas yi ge brgyad cu yongs su gyur pa las nyi
translated: On top of that, the thirty-four letters beginning with ka and the six letters ya ra la wa sha sa are doubled, in forward and reverse order, and transform into the eighty letters.

original: ma'i dkyil 'khor te dpe byad brgyad cu gsal bar byed pa mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin du blta'o //
analyzed: ma'i dkyil 'khor te dpe byad brgyad cu gsal bar byed pa mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin du blta'o //
translated: From them, one should visualize the sun maṇḍala, which is the nature of the gnosis of uniformity, which illuminates the eighty minor marks.

original: de kha sbyar ba'i dbus su h'u% dang aam gi sa bon gnyis yongs su gyur pa'i thod pa dang gri gug de nyid kyis mtshan pa ni so sor rtog pa'i ye she so //
analyzed: de kha sbyar ba'i dbus su h'u% dang aam gi sa bon gnyis yongs su gyur pa'i thod pa dang gri gug de nyid kyis mtshan pa ni so sor rtog pa'i ye she so //
translated: In the center of that union, the two seed syllables haṃ and aṃ transform into a skull and flaying knife marked by that [haṃ]. That is the gnosis of individual discernment.

original: de nas sa bon nyid las rnam par spros pa'i 'od zer gyi dra ba rnams kyis mtha' yas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams snang bar byas nas yang bkug ste de nyid du zhugs pa las thams cad gcig pa nyid ni bya ba grub pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de nas sa bon nyid las rnam par spros pa'i 'od zer gyi dra ba rnams kyis mtha' yas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams snang bar byas nas yang bkug ste de nyid du zhugs pa las thams cad gcig pa nyid ni bya ba grub pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Then, from the seed syllables, the net of light rays that emanate illuminates the infinite world systems and then draws them back in and dissolves into that, which is the gnosis of successful activities.

original: gcig nyid yongs su gyur pas skad cig gis bdag nyid 'chad par 'gyur ba'i sku mdog dang mtshan ma la sogs pa rdzogs pa'i rang gi 'dod pa'i lha dpal he ru ka'i gzugs sam phyag bcu drug pa dang / phyag drug pa dang / phyag bzhi pa dang /
analyzed: gcig nyid yongs su gyur pas skad cig gis bdag nyid 'chad par 'gyur ba'i sku mdog dang mtshan ma la sogs pa rdzogs pa'i rang gi 'dod pa'i lha dpal he ru ka'i gzugs sam phyag bcu drug pa dang / phyag drug pa dang / phyag bzhi pa dang /
translated: By the complete transformation of the single one, in an instant, one should visualize oneself in the form of one's chosen deity, glorious Heruka, with the complete color, marks, and so forth, as described below, with sixteen arms, with six arms, with four arms,

original: phyag gnyis pa rgyu rdo rje 'dzin pa'i gzugs dang / de bzhin kho nar rdzogs pa'i bdag med ma la sogs pa phrag par 'byung ba ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes so zhes pa rnam pa lngas mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'o ;🔽/ shar la sogs pa'i phyogs su rim pas snying gar zla ba rnams la de bzhin kho nar zla ba dang nyi ma sbyar ba'i dbus su //
analyzed: phyag gnyis pa rgyu rdo rje 'dzin pa'i gzugs dang / de bzhin kho nar rdzogs pa'i bdag med ma la sogs pa phrag par 'byung ba ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes so zhes pa rnam pa lngas mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'o ; / shar la sogs pa'i phyogs su rim pas snying gar zla ba rnams la de bzhin kho nar zla ba dang nyi ma sbyar ba'i dbus su //
translated: or with two arms, in the form of the causal Vajradhara, and likewise, with the complete form of Nairatmya on one's lap, with five aspects, which is the gnosis of the extremely pure dharmadhatu.

original: ga% tsa% ba% gha% pa% sha% la% da%:zhes pa'i sa bon brgyad po blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ga% tsa% ba% gha% pa% sha% la% da%:zhes pa'i sa bon brgyad po blta bar bya'o //
translated: In the east and so forth, in order, on moon discs at the heart, one should visualize the eight seed syllables, ga ca va bha ta ya sa, in the center of moon and sun combinations, just as they are.

original: de yongs su gyur pa'i goo r'i la sogs pa rnams kyi mtshan ma ni //
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa'i goo r'i la sogs pa rnams kyi mtshan ma ni //
translated: The signs of Gaurī, etc. , which are the complete transformations of those, are

original: gri gug dang / @104a * //
analyzed: gri gug dang / @104a * //
translated: the flaying knife,

original: cang te 'u dang / rus sbal dang / sbrul dang / seng ge dang / dge slong dang / 'khor lo dang // rdo rje ste sa bon de dag nyid kyis byin gyis brlabs pa bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: cang te 'u dang / rus sbal dang / sbrul dang / seng ge dang / dge slong dang / 'khor lo dang // rdo rje ste sa bon de dag nyid kyis byin gyis brlabs pa bsam par bya'o //
translated: the skull-cup, the tortoise, the snake, the lion, the monk, the wheel, and the vajra. One should imagine that they are consecrated by those very seed syllables.

original: de thams cad yongs su gyur pa'i rnam pa lngas mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pas goo r'i la sogs pa yang sku mdog dang mtshan ma la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rim pas rdzogs par bya'o zhes pa rgyu'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: de thams cad yongs su gyur pa'i rnam pa lngas mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pas goo r'i la sogs pa yang sku mdog dang mtshan ma la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rim pas rdzogs par bya'o zhes pa rgyu'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: All of that is the complete transformation of the five aspects of manifest, perfect enlightenment. Gaurī, etc. , are also complete in the order of the explanation of the color, signs, etc. , of the body. That is the causal maṇḍala.

original: de ltar rang gi 'dod pa'i lha'i rnam pa rdzogs nas bdag med ma la sogs pa'i mkha' 'gro ma'i 'khor lo yang ste rang gi rig ma dang lhan cig ro gcig tu snyoms par zhugs par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar rang gi 'dod pa'i lha'i rnam pa rdzogs nas bdag med ma la sogs pa'i mkha' 'gro ma'i 'khor lo yang ste rang gi rig ma dang lhan cig ro gcig tu snyoms par zhugs par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, after the form of the chosen deity is complete, one should view the circle of dakinis, beginning with Nairātmya, as well as one’s own knowledge consort, as having entered into union with oneself, having become of one taste.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi dam tshig gi 'od zer gyis bkug pa'i dri za'i sems can bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi dam tshig gi 'od zer gyis bkug pa'i dri za'i sems can bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The gandharva beings summoned by the light rays of the samadhi commitment are the nature of great bliss.

original: ho:yig dmar po'i phreng ba gnyis kyis bskor ba /
analyzed: ho:yig dmar po'i phreng ba gnyis kyis bskor ba /
translated: Surrounded by two garlands of red HO syllables,

original: 'khor lo'i mkha' 'gro'i lam nas rab tu zhugs nas /
analyzed: 'khor lo'i mkha' 'gro'i lam nas rab tu zhugs nas /
translated: they enter the path of the chakra dakinis.

original: bcom ldan 'das rang gi rig ma dang lhan cig 'dod chags chen po'i rjes su chags pa las shin tu mchog gi bde ba chen po'i ror zhugs //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rang gi rig ma dang lhan cig 'dod chags chen po'i rjes su chags pa las shin tu mchog gi bde ba chen po'i ror zhugs //
translated: The Bhagavat, together with his knowledge consort, through passion for great desire, enters the taste of supreme great bliss.

original: sa bon gyi gzugs kyis gnas par gyur pa'o zhes pa zhu ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: sa bon gyi gzugs kyis gnas par gyur pa'o zhes pa zhu ba lta bu'o //
translated: They abide in the form of seed syllables.

original: de nas pukka s'i la sogs pa'i lha mo bzhi po rnams 'khor lo'i bdag po med par mthong nas mya ngan gyis gdungs te bdag cag ni mgon med pa'o zhes pa nas yid mi bde ba chen po thob pas shin tu smre sngags kyis thugs rab sad par
analyzed: de nas pukka s'i la sogs pa'i lha mo bzhi po rnams 'khor lo'i bdag po med par mthong nas mya ngan gyis gdungs te bdag cag ni mgon med pa'o zhes pa nas yid mi bde ba chen po thob pas shin tu smre sngags kyis thugs rab sad par
translated: Then the four goddesses beginning with Pukkasī, seeing the Lord of the Chakra without him, are tormented by grief, saying, “We are without a protector,” and so forth.🔽They attain great mental dissatisfaction and awaken the Bhagavat with cries of lamentation,

original: byed pa'i rdo rje'i glu rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das slong bar byed do //
analyzed: byed pa'i rdo rje'i glu rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das slong bar byed do //
translated: with vajra songs that arouse him.

original: khyod bzhengs rje btsun snying rje'i yid //
analyzed: khyod bzhengs rje btsun snying rje'i yid //
translated: You arise, O Venerable One, with a compassionate mind.

original: ces pa la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa bzhi'i don brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: ces pa la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa bzhi'i don brjod par bya ste /
translated: One should express the meaning of these four verses.

original: khyed bzhengs rje btsun snying rje'i yid //
analyzed: khyed bzhengs rje btsun snying rje'i yid //
translated: You arise, O Venerable One, with a compassionate mind,

original: pukka s'i bdag yongs su skyobs //
analyzed: pukka s'i bdag yongs su skyobs //
translated: protect me, the Pukkasī,

original: stong nyid rang bzhin dor nas ni //🔽bde chen sbyor bas bdag 'dod mdzod //
analyzed: stong nyid rang bzhin dor nas ni // bde chen sbyor bas bdag 'dod mdzod //
translated: having abandoned the nature of emptiness,🔽I desire you through the practice of great bliss.

original: zhu bar ltung ba'i ting nge 'dzin las shes pa ste bdag la khyod kyi byams pa chen po'o //
analyzed: zhu bar ltung ba'i ting nge 'dzin las shes pa ste bdag la khyod kyi byams pa chen po'o //
translated: The great love of yours for me is known from the samādhi of melting bliss.

original: khyod med na ni bdag 'gum pas //
analyzed: khyod med na ni bdag 'gum pas //
translated: If I were without you, I would die,🔽therefore, arise, O Hevajra,

original: kye yi rdo rje khyod bzhengs shig / stong nyid rang bzhin nyid dor nas //
analyzed: kye yi rdo rje khyod bzhengs shig / stong nyid rang bzhin nyid dor nas //
translated: having abandoned the nature of emptiness,

original: ri khrod ma yi bya ba sgrubs //
analyzed: ri khrod ma yi bya ba sgrubs //
translated: accomplish the practice of the Śavarī.

original: zhes pa bdag la khyod kyi snying rje chen po'o //
analyzed: zhes pa bdag la khyod kyi snying rje chen po'o //
translated: The great compassion of yours for me is known from this.

original: dga' gtso 'jig rten mgron gnyer nas /
analyzed: dga' gtso 'jig rten mgron gnyer nas /
translated: O chief of the joyful ones, having invited the world,

original: stong pa nyid @104b la bzhugs sam ci //
analyzed: stong pa nyid @104b la bzhugs sam ci //
translated: do you remain in emptiness?

original: khyod med phyogs ni mi 'tshal bas //
analyzed: khyod med phyogs ni mi 'tshal bas //
translated: Not knowing the direction without you,

original: gdol ba mo bdag zhu ba bgyid //
analyzed: gdol ba mo bdag zhu ba bgyid //
translated: I, the Candālī, make a request.

original: ces pa de las bzhengs shig ste bdag la khyod kyi dga' ba chen po'o //🔽bdag gis khyod thugs mig 'phrul shes //
analyzed: ces pa de las bzhengs shig ste bdag la khyod kyi dga' ba chen po'o // bdag gis khyod thugs mig 'phrul shes //
translated: Arise from that, O my great joy!🔽I am your eye of the mind,

original: kye ma mig 'phrul can khyod bzhengs //🔽g-yung mo bdag ni grong khyer ma //
analyzed: kye ma mig 'phrul can khyod bzhengs // g-yung mo bdag ni grong khyer ma //
translated: O you who are endowed with magical power!🔽Arise, O you who are endowed with magical power!🔽I am the village girl, O you who are endowed with compassion!

original: snying rje chad par ma mdzad cig / ces pa bdag la khyod kyis btang snyoms chen po'i gnas pa'o //
analyzed: snying rje chad par ma mdzad cig / ces pa bdag la khyod kyis btang snyoms chen po'i gnas pa'o //
translated: Do not be indifferent to me!

original: bcom ldan 'das rang gi rig ma dang lhan cig 'dod chags chen pos rjes su chags pa las shin tu mchog gi bde ba chen po'i ror zhu ba sa bon gyi gzugs kyis gnas par gyur pa'o zhes pa 'di'i don rnam par dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rang gi rig ma dang lhan cig 'dod chags chen pos rjes su chags pa las shin tu mchog gi bde ba chen po'i ror zhu ba sa bon gyi gzugs kyis gnas par gyur pa'o zhes pa 'di'i don rnam par dpyad par bya ste /
translated: The Bhagavān, together with his knowledge consort, through great passion, melts into the taste of the supreme great bliss, and abides in the form of a seed syllable. The meaning of this should be analyzed.

original: ci zhu ba de thog mar de nyid tha mal pa'i lus med par bltas nas ye shes kyi snang ba rdo rje'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sbyor bas gang bcom ldan 'das lhan cig skyes pa he ru ka yin nam /
analyzed: ci zhu ba de thog mar de nyid tha mal pa'i lus med par bltas nas ye shes kyi snang ba rdo rje'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sbyor bas gang bcom ldan 'das lhan cig skyes pa he ru ka yin nam /
translated: What is that which melts? First, having seen that ordinary body of that [yogin] as nonexistent, by the yoga of the vajra samādhi of the appearance of gnosis, what is the Bhagavān? Is it the coemergent Heruka?

original: de yongs su gyur pa'i phyag bcu drug pa la sogs pa'i gzugs yin //
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa'i phyag bcu drug pa la sogs pa'i gzugs yin //
translated: He is the form of the sixteenfold Vajra-Being, etc.

original: gnyi ga ltar yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar yang mi rigs te /
translated: Both of these interpretations are incorrect.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa dang // sprul pa'i sku dag ni rus pa dang / rkang la sogs pa dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes kha cig rnam par rtog na /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa dang // sprul pa'i sku dag ni rus pa dang / rkang la sogs pa dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes kha cig rnam par rtog na /
translated: For the Enjoyment Body and the Transformation Body are devoid of bones, marrow, etc.

original: dri za'i sems can rab tu zhugs pa las zhu bar gyur pa nyid zhu ba yin no //
analyzed: dri za'i sems can rab tu zhugs pa las zhu bar gyur pa nyid zhu ba yin no //
translated: The being of the Gandharva state, having entered the womb, is the “congealed” state.

original: ji ltar yan lag bcu gnyis la brten nas ma dang pha yang dag par sbyor ba las khu ba dang khrag de dag 'dres par gyur pa ni zhu ba yin pa de bzhin du 'dir yang ste /
analyzed: ji ltar yan lag bcu gnyis la brten nas ma dang pha yang dag par sbyor ba las khu ba dang khrag de dag 'dres par gyur pa ni zhu ba yin pa de bzhin du 'dir yang ste /
translated: Just as the semen and blood of the mother and father, having united, are the “congealed” state, in dependence on the twelve members, in the same way, here also.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das zhu ba zhes pa dri za'i sems can zhu ba yin pas na bcom ldan 'das zhu ba'o zhes smra ba ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das zhu ba zhes pa dri za'i sems can zhu ba yin pas na bcom ldan 'das zhu ba'o zhes smra ba ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, it is not correct to say that the Blessed One is the “congealed” state because the being of the Gandharva state is the “congealed” state.

original: nye bar brtags pa las bcom ldan 'das dang lhan cig gnyis su med par byas nas brjod par byas te /
analyzed: nye bar brtags pa las bcom ldan 'das dang lhan cig gnyis su med par byas nas brjod par byas te /
translated: In the Upadesa, it is said that the question is to be made without duality with the Bhagavat.

original: dngos su na zhu ba yin no //
analyzed: dngos su na zhu ba yin no //
translated: In fact, it is a question.

original: de ltar rigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar rigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable to say that,

original: zhu ba la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhu ba la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no question, etc.

original: zhu ba lhung ba'i sgras sngar med pa'i sems can skye ba yang brjod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zhu ba lhung ba'i sgras sngar med pa'i sems can skye ba yang brjod pa ma yin no //
translated: The word “question” does not refer to the arising of a sentient being who did not exist previously.

original: de'i phyir zhu ba lhung ba'i sgras phyag bcu drug pa la sogs pa ma yin zhing lhan cig skyes pa rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhu ba lhung ba'i sgras phyag bcu drug pa la sogs pa ma yin zhing lhan cig skyes pa rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the word “question” does not refer to the sixteen-branched prostration, etc., but is to be taken as referring to the innate.

original: 'di nyid mtsho skyes zhabs kyis gsungs pa ni //
analyzed: 'di nyid mtsho skyes zhabs kyis gsungs pa ni //
translated: This very point is stated by the Lake-born Master:

original: sa bon gyi gzugs kyis gnas par gyur pa zhes so //🔽de bzhin @105a * //
analyzed: sa bon gyi gzugs kyis gnas par gyur pa zhes so // de bzhin @105a * //
translated: “It is the form of the seed that is present.”

original: du yang dz'a landha ri pa'i zhabs kyis /
analyzed: du yang dz'a landha ri pa'i zhabs kyis /
translated: Similarly, the venerable Jalandhari🔽says:

original: lha'i rnam pas ma dag pa'i lus med pa ste /
analyzed: lha'i rnam pas ma dag pa'i lus med pa ste /
translated: “The impure body does not exist in the form of the deity.

original: ma dag pa'i lus med pa na dag pa'i skur brtag pa tsam mo //
analyzed: ma dag pa'i lus med pa na dag pa'i skur brtag pa tsam mo //
translated: When the impure body does not exist, the pure body is merely imagined.”

original: de yang med pa na bdud rtsi zhu ba'i thigs pa bzhin du dang ba sgyu ma lta bu'i rnam par shes pa'i gzugs kyis gnas pa ste /
analyzed: de yang med pa na bdud rtsi zhu ba'i thigs pa bzhin du dang ba sgyu ma lta bu'i rnam par shes pa'i gzugs kyis gnas pa ste /
translated: Moreover, when it does not exist, it abides in the form of consciousness, which is clear like a drop of nectar, and illusory.

original: 'di nyid sgyu ma lta bu'i rnam par shes pa'i smon lam gyi rten no //
analyzed: 'di nyid sgyu ma lta bu'i rnam par shes pa'i smon lam gyi rten no //
translated: This is the basis of the aspiration for the illusion-like consciousness.

original: ji ltar sgyu ma rang dang gzhan gyi shes pa dang yang dag par rig pa med na yang don gyi bya ba byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar sgyu ma rang dang gzhan gyi shes pa dang yang dag par rig pa med na yang don gyi bya ba byed do //
translated: Just as an illusion, although it is not a real entity, performs the function of an entity,

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i sgyu ma ni yun ring por smon lam gyi shugs kyis don byed pa'i dbang gis bzhengs pa ste rmi lam sad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i sgyu ma ni yun ring por smon lam gyi shugs kyis don byed pa'i dbang gis bzhengs pa ste rmi lam sad pa bzhin no //
translated: so also the illusion-like consciousness, through the power of the force of aspiration over a long period of time, performs the function of an entity, like a dream after waking up.

original: de la 'dir bzhengs pa'i rim pa ni rnam pa lnga'i rab tu sbyor ba las te /
analyzed: de la 'dir bzhengs pa'i rim pa ni rnam pa lnga'i rab tu sbyor ba las te /
translated: Here, the process of arising is applied in five aspects.

original: der bdud rtsi zhu ba'i thigs pa dang 'dra ba sgyu ma lta bu'i rnam par shes pa de yong su gyur pa las rnam par shes pa lnga'i rang bzhin der a'a li yongs su gyur pa'i me long lta bu'i ye shes te zla ba'o //
analyzed: der bdud rtsi zhu ba'i thigs pa dang 'dra ba sgyu ma lta bu'i rnam par shes pa de yong su gyur pa las rnam par shes pa lnga'i rang bzhin der a'a li yongs su gyur pa'i me long lta bu'i ye shes te zla ba'o //
translated: In that, the consciousness, which is like a drop of melted nectar, and which is illusory in form, is transformed. From that, the mirror-like pristine consciousness, which has the nature of the five pristine consciousnesses, is the moon.

original: k'a li yongs su gyur pa'i mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes te nyi ma'o //
analyzed: k'a li yongs su gyur pa'i mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes te nyi ma'o //
translated: The pristine consciousness of uniformity, which is the transformation of the kāli, is the sun.

original: de dag gi dbus su son pa'i sa bon no //
analyzed: de dag gi dbus su son pa'i sa bon no //
translated: The seed syllable is located in the center of those two.

original: de yongs su gyur pa'i mtshan ma ni so sor rtog par brjod par bya ste /🔽thams cad gcig pa nan tan te /
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa'i mtshan ma ni so sor rtog par brjod par bya ste / thams cad gcig pa nan tan te /
translated: The sign that is the transformation of that is said to be discernment.

original: gzugs rdzogs dag pa'i chos nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs rdzogs dag pa'i chos nyid do //
translated: All are one; it is the reality of the perfect form.

original: de la ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin byang chub kyi sems las langs pa'i 'od zer rnams kyis rgyu ba dang bcas pa'i mi rgyu ba bkug nas de nyid du dkyil 'khor ba dang ro mnyam du byas nas byang chub kyi sems ston ka'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi
analyzed: de la ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin byang chub kyi sems las langs pa'i 'od zer rnams kyis rgyu ba dang bcas pa'i mi rgyu ba bkug nas de nyid du dkyil 'khor ba dang ro mnyam du byas nas byang chub kyi sems ston ka'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi
translated: The light rays that arise from the bodhicitta, which has the nature of the five pristine consciousnesses, summon the animate and inanimate worlds. Having made them the same taste as the maṇḍala, the bodhicitta is the maṇḍala of the autumn moon.

original: rnam par blta bar bya ste zhes pa ni rnal 'byor zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: rnam par blta bar bya ste zhes pa ni rnal 'byor zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: One should view is the samadhi called yoga.

original: de'i rjes su skad cig gis de yongs su gyur pa'i lhan cig skyes pa'i gzugs brnyan ston ka'i ri bong 'dzin pa'i rnam pa mtha' yas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams rab tu gsal bar byed pa'i chos kyi phyag rgya dang ldan pa ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin sgyu
analyzed: de'i rjes su skad cig gis de yongs su gyur pa'i lhan cig skyes pa'i gzugs brnyan ston ka'i ri bong 'dzin pa'i rnam pa mtha' yas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams rab tu gsal bar byed pa'i chos kyi phyag rgya dang ldan pa ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin sgyu
translated: After that, one should view the illusion-like co-emergence of the form of Heruka with two arms, the nature of the five wisdoms, endowed with the Dharma mudra that illuminates limitless world systems, the aspect of the autumn moon, arisen from the transformation of that [moon], in an instant.

original: ma lta bu'i lhan cig skyes pa he ru ka phyag gnyis pa blta bar bya'o zhes pa ni rjes su rnal 'byor zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin te bzhengs pa'o //🔽'di ltar rjes su rnal 'byor rdzogs par byas nas phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams la rdo rje ma la sogs pa @105b nas ;
analyzed: ma lta bu'i lhan cig skyes pa he ru ka phyag gnyis pa blta bar bya'o zhes pa ni rjes su rnal 'byor zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin te bzhengs pa'o // 'di ltar rjes su rnal 'byor rdzogs par byas nas phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams la rdo rje ma la sogs pa @105b nas ;
translated: This is the samadhi called subsequent yoga, the arising.

original: mkha' spyod ma'i mthar thug pa rnams ki sa bon dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: mkha' spyod ma'i mthar thug pa rnams ki sa bon dgod par bya'o //
translated: Having thus completed the subsequent yoga, one should arrange the seed syllables of Vajraṇārityā and so forth up to Kham̃avijaya in the aggregates, elements, and sense bases.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: This is as follows.

original: gzugs kyi phung po la rdo rje ma'i aom dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po la rdo rje ma'i aom dgod par bya'o //
translated: One should place the oṃ of Vajrī in the form aggregate.

original: tshor ba'i phung po la goo r'i'i ai ngo //
analyzed: tshor ba'i phung po la goo r'i'i ai ngo //
translated: One should place the ī of Gaurī in the feeling aggregate.

original: 'du shes kyi phung po la chu'i rnal 'byor ma'i a'im ngo /
analyzed: 'du shes kyi phung po la chu'i rnal 'byor ma'i a'im ngo /
translated: One should place the īṃ of Vāriyoginī in the discernment aggregate.

original: 'du byed kyi phung po la rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma'i aum ngo /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po la rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma'i aum ngo /
translated: One should place the ūṃ of Vajraḍāka in the compositional factor aggregate.

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung po la bdag med ma'i aam ngo //🔽sha la pukka s'i'i a'u dgod do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung po la bdag med ma'i aam ngo // sha la pukka s'i'i a'u dgod do //
translated: One should place the āṃ of Nairātmyā in the consciousness aggregate.🔽One should place the ū of Pukkāsī in flesh.

original: khrag la ri khrod ma'i rim ngo //
analyzed: khrag la ri khrod ma'i rim ngo //
translated: One should place the ṛ of Carcikā in blood.

original: byang chub kyi sems la gdol ba mo'i rim ngom //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems la gdol ba mo'i rim ngom //
translated: One should place the ṝ of Caṇḍālī in bodhicitta.

original: rus pa la g-yung mo'i lim ngo //
analyzed: rus pa la g-yung mo'i lim ngo //
translated: One should place the ḷ of Ḍombinī in bones.

original: skye mched dgod pa yang brjod par bya ste /🔽gzugs kyi skye mched la goo r'i gzhan gyi l'im dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: skye mched dgod pa yang brjod par bya ste / gzugs kyi skye mched la goo r'i gzhan gyi l'im dgod par bya'o //
translated: One should also state the placement of the sense bases.🔽One should place the ḷā of Gaurī in the sense base of form.

original: sgra chom rkun ma'i aem ngo //🔽dri la ro langs ma'i aeem ngo //🔽ro la ga sma r'i'i aom ngo //
analyzed: sgra chom rkun ma'i aem ngo // dri la ro langs ma'i aeem ngo // ro la ga sma r'i'i aom ngo //
translated: One should place the e of Caurī in the sense base of sound.🔽One should place the ai of Vetālī in the sense base of smell.🔽One should place the o of Ghasmarī in the sense base of taste.

original: reg la sa spyod ma'i aoom ngo //
analyzed: reg la sa spyod ma'i aoom ngo //
translated: One should place the au of Phag-delī in the sense base of touch.

original: chos kyi khams la mkha' spyod ma'i aam ngo //
analyzed: chos kyi khams la mkha' spyod ma'i aam ngo //
translated: One should place the aṃ of Khecarī in the sense base of phenomena.

original: le'u dgu bar yang bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa //
analyzed: le'u dgu bar yang bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa //
translated: In chapter nine, the Bhagavān also says:

original: gzugs phung rdo rje ma ru gyur //
analyzed: gzugs phung rdo rje ma ru gyur //
translated: The form aggregate becomes Vajrā.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa ste dgod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa ste dgod pa'o //
translated: And so on.

original: mngon par rtogs pa'i rim pa 'di nyid kyang rtsa ba'i rgyud du //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i rim pa 'di nyid kyang rtsa ba'i rgyud du //
translated: This very stage of realization is also in the root tantra:

original: dang por stong nyid byang chub ste //
analyzed: dang por stong nyid byang chub ste //
translated: First, emptiness is enlightenment.

original: gnyis pa la ni sa bon bsdu //
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni sa bon bsdu //
translated: Second, the seed is gathered.

original: gsum pa gzugs brnyan rdzogs pa ste /
analyzed: gsum pa gzugs brnyan rdzogs pa ste /
translated: Third, the reflection is complete.

original: bzhi pa yi ge dgod pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa yi ge dgod pa'o //
translated: Fourth, the syllables are set.

original: zhes so // mya ngan las 'das pa'i sku 'dzin pa'i don dang / gdul bya'i skye bo mi spang ba'i don du phung po la sogs pa dgod pa'i shin tu rnal 'byor rdzogs par byas nas /
analyzed: zhes so // mya ngan las 'das pa'i sku 'dzin pa'i don dang / gdul bya'i skye bo mi spang ba'i don du phung po la sogs pa dgod pa'i shin tu rnal 'byor rdzogs par byas nas /
translated: Having completed the very yoga of setting the aggregates and so on for the purpose of holding the body of nirvana and for the purpose of not abandoning the beings to be tamed,

original: rnal 'byor chen po yang dag par brtsam par bya ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor chen po yang dag par brtsam par bya ste /
translated: one should begin the great yoga.

original: lte ba dang / snying ga dang / mgrin pa dang / dbral bar yang padma bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: lte ba dang / snying ga dang / mgrin pa dang / dbral bar yang padma bzhi pa'o //
translated: The navel, heart, throat, and head are the four lotuses.

original: 'dab ma drug cu rtsa bzhi dang / brgyad dang / bcu drug dang / sum cu rtsa gnyis go rims bzhin du bsams nas /
analyzed: 'dab ma drug cu rtsa bzhi dang / brgyad dang / bcu drug dang / sum cu rtsa gnyis go rims bzhin du bsams nas /
translated: One should imagine that there are sixty-four, eight, sixteen, or thirty-two petals, respectively.

original: de rnams su aam h'u% aom ham rnam par bkod de /
analyzed: de rnams su aam h'u% aom ham rnam par bkod de /
translated: One should place the syllables A, Ha, and Om in them,

original: sku dang / gsung dang / thugs byin gyis brlab par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: sku dang / gsung dang / thugs byin gyis brlab par bsam par bya'o //
translated: and imagine that one is consecrated with body, speech, and mind.

original: mgo bor aom yig dkar po bsams nas de las sku rdo rje'i tshogs kyis nam mkha' gang ba sa bon de nyid du zhugs pa las sku rdo rjer gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mgo bor aom yig dkar po bsams nas de las sku rdo rje'i tshogs kyis nam mkha' gang ba sa bon de nyid du zhugs pa las sku rdo rjer gyur pa'o //
translated: Having imagined a white syllable Om on the head, one imagines that the space is filled with a host of Body Vajras, and that they enter into that very seed syllable, and one becomes Body Vajra.

original: aom k'a ya badzr'atma k'a:sarba dharmma:k'a ya badzr'a tma ko& ham zhes brjod do //
analyzed: aom k'a ya badzr'atma k'a:sarba dharmma:k'a ya badzr'a tma ko& ham zhes brjod do //
translated: One should recite: “Om, I am consecrated with the body of all dharmas, which is the body of Vajra Body.

original: ngag gi lam du a'a:yig dmar po bsams nas de las gsung rdo rje'i tshogs kyis nam mkha' gang ba sa bon de nyid du zhugs pa las gsung rdo rjer gyur pa'o//
analyzed: ngag gi lam du a'a:yig dmar po bsams nas de las gsung rdo rje'i tshogs kyis nam mkha' gang ba sa bon de nyid du zhugs pa las gsung rdo rjer gyur pa'o//
translated: Having imagined a red syllable A on the path of speech, one imagines that the space is filled with a host of Speech Vajras, and that they enter into that very seed syllable, and one becomes Speech Vajra.

original: @106a * // aom w'a ka badzr'atma k'a:sarba dha rmma:w'a ka badzr'a tma ko& ham zhes brjod do //
analyzed: @106a * // aom w'a ka badzr'atma k'a:sarba dha rmma:w'a ka badzr'a tma ko& ham zhes brjod do //
translated: Oṃ, I am the vajra of speech, all dharmas are the vajra of speech.

original: snying gar h'um yig nag po bsams nas de las thugs rdo rje'i tshogs kyis nam mkha' gang ba sa bon de nyid du zhugs pa las thugs rdo rjer gyur pa'o //
analyzed: snying gar h'um yig nag po bsams nas de las thugs rdo rje'i tshogs kyis nam mkha' gang ba sa bon de nyid du zhugs pa las thugs rdo rjer gyur pa'o //
translated: Having contemplated a black syllable hūṃ at the heart, from that a host of mind vajras fills the sky, enters into that seed, and becomes the mind vajra.

original: aom tsatti badzr'atma k'a:sarba dharmma shtsatti badzr'a tma ko& ham zhes brjod do //
analyzed: aom tsatti badzr'atma k'a:sarba dharmma shtsatti badzr'a tma ko& ham zhes brjod do //
translated: Oṃ, I am the vajra of mind, all dharmas are the vajra of mind.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis sngags kyi le'ur yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis sngags kyi le'ur yang gsungs pa /
translated: The Blessed One also taught in the Mantra Chapter:

original: aom a'a:h'u% zhes pa sku dang gsung dang thugs byin gyis rlob pa'i sngags so zhes so //
analyzed: aom a'a:h'u% zhes pa sku dang gsung dang thugs byin gyis rlob pa'i sngags so zhes so //
translated: Oṃ āḥ hūṃ, the mantras for blessing body, speech, and mind.

original: rnal 'byor chen po zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin te 'di rnams kyi mthar thug pa ni dgod pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor chen po zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin te 'di rnams kyi mthar thug pa ni dgod pa'o //
translated: This is the meditative concentration called “great yoga.” These are the final ones, the placements.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma la ni dgod pa ji lta bur gyur pa de bzhin te rigs lnga'i cha shin tu lhag pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma la ni dgod pa ji lta bur gyur pa de bzhin te rigs lnga'i cha shin tu lhag pa'o //
translated: The Blessed Lady is just like the placement, with the five families in excess.

original: sngar gsungs pa'i rim pas he ru ka'i rnam pa bzhi po rnams kyi nang nas rang gi 'dod pa'i lha shes rab dang snyoms par zhugs pa'i bdag nyid sku mdog nag po 'jigs pa chen po zhe sdang gi bdag nyid can blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sngar gsungs pa'i rim pas he ru ka'i rnam pa bzhi po rnams kyi nang nas rang gi 'dod pa'i lha shes rab dang snyoms par zhugs pa'i bdag nyid sku mdog nag po 'jigs pa chen po zhe sdang gi bdag nyid can blta bar bya'o //
translated: One should see the form of one's chosen deity, the nature of which is the union of wisdom and method, as one of the four forms of Heruka, as previously explained, black in color, of the nature of hatred, and very frightening.

original: sngar gsungs pa'i rim pa ni /🔽sems dpa'i gzugs brnyan las byung ba'i //
analyzed: sngar gsungs pa'i rim pa ni / sems dpa'i gzugs brnyan las byung ba'i //
translated: The previously explained procedure is as follows:

original: dkyil 'khor dbang po bsgom par bya //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor dbang po bsgom par bya //
translated: The lord of the mandala should be visualized as arising from the reflection of the sattva,

original: zhes gsungs pa las so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa las so //
translated: as previously explained.

original: de nas 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rim pas mtshan ma la sogs pa can bsams nas dam tshig gsum brtsal bar bya ste /
analyzed: de nas 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rim pas mtshan ma la sogs pa can bsams nas dam tshig gsum brtsal bar bya ste /

original: de la bdag nyid dam tshig rdo rje 'dzin pa'i gzugs nyid do //
analyzed: de la bdag nyid dam tshig rdo rje 'dzin pa'i gzugs nyid do //
translated: In this regard, one's own form is that of the pledge-holder Vajradhara.

original: rang gi snying gar nyi ma la bdag nyid dam tshig pa bzhin du ye shes kyi dam tshig dang / de'i thugs kar ting nge 'dzin gyi dam tshig yi ge h'u% bsam par bya'o zhes pa zhe sdang gi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: rang gi snying gar nyi ma la bdag nyid dam tshig pa bzhin du ye shes kyi dam tshig dang / de'i thugs kar ting nge 'dzin gyi dam tshig yi ge h'u% bsam par bya'o zhes pa zhe sdang gi bdag nyid do //
translated: In one's heart, on a sun [disc], is the pledge-being, like oneself, and in its heart, on a sun [disc], is the gnosis-being, the letter hūṃ.

original: de ltar dam tshig gsum gyi bdag nyid du gyur nas rigs lnga'i cha dang ldan par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar dam tshig gsum gyi bdag nyid du gyur nas rigs lnga'i cha dang ldan par bya'o //
translated: Thus, having become the embodiment of the three pledges, one should be endowed with the parts of the five clans.

original: shes rab rnyed nas mi g-yo zhing //
analyzed: shes rab rnyed nas mi g-yo zhing //
translated: Having attained wisdom, one is unmoving,

original: sgrub po la gus mnyen gshin pa //
analyzed: sgrub po la gus mnyen gshin pa //
translated: respectful to the adept, gentle,

original: sems can kun phan tshol ba can //
analyzed: sems can kun phan tshol ba can //
translated: seeking the welfare of all sentient beings,

original: mtshan rnams kun dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan rnams kun dang ldan pa'o //
translated: and endowed with all the marks.

original: de'i mgo bor aom yig dang / snying khar h'u% yig dang / lte bar sv'a yig dang / brla zung la a'a:yig dang / rkang pa dag la h'a yig kyang dgod do //
analyzed: de'i mgo bor aom yig dang / snying khar h'u% yig dang / lte bar sv'a yig dang / brla zung la a'a:yig dang / rkang pa dag la h'a yig kyang dgod do //
translated: On one's head is the letter oṃ, in one's heart the letter hūṃ, in one's navel the letter svā, on one's two thighs the letter āḥ, and on one's two feet the letter ha.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma'i yan lag dgong pa yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma'i yan lag dgong pa yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: One should also recite the limbs of the Blessed Lady.

original: gzugs phung rdo rje mar ni gyur //
analyzed: gzugs phung rdo rje mar ni gyur //
translated: The form aggregate becomes Vajrī,

original: tshor ba la ni dkar mor dran //
analyzed: tshor ba la ni dkar mor dran //
translated: and feeling is remembered as Pāṇḍaravāsinī.

original: 'du shes chu yi @106b rnal 'byor ma //
analyzed: 'du shes chu yi @106b rnal 'byor ma //

analyzed: 'du byed rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma // rnam shes phung po'i tshul gyis ni //
translated: Formation is the Vajraḍākinī,🔽And consciousness is Nairātmyāyoginī,

original: bdag med rnal 'byor ma gnas so //
analyzed: bdag med rnal 'byor ma gnas so //
translated: In the manner of the aggregates.

original: sa ni pukka s'ir bshad do //
analyzed: sa ni pukka s'ir bshad do //
translated: Earth is said to be Pukkasī,

original: chu khams ri khrod ma ru dran //
analyzed: chu khams ri khrod ma ru dran //
translated: The water element is remembered as Rūpiṇī,

original: me ni gtum mor shes par bya //
analyzed: me ni gtum mor shes par bya //
translated: Fire is known as Caṇḍālī,

original: rlung ni g-yung mor rab tu grags //
analyzed: rlung ni g-yung mor rab tu grags //
translated: And wind is renowned as Ḍombinī.

original: gzugs la dkar mor rtag tu bshad //
analyzed: gzugs la dkar mor rtag tu bshad //
translated: Form is always explained as “the white one,”

original: sgra la chom rkun ma rab grags //🔽dri yi cha la ro langs ma //
analyzed: sgra la chom rkun ma rab grags // dri yi cha la ro langs ma //
translated: Sound is renowned as “the thief,”🔽The part of smell is Vetālī,

original: ro la ghasma r'i rab grags //
analyzed: ro la ghasma r'i rab grags //
translated: And taste is renowned as Ghasmarī.

original: reg las spyod mar bshad de //
analyzed: reg las spyod mar bshad de //
translated: Touch is explained as “the one who practices,”

original: chos kyi khams la mkha' spyod ma /🔽de ltar 'di rnams kyi sa bon yang dag par dgod par byas nas padma dang rdo rje'i byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi khams la mkha' spyod ma / de ltar 'di rnams kyi sa bon yang dag par dgod par byas nas padma dang rdo rje'i byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: And the element of phenomena is Khecarī.🔽Having thus correctly placed the seed syllables, one should perform the consecration of the lotus and vajra.

original: aa:yig gis padma dga' ba sbyin par byed par bsams nas padma'i mdzod kyi ze'u 'bru'i bu gar h'u% yig rnam par bsam par bya /
analyzed: aa:yig gis padma dga' ba sbyin par byed par bsams nas padma'i mdzod kyi ze'u 'bru'i bu gar h'u% yig rnam par bsam par bya /
translated: Visualizing the syllable Aḥ, one should imagine the lotus as the giver of pleasure, and in the center of the anthers of the lotus, one should imagine the syllable Hūṃ.

original: de'i rjes su h'u% yig las byung ba'i rdo rje bsgom par bya zhing de'i nor bu'i bu gar h'u% yig bsams nas slar yang /
analyzed: de'i rjes su h'u% yig las byung ba'i rdo rje bsgom par bya zhing de'i nor bu'i bu gar h'u% yig bsams nas slar yang /
translated: Then one should consecrate it with the mantra:

original: aom padma su kh'a dha ra ma h'a r'a ga sukhanda da /
analyzed: aom padma su kh'a dha ra ma h'a r'a ga sukhanda da /
translated: Oṃ, holder of the lotus vagina, great passion, with four joys,

original: tsa tu r'a nanda bha ga bi shva h'u% h'u% karyam ku ru shva me /
analyzed: tsa tu r'a nanda bha ga bi shva h'u% h'u% karyam ku ru shva me /

original: aom badzra ma h'a dve sha tsa tu r'a nanda d'a ya ka kha ga mu khee ga ra so n'a tha h'u% h'u% k'a ryam ku ru shva me zhes pa'i sngags kyis byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: aom badzra ma h'a dve sha tsa tu r'a nanda d'a ya ka kha ga mu khee ga ra so n'a tha h'u% h'u% k'a ryam ku ru shva me zhes pa'i sngags kyis byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: Oṃ, great wrathful vajra, with four joys, with a mouth of khagamukha, with a garland of human heads, hūṃ hūṃ, accomplish your activity for me.

original: phyi rol du phyag rgya med na yid kyis sprul pa'i phyag rgya rnyed nas de yang rigs lnga'i cha dang ldan pa'i rim pa dang po nyid du byas nas /
analyzed: phyi rol du phyag rgya med na yid kyis sprul pa'i phyag rgya rnyed nas de yang rigs lnga'i cha dang ldan pa'i rim pa dang po nyid du byas nas /

original: rjes su chags pa brtsam par bya'o //
analyzed: rjes su chags pa brtsam par bya'o //

analyzed: gsung rdo rje'i nga rgyal gyis h'u% yig brjod de rdo rje g-yo bar bya'o //

translated: In the eight lotus-vessels held in the eight right hands, in due order, are an elephant, a horse, a donkey, an ox, a camel, a man, a śarabha, and a cat.

original: de bzhin du sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / zla ba dang / nyi ma dang / gshin rje dang / nor sbyin rnams kyang g-yon gyi padma'i snod brgyad po rnams su rim pas shes par bya'o //

translated: Similarly, in the eight lotus-vessels of the left hands, in due order, are Earth, Water, Fire, Wind, Moon, Sun, Yama, and Kubera.

original: glo dang de bzhin dbugs mi bde //
analyzed: glo dang de bzhin dbugs mi bde //
translated: The eight afflictions are: cough, and likewise shortness of breath,

original: smyo zad mdze dang rkang bam dang // mcher ba mchin pa'i rang bzhin gyis//
analyzed: smyo zad mdze dang rkang bam dang // mcher ba mchin pa'i rang bzhin gyis//
translated: insanity, consumption, leprosy, elephantiasis, and spleen-disease.

original: thams cad 'di nyid rab tu grags //🔽zhes pa nyon mongs pa brgyad rnam par dag pa las glang po che la sogs pa 'dzin pa rnams so //
analyzed: thams cad 'di nyid rab tu grags // zhes pa nyon mongs pa brgyad rnam par dag pa las glang po che la sogs pa 'dzin pa rnams so //
translated: All of these are well-known.

original: sa la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa nas /
translated: From the purification of the eight afflictions, the holders of the elephant and so forth arise.🔽From the purification of the eight planets, the eight planets arise.

original: nor sbyin gyi bar du ni dbang phyug brgyad rnam par dag pas so //
analyzed: nor sbyin gyi bar du ni dbang phyug brgyad rnam par dag pas so //
translated: up to the giving of wealth, by means of the eight masteries.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:🔽The mastery of body, the mastery of speech,

original: sku yi dbang phyug gsung gi dbang phyug @107b dang ; / de bzhin kho nar thugs kyi dbang phyug kyang //
analyzed: sku yi dbang phyug gsung gi dbang phyug @107b dang ; / de bzhin kho nar thugs kyi dbang phyug kyang //
translated: and likewise the mastery of mind,🔽the mastery of miracles, the mastery of action,

original: rdzu 'phrul dang ni kun 'gro'i dbang phyug dang // 'dod dang byed po yon tan brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul dang ni kun 'gro'i dbang phyug dang // 'dod dang byed po yon tan brgyad pa'o //
translated: the mastery of desire, and the mastery of qualities.

original: sku mtha' yas pa ni sku'i dbang phyug go //
analyzed: sku mtha' yas pa ni sku'i dbang phyug go //
translated: The mastery of body is the infinite body.

original: thams cad kyi skad du smra ba ni gsung gi dbang phyug go //
analyzed: thams cad kyi skad du smra ba ni gsung gi dbang phyug go //
translated: The mastery of speech is the ability to speak all languages.

original: sems can thams cad kyi sems shes pa ni thugs kyi dbang phyug go //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sems shes pa ni thugs kyi dbang phyug go //
translated: The mastery of mind is the knowledge of the minds of all beings.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyis mtha' yas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams lta ba ni rdzu 'phrul gyi dbang phyug go //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyis mtha' yas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams lta ba ni rdzu 'phrul gyi dbang phyug go //
translated: The mastery of miracles is the ability to see infinite world systems by means of miracles.

original: 'jig rten gsum po gcig pa'i sku ni kun du 'gro ba'i dbang phyug go //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum po gcig pa'i sku ni kun du 'gro ba'i dbang phyug go //
translated: The mastery of action is the ability to manifest one's body in all three worlds.

original: a'atstshi'i sgras ni 'dod pa gsungs te /
analyzed: a'atstshi'i sgras ni 'dod pa gsungs te /
translated: The mastery of desire is the ability to fulfill all desires.🔽The mastery of qualities is the ability to fulfill all actions.

original: 'dod pas sems can rnams kyi bde ba chen po skyed par byed pa ni 'dod pa'i dbang phyug go //
analyzed: 'dod pas sems can rnams kyi bde ba chen po skyed par byed pa ni 'dod pa'i dbang phyug go //
translated: The lord of desire is the one who generates the great bliss of all sentient beings through desire.

original: byed pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po zhes byed po'i dbang phyug go //
analyzed: byed pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po zhes byed po'i dbang phyug go //
translated: The lord of action is the one who is called Great Vajradhara.

original: lha'i rnam pas spyod pa ni yon tan gyi dbang phyug go //
analyzed: lha'i rnam pas spyod pa ni yon tan gyi dbang phyug go //
translated: The lord of qualities is the one who acts with the form of a god.

original: padma'i snod ni snying rje'i cha rnam par dag pa las yin la /
analyzed: padma'i snod ni snying rje'i cha rnam par dag pa las yin la /
translated: The lotus vessel is from the purity of the aspect of compassion.

original: phyag rnams ni stong pa nyid rnam par dag pa las te /
analyzed: phyag rnams ni stong pa nyid rnam par dag pa las te /
translated: The hands are from the purity of emptiness.

original: 'dis ni stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa nyid du rig par byas so //
analyzed: 'dis ni stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa nyid du rig par byas so //
translated: By this, one should understand the inseparability of emptiness and compassion.

original: byams pa'i thugs las yan lag gnag /🔽zhal brgyad rnam par thar pa brgyad //
analyzed: byams pa'i thugs las yan lag gnag / zhal brgyad rnam par thar pa brgyad //
translated: The limbs are black from the mind of love.

original: rnam par dag pa las te /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa las te /
translated: The eight faces are from the purity of the eight liberations.🔽The four fangs are from the purity of the four immeasurables.

original: sdang ba sgrub par byed pa'i don du zhal dang po ni nag po'o //
analyzed: sdang ba sgrub par byed pa'i don du zhal dang po ni nag po'o //
translated: The first face is black for the purpose of accomplishing hatred.

original: dbang gi don du g-yon pa dmar po'o//
analyzed: dbang gi don du g-yon pa dmar po'o//
translated: The left is red for the purpose of subjugation.

original: g-yas kyi dkar po ni zhi ba sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: g-yas kyi dkar po ni zhi ba sgrub pa'o //
translated: The right is white for the purpose of pacification.

original: zhe sdang la sogs pa byung ba rnam par nyams pa'i don du steng gi zhal ni rnam par gtsigs pa du ba'i mdog go //
analyzed: zhe sdang la sogs pa byung ba rnam par nyams pa'i don du steng gi zhal ni rnam par gtsigs pa du ba'i mdog go //
translated: The upper face is wrathful, the color of smoke, for the purpose of destroying the arising of hatred, etc.

original: bdud bzhi rnam par gzhom pa'i don du slar g-yas g-yon gyi zhal gnyis gnyis nag po ste /
analyzed: bdud bzhi rnam par gzhom pa'i don du slar g-yas g-yon gyi zhal gnyis gnyis nag po ste /
translated: The two faces on the right and left are black for the purpose of destroying the four Maras.

original: zhal thams cad nyid mche ba gtsigs pa /
analyzed: zhal thams cad nyid mche ba gtsigs pa /
translated: All the faces have bared fangs.

original: 'khyog po'i smin ma dang bcas pa //🔽'jigs pa'i dus kyi me 'bar ba //
analyzed: 'khyog po'i smin ma dang bcas pa // 'jigs pa'i dus kyi me 'bar ba //
translated: They have crooked eyebrows.🔽They are the blazing fire of the time of destruction.

original: 'khrug pa'i 'od can 'jigs pa chen po ste //
analyzed: 'khrug pa'i 'od can 'jigs pa chen po ste //
translated: They have the light of destruction, and are of great terror,

original: khro bo bdag nyid can nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: khro bo bdag nyid can nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because of their nature of wrath.

original: zhal so sor dmar zhing zlum pa'i spyan gsum ste snying rje las ni dmar po nyid do //
analyzed: zhal so sor dmar zhing zlum pa'i spyan gsum ste snying rje las ni dmar po nyid do //
translated: Each face has three eyes, red and round, because of compassion.

original: rdo rje gsum gyi spyan gsum gyis /
analyzed: rdo rje gsum gyi spyan gsum gyis /
translated: The three eyes of the three vajras

original: dus gsum yongs su shes pa las ni spyan gsum nyid do //
analyzed: dus gsum yongs su shes pa las ni spyan gsum nyid do //
translated: are the three eyes because of the knowledge of the three times.

original: de ltar nyi shu rtsa bzhis byug pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar nyi shu rtsa bzhis byug pa'o //
translated: Thus, there are twenty-four ornaments.

original: dar dpyang bcings shing gyen du brdzes pa'i skra ni ser skya ste 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa ma lus pa sreg par byed pa'i phyir ro //🔽'gro @108a * //
analyzed: dar dpyang bcings shing gyen du brdzes pa'i skra ni ser skya ste 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa ma lus pa sreg par byed pa'i phyir ro // 'gro @108a * //
translated: The hair is tawny, bound up, and stands erect, because it burns up all the afflictions such as passion, etc.

original: ba'i don byed pa'i phyir spyi bor sna tshogs rdo rjes mtshan pa'o //
analyzed: ba'i don byed pa'i phyir spyi bor sna tshogs rdo rjes mtshan pa'o //
translated: The head is marked with a vajra cross on top, because it acts for the welfare of the world.

original: phung po lnga po rnams kyi rang bzhin med pa nyid rtogs par bya ba'i phyir du dpral ba'i steng du mgo bo skam po lnga'i phreng bas brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: phung po lnga po rnams kyi rang bzhin med pa nyid rtogs par bya ba'i phyir du dpral ba'i steng du mgo bo skam po lnga'i phreng bas brgyan pa'o //
translated: On the forehead, there is a garland of five dry heads, in order to realize the essencelessness of the five aggregates.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga rnam par dag pa las 'khor lo dang rna rgyan dang / mgul rgyan dang / ska rags te phyag rgya lnga dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga rnam par dag pa las 'khor lo dang rna rgyan dang / mgul rgyan dang / ska rags te phyag rgya lnga dang ldan pa'o //
translated: From the purity of the five Tathāgatas, there are the five symbolic implements: the wheel, the earring, the necklace, and the girdle.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' rnam par dag pa las thal ba yang ngo zhes pa phyag rgya drug tu rab tu grags so //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' rnam par dag pa las thal ba yang ngo zhes pa phyag rgya drug tu rab tu grags so //
translated: From the purity of Vajrasattva, there is the ash. Thus, the six symbolic implements are well known.

original: chos thams cad la dmigs pa med pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir du yang dag par rdzogs pa'i ye shes rnam par dag pa las gcer bu'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad la dmigs pa med pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir du yang dag par rdzogs pa'i ye shes rnam par dag pa las gcer bu'o //
translated: He is naked from the perfectly accomplished, pure intuition which is to be realized as the non-objectification of all things.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis zhabs bzhi'o //
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis zhabs bzhi'o //
translated: He has four feet from the four means of gathering disciples.

original: byang chub kyi sems shin tu thob pa'i phyir nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la zhabs gnyis kyis skyil krung phyed pa t'a na da pa'i stabs 'chang ba nyid do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems shin tu thob pa'i phyir nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la zhabs gnyis kyis skyil krung phyed pa t'a na da pa'i stabs 'chang ba nyid do //
translated: He has two feet in the half-lotus posture on the sun-disc, because of the attainment of the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: 'di nyid khams gsum po ma lus pa gcig pa'i skur rtogs par bya ba'i phyir zhabs kyi mthe bong gcig pu btsugs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid khams gsum po ma lus pa gcig pa'i skur rtogs par bya ba'i phyir zhabs kyi mthe bong gcig pu btsugs pa'o //
translated: He has one big toe, because of the realization of the entire three worlds as one body.

original: de lta bu kho nar bgegs rnam par nyams pa las g-yon bskum pa'i zhabs 'chang ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bu kho nar bgegs rnam par nyams pa las g-yon bskum pa'i zhabs 'chang ba'o //

translated: The nine flavors of dance are🔽grace, valor, ugliness,

analyzed: khro gnyer gtsigs pa nyid ni mi sdug pa'o //

original: 'bar ba'i 'od nyid ni drag shul lo //

original: zhal rnam par rgyas pa nyid ni rgod pa'o //
analyzed: zhal rnam par rgyas pa nyid ni rgod pa'o //

analyzed: mgo bo rlon pa'i phreng ba nyid ni 'jigs su rung ba'o //
translated: ferocity, violence, fear,🔽compassion, wonder, and peace.

analyzed: sems can rjes su 'dzin pas sems nyid ni snying rje'o //

analyzed: sgyu ma'i gzugs nyid ni ngo mtshar ba'o //
translated: The form is a wonder, because it is an illusory form.
