analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa nyid ni zhi ba ste de rnams dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is peaceful, because it is free from the afflictions of passion and so on.

original: brgyad gnyis kyi lo'i rnam pas rol pa'i sku bdag med ma dang snyoms par zhugs pa'i bcom @108b ldan 'das su bdag nyid blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: brgyad gnyis kyi lo'i rnam pas rol pa'i sku bdag med ma dang snyoms par zhugs pa'i bcom @108b ldan 'das su bdag nyid blta bar bya'o //
translated: One should visualize oneself as the Bhagavān, in union with the Nairātmya of the Playful Body, in the form of an eight-year-old girl.

original: bcom ldan 'das ji lta ba ltar bcom ldan 'das ma yang ste 'on kyang phyag lnga lnga dang ldan pa'i mi mgo skam po'i phreng bas brgyan pa'i sku lha dang lha ma yin gyi khrag gis gang ba'i thod pa phyag g-yon na 'dzin pa nyon mongs pa ma
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji lta ba ltar bcom ldan 'das ma yang ste 'on kyang phyag lnga lnga dang ldan pa'i mi mgo skam po'i phreng bas brgyan pa'i sku lha dang lha ma yin gyi khrag gis gang ba'i thod pa phyag g-yon na 'dzin pa nyon mongs pa ma
translated: The Bhagavatī is like the Bhagavān, but she has five faces and is adorned with a garland of dry human skulls, and in her left hand she holds a skull-cup filled with the blood of gods and demigods.

original: lus pa gcod pa'i phyir gri gug 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: lus pa gcod pa'i phyir gri gug 'dzin pa'o //
translated: She holds a flaying knife in order to cut through all the afflictions.

original: khams gsum pa gcig pa'i ngor gtogs par bya ba'i phyir du zhal gcig ma /
analyzed: khams gsum pa gcig pa'i ngor gtogs par bya ba'i phyir du zhal gcig ma /
translated: She has one face in order to be included in the single essence of the three realms.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi smad kyi ro yang dag par myang bar byed pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi smad kyi ro yang dag par myang bar byed pa /
translated: She is the Bhagavat's lower lip, the experiencer of the taste.

original: zhabs g-yon brkyang bas mchog tu bde ba chen po'i dga' bas bcom ldan 'das dang snyoms par zhugs par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: zhabs g-yon brkyang bas mchog tu bde ba chen po'i dga' bas bcom ldan 'das dang snyoms par zhugs par bsam par bya'o //
translated: She is imagined to be in union with the Bhagavat, with her left leg extended, with the joy of supreme great bliss.🔽He is Hevajra with six faces and six arms, with three eyes, and with a garland of heads.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug rnam par dag pas kye rdo rje phyag drug pa ste zhal gsum pa rtsa ba'i zhal nag po //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug rnam par dag pas kye rdo rje phyag drug pa ste zhal gsum pa rtsa ba'i zhal nag po //
translated: He is the purification of the six perfections.🔽His principal face is black,

original: g-yon dmar po //🔽g-yon gyi phyag gnyis dag gis rtse gsum dang rdo rje dril bu 'dzin pa /🔽g-yas kyi phyag gnyis dag gis rdo rje dang gri gug 'dzin pa /
analyzed: g-yon dmar po // g-yon gyi phyag gnyis dag gis rtse gsum dang rdo rje dril bu 'dzin pa / g-yas kyi phyag gnyis dag gis rdo rje dang gri gug 'dzin pa /
translated: his left red,🔽and his right white.🔽He holds a trident and a vajra-bell with his two left hands,🔽and a vajra and a flaying knife with his two right hands.

original: phyag lhag ma dag gis gri gug dang thod par bcas pas rdo rje lcags sgrog ma la snyoms par zhugs pa ro mnan pa blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyag lhag ma dag gis gri gug dang thod par bcas pas rdo rje lcags sgrog ma la snyoms par zhugs pa ro mnan pa blta bar bya'o //
translated: He is imagined to be in union with Vajra-Hook, holding a flaying knife and a skull-cup with his remaining two hands, standing on corpses, and looking at Vajra-Hook.

original: yang bdud bzhi rnam par dag pa las kye'i rdo rje phyag bzhi pa ste g-yas kyis rdo rje 'dzin pa g-yon gyis thod khrag / phyag lhag ma dag gis rdo rje phag mo la snyoms par zhugs pa /
analyzed: yang bdud bzhi rnam par dag pa las kye'i rdo rje phyag bzhi pa ste g-yas kyis rdo rje 'dzin pa g-yon gyis thod khrag / phyag lhag ma dag gis rdo rje phag mo la snyoms par zhugs pa /
translated: He holds a vajra in the right hand and a skull filled with blood in the left hand, and the remaining two hands embrace Vajravārāhī.

original: zhal gcig pa ro mnan pa bsam par bya'o //🔽yang kye rdo rje phyag gnyis pa ni g-yon gyis thod pa dang kha tv'am ga /
analyzed: zhal gcig pa ro mnan pa bsam par bya'o // yang kye rdo rje phyag gnyis pa ni g-yon gyis thod pa dang kha tv'am ga /
translated: He has one face and tramples on Bhairava.

original: g-yas kyis 'bar ba'i rdo rje ro mnan pa blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: g-yas kyis 'bar ba'i rdo rje ro mnan pa blta bar bya'o //
translated: Again, the two-faced Hevajra holds a skull and khaṭvāṅga in the left hand and a blazing vajra in the right hand.🔽He tramples on Bhairava.

original: phyag drug pa la sogs pa 'di rnams kyi shes rab ma ni rdo rje ma ste /
analyzed: phyag drug pa la sogs pa 'di rnams kyi shes rab ma ni rdo rje ma ste /
translated: The wisdom consort of these six-faced and so forth is Vajrī.

original: lhag ma ni phyag bcu drug pa bzhin te sku mdog dang rgyan la sogs pa dang h'u% las byung ba la sogs pa'i gzugs su blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni phyag bcu drug pa bzhin te sku mdog dang rgyan la sogs pa dang h'u% las byung ba la sogs pa'i gzugs su blta bar bya'o //
translated: The rest is like the sixteen-faced one, except that one should view the form as arisen from hūṃ and so forth, with the color, ornaments, and so forth.

original: de bzhin du rdo rje lcags sgrog ma la sogs pa rnams kyi yang bdag med ma bzhin te ming tsam tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rdo rje lcags sgrog ma la sogs pa rnams kyi yang bdag med ma bzhin te ming tsam tha dad pa'o //
translated: Similarly, Vajrāṅkuśī and so forth are like Nairātmya, except for the mere difference in name.

original: thams cad kha tv'am gal 'khyud pas gnas pa ni thams cad kyi yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad kha tv'am gal 'khyud pas gnas pa ni thams cad kyi yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: One should view all of them as abiding in the embrace of the male and female deities.

original: de ltar gyur pa'i bcom ldan 'das rang gi 'dod pa'i lha'i rnam par bsams nas bsrub cing bsrub pa'i sbyor ba las lha mo'i 'khor lo gang yin pa thog mar dbyung bar bya @109a * //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa'i bcom ldan 'das rang gi 'dod pa'i lha'i rnam par bsams nas bsrub cing bsrub pa'i sbyor ba las lha mo'i 'khor lo gang yin pa thog mar dbyung bar bya @109a * //
translated: Having contemplated the Bhagavān in this way in the form of one’s chosen deity, one should first generate the circle of goddesses from the union of the churning and the churned.

original: ste / de la shar la sogs pa'i phyogs dang sku mdog dang mtshan ma la sogs pa'i rim pa ni rnam par dag pa'i sgo nas rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: ste / de la shar la sogs pa'i phyogs dang sku mdog dang mtshan ma la sogs pa'i rim pa ni rnam par dag pa'i sgo nas rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The order of the colors, hand implements, and so on of the deities in the east and so on should be understood in terms of their purity.

original: de la shar gyi sgor gdul bya bdud kyi sems can sad par bya ba'i ga% yig las skyes pa'i goo r'i nag po'o //
analyzed: de la shar gyi sgor gdul bya bdud kyi sems can sad par bya ba'i ga% yig las skyes pa'i goo r'i nag po'o //
translated: In this regard, at the eastern gate is black Gaurī, born from the syllable ga, in order to awaken the beings of the desire realm.

original: log par lta ba gcod par byed pa'i phyir g-yas kyi phyag na gri gug 'dzin pa /
analyzed: log par lta ba gcod par byed pa'i phyir g-yas kyi phyag na gri gug 'dzin pa /
translated: She holds a flaying knife in her right hand in order to sever wrong views.

original: 'khor ba'i bag chags nyams par bya ba'i phyir g-yon pas nya ro hi ta 'dzin pa /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i bag chags nyams par bya ba'i phyir g-yon pas nya ro hi ta 'dzin pa /
translated: She holds a rohita fish in her left hand in order to destroy the latent tendencies of saṃsāra.

original: tshangs pa mnan pa /
analyzed: tshangs pa mnan pa /
translated: She tramples Brahmā.

original: gzugs kyi phung po'i rang bzhin du bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po'i rang bzhin du bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should contemplate her as the nature of the aggregate of form.

original: lhor gdul bya 'dod chags kyi sems can sad par bya ba'i phyir tsam yig las chom rkun ma sku mdog dmar mo'o //
analyzed: lhor gdul bya 'dod chags kyi sems can sad par bya ba'i phyir tsam yig las chom rkun ma sku mdog dmar mo'o //
translated: In the south, in order to awaken passionate sentient beings to be tamed, from the syllable caṃ, Caṇḍālī is red in color.

original: shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid can rtogs par bya ba'i phyir g-yas na cang te'u 'dzin pa /
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid can rtogs par bya ba'i phyir g-yas na cang te'u 'dzin pa /
translated: In order to realize the nature of wisdom and method, she holds a ḍamaru in her right hand.

original: gti mug gzhom pa'i don du g-yon na phag pa 'dzin pa /
analyzed: gti mug gzhom pa'i don du g-yon na phag pa 'dzin pa /
translated: In order to conquer delusion, she holds a pig in her left hand.

original: brgya byin mnan pa tshor ba'i phung po'i rang bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: brgya byin mnan pa tshor ba'i phung po'i rang bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: One should view her as the nature of the aggregate of feeling, with Indra beneath her feet.

original: nub tu sems can rnams kyi rgyas pa'i don du bam yig las skyes pa'i ro langs ma gser gyi mdog can no //
analyzed: nub tu sems can rnams kyi rgyas pa'i don du bam yig las skyes pa'i ro langs ma gser gyi mdog can no //
translated: In the west, in order to increase sentient beings, from the syllable vaṃ, Pukkasī is golden in color.

original: stong pa nyid rtogs par bya ba'i phyir g-yas na rus sbal 'dzin pa /
analyzed: stong pa nyid rtogs par bya ba'i phyir g-yas na rus sbal 'dzin pa /
translated: In order to realize emptiness, she holds a tortoise in her right hand.

original: snying rje'i rang bzhin rtogs par bya ba'i phyir g-yon na padma'i snod 'dzin pa nye dbang la zhon pa 'du shes kyi phung po'i rang bzhin du rnam par brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: snying rje'i rang bzhin rtogs par bya ba'i phyir g-yon na padma'i snod 'dzin pa nye dbang la zhon pa 'du shes kyi phung po'i rang bzhin du rnam par brtag par bya'o //
translated: In order to realize the nature of compassion, one should visualize the aggregate of perception as the god Indra, holding a lotus vessel in his left hand, riding on an elephant, and holding a snake in his right hand.

original: byang du mngon spyod kyi las rab tu bsgrub pa'i don du gham las skyes pa'i za nus ma nor bu ma rgad lta bu'o //🔽zhe sdang rnam par dag pa las g-yas na sbrul 'dzin pa shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid khong du chud pa'i don du g-yon pas rnal 'byor lhung bzed 'dzin pa /
analyzed: byang du mngon spyod kyi las rab tu bsgrub pa'i don du gham las skyes pa'i za nus ma nor bu ma rgad lta bu'o // zhe sdang rnam par dag pa las g-yas na sbrul 'dzin pa shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid khong du chud pa'i don du g-yon pas rnal 'byor lhung bzed 'dzin pa /
translated: In the north, in order to accomplish the activity of wrath, one should visualize Pukkasī born from the syllable ghaṃ, with a body like a coral tree.

original: drag po la zhon pa 'du byed kyi phung po'i rang bzhin du bsgom par bya'o //🔽dbang ldan du rmugs pa'i las rab tu rtogs pa'i phyir du pam las skyes pa'i pukka s'i sku mdog sngon mo'o //
analyzed: drag po la zhon pa 'du byed kyi phung po'i rang bzhin du bsgom par bya'o // dbang ldan du rmugs pa'i las rab tu rtogs pa'i phyir du pam las skyes pa'i pukka s'i sku mdog sngon mo'o //
translated: In order to realize the nature of wisdom and method, one should visualize the aggregate of formation as Rudra, holding a snake in his right hand, holding a yogin's alms bowl in his left hand, riding on Rudra, and holding a lion in his right hand.

original: nga rgyal rnam par sbyang ba'i don du yang g-yas seng ge 'dzin pa /
analyzed: nga rgyal rnam par sbyang ba'i don du yang g-yas seng ge 'dzin pa /
translated: In order to purify anger, one should visualize the aggregate of consciousness as Caṇḍālī born from the syllable aṃ, with a blue body, holding a sword in her right hand, and holding a skull cup in her left hand.🔽In order to purify pride, one should visualize Caṇḍālī born from the syllable aṃ, with a blue body, holding a sword in her right hand, and holding a skull cup in her left hand.

original: bdud kyi sde rnam par 'joms pa'i phyir dang mi mdza' ba ma lus pa gcod pa'i phyir du g-yon pas dgra sta 'dzin pa /
analyzed: bdud kyi sde rnam par 'joms pa'i phyir dang mi mdza' ba ma lus pa gcod pa'i phyir du g-yon pas dgra sta 'dzin pa /
translated: He holds an axe in his left hand in order to destroy the army of demons and to cut down all enemies.

original: gshin rje mnan nas /
analyzed: gshin rje mnan nas /
translated: He tramples on Yama,

original: sa'i khams kyi rang bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sa'i khams kyi rang bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: and should be known to have the nature of the earth element.

original: mer zhi @109b ba'i sems can rab tu sad par byed pa'i phyir du sha% yig las skyes pa'i sha ba r'i dkar mo'o //
analyzed: mer zhi @109b ba'i sems can rab tu sad par byed pa'i phyir du sha% yig las skyes pa'i sha ba r'i dkar mo'o //
translated: In the southeast, in order to awaken the beings who are asleep, from the syllable śa arises the white Śarabha.

original: me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga po rnams rab tu sad par byed pa'i phyir du g-yas na dge slong 'dzin pa /
analyzed: me long lta bu la sogs pa'i ye shes lnga po rnams rab tu sad par byed pa'i phyir du g-yas na dge slong 'dzin pa /
translated: He holds a monk in his right hand in order to awaken the five gnoses, such as the mirror-like gnosis, and so on.

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes khong du chud pa'i phyir du g-yon na 'khar gsil 'dzin pa /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes khong du chud pa'i phyir du g-yon na 'khar gsil 'dzin pa /
translated: He holds a khaṭvāṅga in his left hand in order to realize nondual gnosis.

original: lus ngan la zhon pa /
analyzed: lus ngan la zhon pa /
translated: He rides on a dwarf,

original: chu'i khams kyi rang bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: chu'i khams kyi rang bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: and should be seen to have the nature of the water element.

original: bden bral du rengs pa rab tu bsgrub pa'i don du tsam yig las skyes pa'i gtum mo nam mkha' sngo bsangs ma'o //
analyzed: bden bral du rengs pa rab tu bsgrub pa'i don du tsam yig las skyes pa'i gtum mo nam mkha' sngo bsangs ma'o //
translated: In the southwest, in order to accomplish paralysis, from the syllable ca arises Caṇḍālī, the dark blue sky.

original: dregs pa'i sems can rab tu sad par byed pa'i phyir du yang g-yas na 'khor lo 'dzin pa /
analyzed: dregs pa'i sems can rab tu sad par byed pa'i phyir du yang g-yas na 'khor lo 'dzin pa /
translated: In order to awaken the haughty beings, he holds a wheel in his right hand.

original: the tshom gyi shes pa'i cha gcod pa'i phyir dang mi shes pa'i dri ma rtsa ba nas med pa'i don du g-yon pas gshol 'dzin pa /
analyzed: the tshom gyi shes pa'i cha gcod pa'i phyir dang mi shes pa'i dri ma rtsa ba nas med pa'i don du g-yon pas gshol 'dzin pa /
translated: In order to cut through the part of the mind that is doubt and to eliminate the stain of ignorance, he holds a plow in his left hand.

original: srin po mnan pa /
analyzed: srin po mnan pa /
translated: He tramples on a rākṣasa.

original: me'i khams kyi rang bzhin du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: me'i khams kyi rang bzhin du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: He should be contemplated as having the nature of the fire element.

original: rlung du don sna tshogs pa so sor rtogs pa'i phyir du da% yig las skyes pa'i dombi n'i sna tshogs mdog go //
analyzed: rlung du don sna tshogs pa so sor rtogs pa'i phyir du da% yig las skyes pa'i dombi n'i sna tshogs mdog go //
translated: In the wind [direction], from the syllable ya, is the multicolored Vāyuḍombinī, who is multicolored in order to realize the various objects.

original: bsam pa ma rungs pa'i skye bo rab tu sad pa'i phyir dang mi phyed pa'i ye shes rtogs pa'i phyir du g-yas pas 'bar ba'i rdo rje 'dzin pa /
analyzed: bsam pa ma rungs pa'i skye bo rab tu sad pa'i phyir dang mi phyed pa'i ye shes rtogs pa'i phyir du g-yas pas 'bar ba'i rdo rje 'dzin pa /
translated: In order to awaken the wicked beings and in order to realize indivisible gnosis, he holds a blazing vajra in his right hand.

original: gdug pa ma lus pa bsdigs pa'i phyir du g-yon pas sdigs mdzub 'dzin pa /
analyzed: gdug pa ma lus pa bsdigs pa'i phyir du g-yon pas sdigs mdzub 'dzin pa /
translated: In order to threaten all the wicked, he holds up a threatening forefinger in his left hand.

original: thags bzangs ris la mnyam par zhon pa /
analyzed: thags bzangs ris la mnyam par zhon pa /
translated: He is mounted on a multicolored snake.

original: rlung gi khams kyi rang bzhin du bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: rlung gi khams kyi rang bzhin du bsam par bya'o //
translated: He should be contemplated as having the nature of the wind element.

original: ye shes kyi phyag rgya'i phyogs la bdag med ma yang slar rje btsun la phyung ba'i rjes su gzhug cing zhugs par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi phyag rgya'i phyogs la bdag med ma yang slar rje btsun la phyung ba'i rjes su gzhug cing zhugs par bsam par bya'o //
translated: In the case of the knowledge seal, one should imagine that one is following the sequence of the emergence of Nairātmya from the Lord, and that she has entered.

original: de phyung ba'i rjes su gzhug pa dag dang nye ba'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir de bzhin du goo r'i la sogs pa gzhan dang gzhan rnams phyung ba'i rjes su gzhug par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de phyung ba'i rjes su gzhug pa dag dang nye ba'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir de bzhin du goo r'i la sogs pa gzhan dang gzhan rnams phyung ba'i rjes su gzhug par shes par bya'o //
translated: Because of the similarity of the emergence and the sequence of the emergence, one should understand that one is following the sequence of the emergence of the others, Gaurī, etc.

original: 'di rnams kyis ni ji srid yan lag dgod pa de srid du 'byung ba'o zhes pa 'di gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyis ni ji srid yan lag dgod pa de srid du 'byung ba'o zhes pa 'di gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what is said: “As long as there is the arrangement of the limbs, there is the emergence.”

original: 'di rnams thams cad dmar zhing zlum pa'i spyan gsum pa /🔽ser skya gyen du brdzes pa //
analyzed: 'di rnams thams cad dmar zhing zlum pa'i spyan gsum pa / ser skya gyen du brdzes pa //
translated: All of them have three eyes, red and round.🔽They have tawny hair standing upward.

original: zhal mche ba gtsigs pa /
analyzed: zhal mche ba gtsigs pa /
translated: They have bared fangs.

original: gcer bu phyag rgya lnga dang ldan pa /
analyzed: gcer bu phyag rgya lnga dang ldan pa /
translated: They are naked, and have the five symbolic ornaments.

original: skyil krung byed pa'i t'a na da bas zla ba'i gdan la gnas pa /
analyzed: skyil krung byed pa'i t'a na da bas zla ba'i gdan la gnas pa /
translated: They stand on moon seats in the ardhaparyaṅka posture.

original: drag mo brgyad gnyis kyi lo'i rnam pa ma'o //
analyzed: drag mo brgyad gnyis kyi lo'i rnam pa ma'o //
translated: They have the forms of young women sixteen years old.

original: byang chub kyi sems phyung ba lam yang dag par byung ma bcom ldan 'das dang @110a * //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems phyung ba lam yang dag par byung ma bcom ldan 'das dang @110a * //
translated: The bodhicitta that is extracted is the perfect path.🔽

original: 'dod pa la snyoms par zhugs pa blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa la snyoms par zhugs pa blta bar bya'o //
translated: The eight seats of Brahmā, etc., are taught in order to cut off attachment to passion, consort, emission, drinking, eating, sleep, speculation, and faith.

original: da ni goo r'i la sogs pa rnams kyi gdan brgyad kyi rnam par dag pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni goo r'i la sogs pa rnams kyi gdan brgyad kyi rnam par dag pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the purity of the eight seats of Brahmā, etc., should be stated.

original: 'dod chags dang / rig ma dang / 'dzag pa dang / btung ba dang / bza' ba dang / gnyid dang / rtog ge dang / dad pa rnams su mngon par zhen pa gcod pa'i phyir du tshangs pa la sogs pa nas thags bzangs ris kyi mthar thug pa'i gdan brgyad po rnams gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / rig ma dang / 'dzag pa dang / btung ba dang / bza' ba dang / gnyid dang / rtog ge dang / dad pa rnams su mngon par zhen pa gcod pa'i phyir du tshangs pa la sogs pa nas thags bzangs ris kyi mthar thug pa'i gdan brgyad po rnams gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The eight seats of Brahmā, etc., are taught in order to cut off attachment to passion, consort, emission, drinking, eating, sleep, speculation, and faith.

original: de ltar ji skad du bstan pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i nang du son pa'i ma ma'o tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba'i rang gi sku las rnam par spros pa'i 'od zer gyi tshogs kyis nam mkha'i mthil khyab par yang dag par rnam par bsgom par bya zhing
analyzed: de ltar ji skad du bstan pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i nang du son pa'i ma ma'o tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba'i rang gi sku las rnam par spros pa'i 'od zer gyi tshogs kyis nam mkha'i mthil khyab par yang dag par rnam par bsgom par bya zhing
translated: Thus, having entered into the mandala circle as taught, one should visualize the assembly of one's own body, completely surrounded by the assembly of the grandmothers, with a host of light rays emanating from one's body, pervading the surface of the sky.

original: ye shes kyi 'khor lo dgug par bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi 'khor lo dgug par bya'o //
translated: And one should summon the wheel of awareness.

original: bdag nyid dam tshig gi thugs ka'i padmar h'u% las byung ba'i thod par gnas pa'i nyi ma la h'u% yig sngon po'i 'od zer gyi lcags kyu rnams kyis mtha' yas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams snang bar byas nas ye shes kyi 'khor lo yang mdun du bkug par
analyzed: bdag nyid dam tshig gi thugs ka'i padmar h'u% las byung ba'i thod par gnas pa'i nyi ma la h'u% yig sngon po'i 'od zer gyi lcags kyu rnams kyis mtha' yas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams snang bar byas nas ye shes kyi 'khor lo yang mdun du bkug par
translated: In the lotus at the heart of one's own commitment being, from a blue hūṃ arises a skull cup, in which is a sun, upon which is a blue hūṃ syllable. Light rays in the form of hooks from that illuminate the limitless world systems, summoning the wheel of awareness in front.

original: rnam par bsams te mchod yon dang zhabs bsil la sogs pa phul nas yang dag par mchod cing bstod pa yang byas te /
analyzed: rnam par bsams te mchod yon dang zhabs bsil la sogs pa phul nas yang dag par mchod cing bstod pa yang byas te /
translated: Having offered water for welcoming and water for the feet, and so forth, one should also make offerings and praises.

original: dza:h'u% bam ho:zhes pa 'dis dgug pa dang gzhug pa dang bcing ba dang mnyes par bya'o //
analyzed: dza:h'u% bam ho:zhes pa 'dis dgug pa dang gzhug pa dang bcing ba dang mnyes par bya'o //
translated: With JAH HŪṀ VAṀ HOṀ one should summon, induct, bind, and subdue.

original: de nas aom badzra goo r'i a'a k'arsha ya dza:aom badzra tsoo r'i pra be sha ya h'um //
analyzed: de nas aom badzra goo r'i a'a k'arsha ya dza:aom badzra tsoo r'i pra be sha ya h'um //
translated: Then, with OṀ VAJRA GHORĪ ĀKARSAYA JAH, OṀ VAJRA CCHORI PRAVESA HŪṀ,

original: aom badzra bett'a l'i bandha ya bam /
analyzed: aom badzra bett'a l'i bandha ya bam /
translated: OṀ VAJRA VETĀLĪ BANDHA VAṀ,

original: aom badzra ghasma r'i to sha ya ho:zhes pa ji lta ba'i lam nas ye shes kyi 'khor lo dam tshig 'khor lo la gzhug go //
analyzed: aom badzra ghasma r'i to sha ya ho:zhes pa ji lta ba'i lam nas ye shes kyi 'khor lo dam tshig 'khor lo la gzhug go //
translated: OṀ VAJRA GHASMARĪ TOȘAYA HOṀ, one should induct the wisdom wheel into the commitment wheel through the path of the moon.

original: 'dis dpal he ru ka'i nga rgyal brtan par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis dpal he ru ka'i nga rgyal brtan par bya'o //
translated: By this, one should stabilize the pride of glorious Heruka.

original: gal te yang bdag nyid dam tshig bzhin du ye shes kyi dam tshig go //
analyzed: gal te yang bdag nyid dam tshig bzhin du ye shes kyi dam tshig go //
translated: If one is not like that, then the commitment of wisdom is as oneself.

original: de lta na ye shes kyi 'khor lo gzhug pa dang bar med par ye shes kyi dam tshig zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa dmar po rang 'od kyi shes rab ste rang gi snying gar bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta na ye shes kyi 'khor lo gzhug pa dang bar med par ye shes kyi dam tshig zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa dmar po rang 'od kyi shes rab ste rang gi snying gar bsam par bya'o //
translated: In that case, without interruption of the induction of the wisdom wheel, one should imagine the wisdom commitment with one face and two arms, red, with a self-luminous wisdom, at one's heart.

original: de'i snying gar ting nge 'dzin gyi mgon po yang ngo //
analyzed: de'i snying gar ting nge 'dzin gyi mgon po yang ngo //
translated: At its heart is also the lord of meditative concentration.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das ma yang de bzhin te ye shes kyi dam tshig gi snying gar padma dang zla ba la gnas pa'i aam yig las skyes pa'i gri gug la gnas pa'i zla bar gnas pa'i aam yig blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das ma yang de bzhin te ye shes kyi dam tshig gi snying gar padma dang zla ba la gnas pa'i aam yig las skyes pa'i gri gug la gnas pa'i zla bar gnas pa'i aam yig blta bar bya'o //
translated: Then the Bhagavatī is also like that. One should see the knowledge pledge at the heart, the letter AṂ arisen from the letter AṂ on a lotus and moon, on a flaying knife located on a moon, and the letter AṂ located on the moon.

original: rnal 'byor ma @110b brgyad rnams kyi de bzhin du ye shes kyi dam tshig gi snying gar padma dang zla ba rnams su rang rang gi sa bon las skyes pa'i mtshan ma /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma @110b brgyad rnams kyi de bzhin du ye shes kyi dam tshig gi snying gar padma dang zla ba rnams su rang rang gi sa bon las skyes pa'i mtshan ma /
translated: One should see the eight yoginīs in the same way, the knowledge pledge at the heart, the signs arisen from their own seed syllables on lotuses and moons.

original: slar yang zla ba la gnas pa'i de'i sa bon gyis byin gyis brlabs la blta bar bya'o zhes pa ye shes kyi 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: slar yang zla ba la gnas pa'i de'i sa bon gyis byin gyis brlabs la blta bar bya'o zhes pa ye shes kyi 'khor lo'o //
translated: Again, one should see the consecration by the seed syllable on the moon. This is the knowledge wheel.

original: ye shes kyi 'khor lo dang dam tshig gi 'khor lo dag gcig tu byas pa'i dus su rang gi sku las rnam par spros pa'i 'od zer rnams kyis bkug pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa lnga po dpal he ru ka'i gzugs thob pa rnams dang rdo rje rnal 'byor
analyzed: ye shes kyi 'khor lo dang dam tshig gi 'khor lo dag gcig tu byas pa'i dus su rang gi sku las rnam par spros pa'i 'od zer rnams kyis bkug pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa lnga po dpal he ru ka'i gzugs thob pa rnams dang rdo rje rnal 'byor
translated: When the knowledge wheel and the pledge wheel are made one, one should see the five transcendent lords summoned by the light rays emanating from one’s body, having attained the form of Śrī Heruka, and the vajra yoginīs, having attained the form of Śrī Vajravārāhī.

original: ma dang byang chub sems dpa' chen po dang khro bo la sogs pa rnams kyang nam mkha' la mngon du bltas nas mngon par dbang bskur bar gsol ba gdab ste /
analyzed: ma dang byang chub sems dpa' chen po dang khro bo la sogs pa rnams kyang nam mkha' la mngon du bltas nas mngon par dbang bskur bar gsol ba gdab ste /
translated: The mother, the great bodhisattvas, and the wrathful ones and so forth, also facing the sky, are supplicated to confer the actual consecration.

original: aa bhi shinytsa tu m'am sarba ta th'a ga ta zhes pas so //
analyzed: aa bhi shinytsa tu m'am sarba ta th'a ga ta zhes pas so //
translated: With abhiṣiñcantu māṃ sarvatathāgatāḥ, [the practitioner] says, May the five transcendent lords consecrate me.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga de rnams kyang bdud rtsi lngas gang ba'i rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa la sogs pa rnams kyis /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga de rnams kyang bdud rtsi lngas gang ba'i rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa la sogs pa rnams kyis /
translated: Those five transcendent lords, with the victorious vases and so forth filled with the five ambrosias,

original: ji ltar bltams pa tsam gyis ni //🔽de bzhin gshegs kun khrus gsol ltar //
analyzed: ji ltar bltams pa tsam gyis ni // de bzhin gshegs kun khrus gsol ltar //
translated: say, Just as at the mere time of birth

original: lha yi chu ni dag pa yis //
analyzed: lha yi chu ni dag pa yis //
translated: all transcendent lords bathed him,

original: de bzhin bdag gis khrus bgyi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin bdag gis khrus bgyi'o //
translated: in the same way I will bathe him🔽with the pure divine water.

original: zhes gsung zhing 'khru bar mdzad do zhes pa mngon par dbang bskur ba'o //
analyzed: zhes gsung zhing 'khru bar mdzad do zhes pa mngon par dbang bskur ba'o //
translated: Thus they bathe him. This is the actual consecration.

original: de nas dam tshig rdo rje'i rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis dzo dzo'i sgra sgrogs par byed do //
analyzed: de nas dam tshig rdo rje'i rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis dzo dzo'i sgra sgrogs par byed do //
translated: Then the yoginīs of the pledge vajra proclaim the sound of jho jho.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis slar yang dga' ba'i bdag nyid du gzigs par mdzad do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis slar yang dga' ba'i bdag nyid du gzigs par mdzad do //
translated: The Bodhisattvas look on with a joyful nature.

original: khro bo la sogs pa rnams kyis dga' bar mdzad do //
analyzed: khro bo la sogs pa rnams kyis dga' bar mdzad do //
translated: The wrathful ones and so forth are delighted.

original: nam mkha' sna tshogs pa'i dri bzang po can gyi me tog gi char 'bab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' sna tshogs pa'i dri bzang po can gyi me tog gi char 'bab par 'gyur ro //
translated: A rain of flowers with various celestial fragrances falls.

original: gur kum dang tsandan gyi char dang rin po che sna tshogs pa'i char rab tu 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: gur kum dang tsandan gyi char dang rin po che sna tshogs pa'i char rab tu 'bab pa'o //
translated: A rain of saffron and sandalwood, and a rain of various jewels falls.

original: gar dang sil snyan dang glu dang bstod pa'i sgras mtha' yas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams kyi steng du ca co'i sgra chen po 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gar dang sil snyan dang glu dang bstod pa'i sgras mtha' yas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnams kyi steng du ca co'i sgra chen po 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: With the sounds of dance, cymbals, song, and praise, a great clamor arises in the limitless world systems above.

original: dbang bskur ba na bcom ldan 'das kyi spyi bor thugs kyi dbang por 'gyur te bcom ldan 'das ma'i yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba na bcom ldan 'das kyi spyi bor thugs kyi dbang por 'gyur te bcom ldan 'das ma'i yang de bzhin no //
translated: When the empowerment is conferred, the Lord of Mind is on the crown of the Blessed One, and also on the Blessed Lady.

original: goo r'i la sogs pa rnams la mi bskyod pa dang / rnam par snang mdzad dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dang / 'od dpag med kyis rgyas gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: goo r'i la sogs pa rnams la mi bskyod pa dang / rnam par snang mdzad dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dang / 'od dpag med kyis rgyas gdab par bya'o //
translated: One should seal Gauri and so forth with Akshobhya, Vairochana, Ratnasambhava, and Amitabha, respectively.

original: slar yang sangs rgyas de rnams kho nas pukka s'i la sogs pa rnams kyis glu'i bstod @111a * //🔽pas bstod par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: slar yang sangs rgyas de rnams kho nas pukka s'i la sogs pa rnams kyis glu'i bstod @111a * // pas bstod par yang 'gyur te /
translated: Again, those very Buddhas praise PukkasI and so forth with the praise of the song.

original: rnal 'byor ma tshogs grogs mos yongs bskor khyod //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma tshogs grogs mos yongs bskor khyod //
translated: The assembly of yoginis, your companions, surround you.

original: khyod ni rang gi thugs la mchog brnyes pa //
analyzed: khyod ni rang gi thugs la mchog brnyes pa //
translated: You have attained the supreme mind of your own.

original: des ni rgyu dang mi rgyu'i 'gro kun mdzes //
analyzed: des ni rgyu dang mi rgyu'i 'gro kun mdzes //
translated: By that, all migrating beings, animate and inanimate, are beautified.

original: snying rje'i thugs kyis sems can sad par mdzad //
analyzed: snying rje'i thugs kyis sems can sad par mdzad //
translated: With a compassionate mind, you awaken sentient beings.

original: he ru ka dpal rgyal po mig 'phrul gyi //
analyzed: he ru ka dpal rgyal po mig 'phrul gyi //
translated: O Heruka, king of magical displays,

original: spros pas bya ba sgrubs la thugs dgyes mdzod //
analyzed: spros pas bya ba sgrubs la thugs dgyes mdzod //
translated: be pleased with the activities accomplished by emanations.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dang byang chub sems dpa' dang rig ma dang lha mo dang khro bo la sogs pa rnams kyis kyang nam mkha' la bzhugs nas snying po dang nye ba'i snying po dang rkang pa brgyad pa'i phreng ba'i sngags rnams kyis mngon par bstod par 'gyur
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dang byang chub sems dpa' dang rig ma dang lha mo dang khro bo la sogs pa rnams kyis kyang nam mkha' la bzhugs nas snying po dang nye ba'i snying po dang rkang pa brgyad pa'i phreng ba'i sngags rnams kyis mngon par bstod par 'gyur
translated: The Tathagatas, the Bodhisattvas, the Knowledge Goddesses, the Goddesses, the Wrathful Ones, and so forth, also residing in space, will praise with the essence mantras, the near essence mantras, and the eight line mantras.

original: ro zhes rgyas gdab bo //
analyzed: ro zhes rgyas gdab bo //
translated: Thus seal it.

original: de nas ma mo'i tshogs kyi dbus su rig ma dang ldan pa'i rdo rje can bdud rtsi za ba rdzogs par byas te /
analyzed: de nas ma mo'i tshogs kyi dbus su rig ma dang ldan pa'i rdo rje can bdud rtsi za ba rdzogs par byas te /
translated: Then, in the midst of the assembly of the Mothers, the possessor of the Knowledge Goddess, the Vajra Holder, should complete the eating of the nectar.

original: yam yig las rlung gi dkyil 'khor sngon po zla ba phyed pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: yam yig las rlung gi dkyil 'khor sngon po zla ba phyed pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: From the syllable YAM arises the blue wind mandala in the shape of a half-moon.

original: de'i steng du ram yig las skyes pa'i me dmar po gru gsum mo //
analyzed: de'i steng du ram yig las skyes pa'i me dmar po gru gsum mo //
translated: Upon that, from the syllable RAM arises the red triangular fire.

original: de'i steng du a'a: yig las skyes pa'i mgo bo gsum gyi steng du padma'i snod phyi dkar ba nang dmar ba a'a: yig gis byin gyis brlab pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de'i steng du a'a: yig las skyes pa'i mgo bo gsum gyi steng du padma'i snod phyi dkar ba nang dmar ba a'a: yig gis byin gyis brlab pa yang ngo //
translated: Upon that, from the syllable A arises the three-headed vessel of the lotus, white outside and red inside, consecrated by the syllable A.

original: de'i nang du bum yig la sogs pa'i sngags kyis bca' ba dang bdud rtsi lnga dang sgron ma lnga yang rdzogs par byas nas aom yig gis byin gyis brlabs pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de'i nang du bum yig la sogs pa'i sngags kyis bca' ba dang bdud rtsi lnga dang sgron ma lnga yang rdzogs par byas nas aom yig gis byin gyis brlabs pa yang ngo //
translated: In it, one should complete the mantra, such as the vase-syllable, and the five ambrosias and the five lamps, and also the consecration with the syllable Om.

original: de'i steng du h'u% yig las byung ba'i rdo rje dkar po blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du h'u% yig las byung ba'i rdo rje dkar po blta bar bya'o //
translated: Above that, one should see the white vajra arisen from the syllable Hum.

original: de'i rjes su rlung gis bskul ba'i me tsha ba nyid las dngul chu'i ro'i rnam pa bzhin du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes su rlung gis bskul ba'i me tsha ba nyid las dngul chu'i ro'i rnam pa bzhin du gyur pa'o //
translated: After that, from the heat of the fire urged by the wind, it becomes like the form of mercury.

original: aom a'a:h'u% gi yi ge rnams kyis sbyang ba dang rtogs pa dang 'bar bar byas nas mtha' yas shing mu med pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa rnams la rjes su chags par byas nas 'jig rten gyi khams rnams su song nas ye shes
analyzed: aom a'a:h'u% gi yi ge rnams kyis sbyang ba dang rtogs pa dang 'bar bar byas nas mtha' yas shing mu med pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa rnams la rjes su chags par byas nas 'jig rten gyi khams rnams su song nas ye shes
translated: With the syllables Om, Ah, and Hum, one should purify, realize, and inflame it, and having made it infinite and limitless, one should make it attached to the Buddhas, Bodhisattvas, and so forth, and having gone to the world systems, one should gather the wisdom

original: kyi bdud rtsi bkug ste de nyid du zhugs pa las gcig tu byas nas de nyid rdo rjes dkrugs pas ro mnyam par byas te rdo rje yang bdud rtsi la thim par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: kyi bdud rtsi bkug ste de nyid du zhugs pa las gcig tu byas nas de nyid rdo rjes dkrugs pas ro mnyam par byas te rdo rje yang bdud rtsi la thim par blta bar bya ste /
translated: The vajra also dissolves into the nectar.

original: rdo rje dang chu skyes sbyor ba las bsil bar gyur pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi bdud rtsi yang zhugs pa'o //🔽rdzogs pa de kho na nyid gsum gyi byin gyis brlabs pa'i lag pa'i blugs gzar gyis blangs nas h'u% @111b las byung ba'i ljags rdo rje'i 'od zer gyis drangs te bdud rtsi de zhi ba la sogs pa'i las kyi dbye bas ting nge 'dzin gyi dam tshig la
analyzed: rdo rje dang chu skyes sbyor ba las bsil bar gyur pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi bdud rtsi yang zhugs pa'o // rdzogs pa de kho na nyid gsum gyi byin gyis brlabs pa'i lag pa'i blugs gzar gyis blangs nas h'u% @111b las byung ba'i ljags rdo rje'i 'od zer gyis drangs te bdud rtsi de zhi ba la sogs pa'i las kyi dbye bas ting nge 'dzin gyi dam tshig la
translated: The nectar of the gnosis of the tathāgatas, which has become cool through the union of the vajra and the lotus, also enters.

original: sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: Having taken it up with the ladle of the hand, which is consecrated with the three perfections and realities, it is drawn up with the tongue, which arises from hūṃ, by the light rays of the vajra, and that nectar is offered into the pledge of meditative concentration, which is divided into the types of pacifying and so forth.

original: de ni dkyil 'khor pa la de dang 'dra bar bsam mo zhes pa bdud rtsi myang ba'o //
analyzed: de ni dkyil 'khor pa la de dang 'dra bar bsam mo zhes pa bdud rtsi myang ba'o //
translated: One should imagine that it is the same for the maṇḍala.

original: de'i rjes su dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po dang / dkyil 'khor ba de las spros pa'i lha'i sprul pa du ma gang dang gang na gdul bar bya ba yod pa //
analyzed: de'i rjes su dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po dang / dkyil 'khor ba de las spros pa'i lha'i sprul pa du ma gang dang gang na gdul bar bya ba yod pa //
translated: After that, the lord of the maṇḍala and the emanations of the deities emanated from that maṇḍala go to wherever there are those to be tamed.

original: de dang der song nas de rnams btul te slar 'ongs nas sprul pa rnams rdo rje can gyi rang rang gi sku la nye bar bsdu bar bya'o zhes pa 'gro ba'i don no //
analyzed: de dang der song nas de rnams btul te slar 'ongs nas sprul pa rnams rdo rje can gyi rang rang gi sku la nye bar bsdu bar bya'o zhes pa 'gro ba'i don no //
translated: Having gone there, they tame them, and having returned, the emanations are withdrawn into the individual bodies of the vajra holders. This is the benefit of migrating beings.

original: dbyung ba la sogs pa nas 'gro ba'i don gyi mthar thug pa ni dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: dbyung ba la sogs pa nas 'gro ba'i don gyi mthar thug pa ni dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The samādhi called “supreme maṇḍala king” is from the emanation up to the benefit of migrating beings.

original: de'i rjes su //🔽mtsho skyes zhabs kyis kha dog ni //
analyzed: de'i rjes su // mtsho skyes zhabs kyis kha dog ni //
translated: After that,🔽the lotus-born one [Nāgārjuna] says:

original: las kyi dbye bas dbye bar bya'o //
analyzed: las kyi dbye bas dbye bar bya'o //
translated: The colors should be differentiated by the division of the activities.

original: zhes pa ni yan lag drug sbas pa ste //
analyzed: zhes pa ni yan lag drug sbas pa ste //
translated: This is the hidden six-branched [yoga].

original: bzang po'i zhabs kyis slar cung zad gsal bar mdzad de h'u% yig las gyur pa'i kha dog ste ji ltar rigs par rab tu sbyor ba las zhes so //
analyzed: bzang po'i zhabs kyis slar cung zad gsal bar mdzad de h'u% yig las gyur pa'i kha dog ste ji ltar rigs par rab tu sbyor ba las zhes so //
translated: Bhadrakīrti clarified it a little, saying, “The color that arises from the syllable hūṃ is applied as appropriate.”

original: 'di yang dz'a landha ri pa'i zhabs kyis rgyas par rnam par bshad de /
analyzed: 'di yang dz'a landha ri pa'i zhabs kyis rgyas par rnam par bshad de /
translated: This is also extensively explained by the venerable Jālandhara.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: ri bong can dang nyi ma kha sbyor ba'i dbus su sngags kyi 'khor los sgyur ba chen po'i sa bon gyi yi ge bltas nas yan lag drug bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: ri bong can dang nyi ma kha sbyor ba'i dbus su sngags kyi 'khor los sgyur ba chen po'i sa bon gyi yi ge bltas nas yan lag drug bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Having seen the seed syllable of the great mantra-cakravartin in the center of the conjunction of the moon and sun, one should meditate on the six-branched yoga.

original: 'dis 'di gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis 'di gsungs pa yin te /
translated: This is what he says:

original: bdag nyid dam tshig gi thugs kar padma la gnas pa'i zla ba dang nyi ma'i dbus su son pa'i h'u% yig las spros pa'i 'od zer gyi tshogs rjes su zhugs pa las dang por ting nge 'dzin gyi mgon po nag po bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid dam tshig gi thugs kar padma la gnas pa'i zla ba dang nyi ma'i dbus su son pa'i h'u% yig las spros pa'i 'od zer gyi tshogs rjes su zhugs pa las dang por ting nge 'dzin gyi mgon po nag po bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Having emanated a mass of light rays from the syllable hūṃ located in the center of the moon and sun situated on the lotus at the heart of the pledge being, one should first meditate on the lord of concentration, black in color.

original: de yongs su gyur pa las thig le'i gzugs su bsams nas 'od zer rnams bcom ldan 'das kyi ba spu'i bu ga las phyung ste dkyil 'khor dang dkyil 'khor pa thams cad la mngon par khyab par byas pa las cher gnas par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa las thig le'i gzugs su bsams nas 'od zer rnams bcom ldan 'das kyi ba spu'i bu ga las phyung ste dkyil 'khor dang dkyil 'khor pa thams cad la mngon par khyab par byas pa las cher gnas par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Having transformed that into the form of a drop, one should imagine that the light rays emerge from the pores of the body of the Bhagavān and pervade all the maṇḍalas and maṇḍala residents.

original: 'di ltar gnyis par dmar po dang / gsum par ser po dang / bzhi par ljang gu dang / lnga par sngon po dang / drug par dkar po yang ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gnyis par dmar po dang / gsum par ser po dang / bzhi par ljang gu dang / lnga par sngon po dang / drug par dkar po yang ste /
translated: Thus, the second is red, the third is yellow, the fourth is green, the fifth is blue, and the sixth is white.

original: zhi ba la sogs pa'i las la ji ltar rigs par shes par bya'o zhes pa yan lag drug go //
analyzed: zhi ba la sogs pa'i las la ji ltar rigs par shes par bya'o zhes pa yan lag drug go //
translated: One should understand this in accordance with the rite, such as the rite of pacification, and so on.

original: yan lag drug bsgom pa byas nas de nas 'od gsal ba brtsam @112a * //🔽par bya ste /
analyzed: yan lag drug bsgom pa byas nas de nas 'od gsal ba brtsam @112a * // par bya ste /
translated: Having cultivated the six-branched yoga, then one should commence with clear light.

original: a'a li k'a li'i phreng bar spros pa'i dbugs dbugs kyi lam nas phyung ste /
analyzed: a'a li k'a li'i phreng bar spros pa'i dbugs dbugs kyi lam nas phyung ste /
translated: Having emanated the garland of Alikali, one should expel the breath through the path of the nose.🔽Having purified the signs and characteristics of the light rays that emerge, the animate and inanimate become one.

original: 'thon po'i 'od zer rnams kyi mtshan dang dpe byad yang dag par sbyangs nas rgyu ba dang bcas pa'i mi rgyu ba gcig tu gyur nas goo r'i la sogs pa rnams dang bdag med ma yang ste rang la 'jug pa'i bdag nyid kyis gang yang rdo rje 'chang
analyzed: 'thon po'i 'od zer rnams kyi mtshan dang dpe byad yang dag par sbyangs nas rgyu ba dang bcas pa'i mi rgyu ba gcig tu gyur nas goo r'i la sogs pa rnams dang bdag med ma yang ste rang la 'jug pa'i bdag nyid kyis gang yang rdo rje 'chang
translated: Gaurī, and so on, and Nairātmya, and so on, enter oneself, and one becomes Vajradhara, the nature of the six yoginīs.

original: gi go 'phang du brtags shing de thams cad 'od gsal bar blta bar bya ste dngos po thams cad las so //
analyzed: gi go 'phang du brtags shing de thams cad 'od gsal bar blta bar bya ste dngos po thams cad las so //
translated: One should imagine that all of them are radiant, and that all things are [radiant].

original: 'di nyid las 'chad par 'gyur ba'i 'od gsal du 'jug pa'i rim pas lhan cig skyes pa'i he ru ka zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa sku mdog dkar por bsams nas de'i thugs kar sa bon bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid las 'chad par 'gyur ba'i 'od gsal du 'jug pa'i rim pas lhan cig skyes pa'i he ru ka zhal gcig phyag gnyis pa sku mdog dkar por bsams nas de'i thugs kar sa bon bsam par bya'o //
translated: Having imagined that, one should imagine the seed at the heart of the white, one-faced, two-handed, co-emergent Heruka, who is imagined by the process of entering into clear light, which will be explained below.

original: de'i rjes su 'od gsal du 'jug pa'i rim pa ni goo r'i la sogs pa rnams byang chub kyi sems las rnam par spros pa'o zhes shes par byas nas dang por goo r'i ni bcom ldan 'das kyi gzugs kyi phyung po la gzhug go //
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'od gsal du 'jug pa'i rim pa ni goo r'i la sogs pa rnams byang chub kyi sems las rnam par spros pa'o zhes shes par byas nas dang por goo r'i ni bcom ldan 'das kyi gzugs kyi phyung po la gzhug go //
translated: After that, one should understand that the process of entering into clear light is the emanation of Gaurī and so forth from the mind of enlightenment, and first of all, Gaurī is placed in the aggregate of form of the Bhagavān.

original: de ltar chom rkun ma dang / ro langs ma dang ghasma r'i dang / bdag med ma yang ste ji ltar rigs par tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po rnams la gzhug go //
analyzed: de ltar chom rkun ma dang / ro langs ma dang ghasma r'i dang / bdag med ma yang ste ji ltar rigs par tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po rnams la gzhug go //
translated: In the same way, Caurī, Vetālī, Ghasmarī, and likewise, also, Ghasmarī, and Nairātmyā, are placed in the aggregates of feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness, respectively.

original: de bzhin du pukka s'i la sogs po rnams ni sa la sogs pa rnams la gzhug go //
analyzed: de bzhin du pukka s'i la sogs po rnams ni sa la sogs pa rnams la gzhug go //
translated: Likewise, Pukkasī and so on are introduced to earth and so on.

original: de ltar phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa ste /
translated: Thus, there is entry into the external maṇḍala.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyi nang du gnas pa'i phung po lnga po rim gyis 'jug pa ni gzugs kyi phung po dang tshor ba'i phung po dag ni 'du shes kyi phung po ste /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyi nang du gnas pa'i phung po lnga po rim gyis 'jug pa ni gzugs kyi phung po dang tshor ba'i phung po dag ni 'du shes kyi phung po ste /
translated: Then, the entry of the five aggregates abiding within the Bhagavān is gradual: the form aggregate and the feeling aggregate are the discrimination aggregate,

original: de 'du byed kyi phung po rnams su dang / de yang rnam par shes pa la ste bdag med ma yang ngo //
analyzed: de 'du byed kyi phung po rnams su dang / de yang rnam par shes pa la ste bdag med ma yang ngo //
translated: that is the aggregate of compositional factors, and that is in consciousness, which is Nairātmya.

original: der sa spyod ma dang mkha' spyod ma yang phyogs gnyis thob pa las 'od gsal bar 'gro'o zhes 'dod de mya ngan las 'das pa thams cad stong pa ji srid par ro //
analyzed: der sa spyod ma dang mkha' spyod ma yang phyogs gnyis thob pa las 'od gsal bar 'gro'o zhes 'dod de mya ngan las 'das pa thams cad stong pa ji srid par ro //
translated: There, Pṛthivī and Ākāśa are also introduced to the two directions, and they go to clear light, it is asserted, for as long as the nirvāṇa of all is empty.

original: de bzang po'i zhabs kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bzang po'i zhabs kyis gsungs pa /
translated: That is stated by Bhadrapāda:

original: sngags pas phung po lnga rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bar bsam par bya ste dkyil 'khor ba thams cad blangs shing slar rang gi yul bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: sngags pas phung po lnga rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bar bsam par bya ste dkyil 'khor ba thams cad blangs shing slar rang gi yul bsdus pa'o //
translated: The mantrin should think of the five aggregates as naturally radiant, and all the mandala-beings are taken in and gathered back into one’s own field.

original: 'dis de'i sa bon gyi yi ge dang zla ba dang nyi ma dag kyang 'dres par gyur pas bdud rtsi'i rang bzhin 'od zer gyi phung po'i @112b rnam pa mar me'i rtse mo lta bur rim gyis rjes su mi dmigs par bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: 'dis de'i sa bon gyi yi ge dang zla ba dang nyi ma dag kyang 'dres par gyur pas bdud rtsi'i rang bzhin 'od zer gyi phung po'i @112b rnam pa mar me'i rtse mo lta bur rim gyis rjes su mi dmigs par bya'o zhes so //
translated: By this, the seed-syllable, moon, and sun of that [aggregate] also become mixed, and one should gradually make the appearance of the mass of light rays, which is the nature of nectar, disappear like the tip of a butter lamp.

original: 'dir dz'a landha ri ba'i zhabs kyis mtsho skyes zhabs kyi rnam par bshad par /
analyzed: 'dir dz'a landha ri ba'i zhabs kyis mtsho skyes zhabs kyi rnam par bshad par /
translated: Here, the venerable Jālandharipa says in the commentary on the Lake-Born One:

original: 'dis de'i sa bon gyi yi ge dang zla ba dang nyi ma dag kyang 'dres par gyur pa zhes pa 'dis ye shes gsum po med par bstan to ;
analyzed: 'dis de'i sa bon gyi yi ge dang zla ba dang nyi ma dag kyang 'dres par gyur pa zhes pa 'dis ye shes gsum po med par bstan to ;
translated: “By this, the seed-syllable, moon, and sun of that [aggregate] also become mixed” teaches the nonexistence of the three intuitions.

original: / bdud rtsi'i rang bzhin zhes pa 'dis ni lhan cig skyes pa'i gnas skabs bstan par mdzad do zhes pa la sogs pa'i gzhung gi rnam par bshad pa 'dis ni 'od gsal ba nyid 'ba' zhig rnam par bshad pa yin gyis bzhengs pa 'ba' zhig gsungs pa ni
analyzed: / bdud rtsi'i rang bzhin zhes pa 'dis ni lhan cig skyes pa'i gnas skabs bstan par mdzad do zhes pa la sogs pa'i gzhung gi rnam par bshad pa 'dis ni 'od gsal ba nyid 'ba' zhig rnam par bshad pa yin gyis bzhengs pa 'ba' zhig gsungs pa ni
translated: By the nature of nectar he teaches the stage of the innate.

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: By this explanation of the text, he explains only clear light, not just the rising.

original: de bzang po'i zhabs kyis gsungs pa /🔽de'i rjes su zla ba dang nyi ma dang sa bon dag gcig tu gyur pa las skad cig gis rab tu 'bar ba'i 'od zer gyi phung po'i rnam par bsam par byas nas rim gyis mar me'i rtse mo lta bur gyur pa de'i rjes su chu shing gi
analyzed: de bzang po'i zhabs kyis gsungs pa / de'i rjes su zla ba dang nyi ma dang sa bon dag gcig tu gyur pa las skad cig gis rab tu 'bar ba'i 'od zer gyi phung po'i rnam par bsam par byas nas rim gyis mar me'i rtse mo lta bur gyur pa de'i rjes su chu shing gi
translated: That is stated by Bhavyakara:

original: snying po'i rnam par de srid du bsam par bya ste dmigs pa med par gyur pa ji srid bar ro //
analyzed: snying po'i rnam par de srid du bsam par bya ste dmigs pa med par gyur pa ji srid bar ro //
translated: After that, from the moon, sun, and seed syllable becoming one, one should imagine in an instant a mass of blazing light rays, and gradually it becomes like the flame of a butter lamp. After that, one should imagine it as the form of a plantain tree trunk,🔽 until it becomes non-apprehensible.

original: skabs 'dir 'di dran par bya ste /
analyzed: skabs 'dir 'di dran par bya ste /
translated: Here one should recall this:

original: der ni thog ma dbus mtha' med //
analyzed: der ni thog ma dbus mtha' med //
translated: There is no beginning, middle, or end there,

original: srid med mya ngan 'das pa med //
analyzed: srid med mya ngan 'das pa med //
translated: no existence, no nirvana.

original: bdag med gzhan ni med pa ste //
analyzed: bdag med gzhan ni med pa ste //
translated: There is no self, no other,

original: 'dir de mchog tu bde chen no //
analyzed: 'dir de mchog tu bde chen no //
translated: here it is the supreme great bliss.

original: zhes pa 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: This is clear light.

original: de nas 'od gsal ba las rnam par bzhengs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas 'od gsal ba las rnam par bzhengs pa ste /
translated: Then, rising from the clear light,

original: 'od gsal de ni mchog gi rnal 'byor te bzhengs pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: 'od gsal de ni mchog gi rnal 'byor te bzhengs pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: that clear light is the supreme yoga, the cause of rising.

original: 'di nyid skad cig gis lhan cig skyes pa'i he ru ka'i gzugs kyi ye shes skye ba mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis 'chang zhing dpe byad brgyad cus brgyan pa grib ma dang sgyu ma dang mtshungs shing zhi bar bsams nas ye shes kyi snang ba rdo rje'i rang
analyzed: 'di nyid skad cig gis lhan cig skyes pa'i he ru ka'i gzugs kyi ye shes skye ba mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis 'chang zhing dpe byad brgyad cus brgyan pa grib ma dang sgyu ma dang mtshungs shing zhi bar bsams nas ye shes kyi snang ba rdo rje'i rang
translated: This very [clear light] is the arising of the exalted wisdom of the form of the simultaneously-born Heruka in an instant, bearing the thirty-two marks and adorned with the eighty minor marks, similar to a shadow and an illusion, and peaceful.

original: bzhin nyid kyi dkyil 'khor gyi dbang po bsdus pas bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: bzhin nyid kyi dkyil 'khor gyi dbang po bsdus pas bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Having contemplated this, the appearance of exalted wisdom, the nature of the vajra, the lord of the mandala, should be meditated upon by gathering the sense powers.

original: rdo rje 'chang gis kyang gsungs pa /🔽sems dpa'i gzugs brnyan las byung ba'i //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang gis kyang gsungs pa / sems dpa'i gzugs brnyan las byung ba'i //
translated: Vajradhara also said:🔽The lord of the mandala should be meditated upon

original: dkyil 'khor dbang po bsgom par bya //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor dbang po bsgom par bya //
translated: arising from the reflection of the sattva.

original: zhes so // sngags bzlas pa'i rgyur phyag bcu drug pa la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis bcom ldan 'das dang por rdzogs par byas nas mkha' 'gro ma'i 'khor lo sngar bzhin du bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes so // sngags bzlas pa'i rgyur phyag bcu drug pa la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis bcom ldan 'das dang por rdzogs par byas nas mkha' 'gro ma'i 'khor lo sngar bzhin du bsam par bya'o //

translated: oṃ vajra vetālī sva sva sthāne śukrodha bandhena bandhaya🔽oṃ vajra ghasmarī śaṃghaṇḍāya vaśaṃ kuru hoḥ.

original: aom badzra ghashma r'i sham ghand'a ya wa sham ku ru ho:zhes byas nas blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: aom badzra ghashma r'i sham ghand'a ya wa sham ku ru ho:zhes byas nas blta bar bya'o //
translated: Then one should look.

original: de la bar gyi grong du shar gyi 'dab ma la dbang po lag na rdo rje zla ba'i gdan la zla ba'i 'od can rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: de la bar gyi grong du shar gyi 'dab ma la dbang po lag na rdo rje zla ba'i gdan la zla ba'i 'od can rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa'o //
translated: In the intermediate directions of that city, on the eastern petal, is Indra, with a moon seat, moon light, and all ornaments.

original: lhor gshin rje lag na dbyug pa ste nyi ma'i gdan la nyi ma'i 'od can no //🔽nub tu chu lha sa ku mu da dang zla ba'i gdan la zla ba'i 'od can rgyan thams cad 'chang ba'o //
analyzed: lhor gshin rje lag na dbyug pa ste nyi ma'i gdan la nyi ma'i 'od can no // nub tu chu lha sa ku mu da dang zla ba'i gdan la zla ba'i 'od can rgyan thams cad 'chang ba'o //
translated: In the south is Yama, with a club in his hand, a sun seat, sun light, and all ornaments.🔽In the west is Varuna, with a moon seat, moon light, and all ornaments.

original: byang du gnod sbyin te lag na shr'i pha la dang zla ba'i gdan la zla ba'i 'od can rgyan thams cad 'chang ba'o //
analyzed: byang du gnod sbyin te lag na shr'i pha la dang zla ba'i gdan la zla ba'i 'od can rgyan thams cad 'chang ba'o //
translated: In the north is Kubera, with a moon seat, moon light, and all ornaments.

original: dbang ldan gyi 'dab ma la 'byung po'i bdag po mig gsum pa /
analyzed: dbang ldan gyi 'dab ma la 'byung po'i bdag po mig gsum pa /
translated: On the northeast petal is the lord of spirits, with three eyes,

original: lag pa na rtse gsum dang stag gi pags pa'i gos 'chang ba thal bas sre bor gyur pa'i lus rus pa'i rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa zla ba'i gdan la zla ba'i 'od can no //
analyzed: lag pa na rtse gsum dang stag gi pags pa'i gos 'chang ba thal bas sre bor gyur pa'i lus rus pa'i rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa zla ba'i gdan la zla ba'i 'od can no //
translated: a trident in his hand, a tiger-skin garment, a body smeared with ashes, all bone ornaments, a moon seat, and moon light.

original: me'i 'dab ma la me lha gsus pa che ba bgrang phreng dang spyi blugs 'dzin pa /
analyzed: me'i 'dab ma la me lha gsus pa che ba bgrang phreng dang spyi blugs 'dzin pa /
translated: On the petal of fire is Agni, with a huge belly, holding a rosary and a sacrificial ladle.

original: nyi ma'i gdan la nyi ma'i 'od can bla gos bgos pa'o //
analyzed: nyi ma'i gdan la nyi ma'i 'od can bla gos bgos pa'o //
translated: On a seat of sun, he has the radiance of the sun and is clothed in a religious robe.

original: bden bral gyi 'dab mar srin po shang lang dang thod pa 'dzin pa /
analyzed: bden bral gyi 'dab mar srin po shang lang dang thod pa 'dzin pa /
translated: On the petal of the realm of the dead is the rakshasa, holding a sword and a skull-cup.

original: khro zhing smin ma 'khyog po dang ldan pa ro'i steng du nyi ma'i gdan la nyi ma'i 'od can no //
analyzed: khro zhing smin ma 'khyog po dang ldan pa ro'i steng du nyi ma'i gdan la nyi ma'i 'od can no //
translated: He is wrathful and has a frowning face, and on a seat of sun on a corpse, he has the radiance of the sun.

original: rlung gi 'dab mar rlung lha lag na rgyal mtshan dang rgyan thams cad 'chang ba zla ba'i gdan la zla ba'i 'od can no //
analyzed: rlung gi 'dab mar rlung lha lag na rgyal mtshan dang rgyan thams cad 'chang ba zla ba'i gdan la zla ba'i 'od can no //
translated: On the petal of the wind is the wind god, holding a banner and all ornaments, on a seat of moon, he has the radiance of the moon.

original: @114b padma'i ze'u 'bru la sa'i lha mo ser mo lha'i gos dang rgyan thams cad 'chang ba lag na bum pa ste zla ba'i gdan la zla ba'i 'od can yi dags rnams kyang sa'i lha mo la kun nas bskor te gnas pa'o //
analyzed: @114b padma'i ze'u 'bru la sa'i lha mo ser mo lha'i gos dang rgyan thams cad 'chang ba lag na bum pa ste zla ba'i gdan la zla ba'i 'od can yi dags rnams kyang sa'i lha mo la kun nas bskor te gnas pa'o //
translated: On the pericarp of the lotus is the yellow goddess of the earth, holding a pot in her hand, wearing divine clothes and all ornaments, on a seat of moon, she has the radiance of the moon. The hungry ghosts also surround the goddess of the earth.

original: dbang po la sogs pa rnams kyi khyad par gzhan ni srung ba'i 'khor lor bshad pa de 'dir rtogs par bya la /
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa rnams kyi khyad par gzhan ni srung ba'i 'khor lor bshad pa de 'dir rtogs par bya la /
translated: The other distinctions of the sense faculties and so forth are to be understood here as explained in the protection wheel.

original: 'dir gang bshad pa de yang 'dir shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir gang bshad pa de yang 'dir shes par bya'o //
translated: And what is explained here is also to be understood there.

original: dbang po la sogs pa lnga rnams kyis g-yon pas sbrul zhags 'dzin pa /
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa lnga rnams kyis g-yon pas sbrul zhags 'dzin pa /
translated: The five sense faculties and so forth hold a snake noose in the left hand.

original: slar thams cad g-yas brkyang pa'i zhabs kyis gnas par bsams nas h'um yig gis mi bskyod pa'i rnam par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: slar thams cad g-yas brkyang pa'i zhabs kyis gnas par bsams nas h'um yig gis mi bskyod pa'i rnam par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Again, all are imagined standing on a right leg, and one should view them with the syllable hum as the form of Akshobhya.

original: steng du chos 'byung du gnas pa'i padma 'dab ma brgyad po rnams su shar gyi 'dab ma zla ba dkar po rta dkar po la zhon pa lag na ku mu da ste rgyan thams cad 'chang ba zla ba'i gdan la zla ba'i 'od can no //
analyzed: steng du chos 'byung du gnas pa'i padma 'dab ma brgyad po rnams su shar gyi 'dab ma zla ba dkar po rta dkar po la zhon pa lag na ku mu da ste rgyan thams cad 'chang ba zla ba'i gdan la zla ba'i 'od can no //
translated: Above, in the dharma source, on the eight petals of the lotus, on the eastern petal is white moon riding a white horse, holding a night lily, wearing all ornaments, on a moon seat, with the light of the moon.

original: lho'i 'dab ma la nyi ma dmar po phyag dag gis padma 'dzin pa rta ljang gu la zhon pa rin po che'i cod pan can rgyan thams cad kun nas rdzogs pa'i nyi ma'i gdan la nyi ma'i 'od can no //
analyzed: lho'i 'dab ma la nyi ma dmar po phyag dag gis padma 'dzin pa rta ljang gu la zhon pa rin po che'i cod pan can rgyan thams cad kun nas rdzogs pa'i nyi ma'i gdan la nyi ma'i 'od can no //
translated: On the petal in the south, red Sun, red horse, holding a lotus in his hands, mounted on a green horse, with a jewel diadem, complete in all respects with ornaments, on a sun seat, with the radiance of the sun.

original: nye ba'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir zla ba dang nyi ma dag gis lhag pa la sogs pa bzung ngo //
analyzed: nye ba'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir zla ba dang nyi ma dag gis lhag pa la sogs pa bzung ngo //
translated: Because of the secondary characteristics, the moon and sun are taken as the excess, etc.

original: nub kyi 'dab ma la lhag pa ser po byi ba ser po la zhon pa nyi ma'i gdan la nyi ma'i 'od can lag na mda' ste rin po che'i cod pan can no //🔽byang gi 'dab ma la pa ba sangs sngon po rim po che'i cod pan can /
analyzed: nub kyi 'dab ma la lhag pa ser po byi ba ser po la zhon pa nyi ma'i gdan la nyi ma'i 'od can lag na mda' ste rin po che'i cod pan can no // byang gi 'dab ma la pa ba sangs sngon po rim po che'i cod pan can /
translated: On the petal in the west, yellow Excess, yellow mouse, holding an arrow in his hand, on a sun seat, with the radiance of the sun, with a jewel diadem.

original: mdung 'dzin pa nyi ma'i gdan la nyi ma'i 'od can no //
analyzed: mdung 'dzin pa nyi ma'i gdan la nyi ma'i 'od can no //
translated: On the petal in the north, blue Mercury, holding a spear in his hand, on a sun seat, with the radiance of the sun, with a jewel diadem.

original: dbang ldan gyi 'dab ma la bkra shis dmar po skra gyen du grol ba padma 'dzin pa nyi ma'i gdan la nyi ma'i 'od can no //
analyzed: dbang ldan gyi 'dab ma la bkra shis dmar po skra gyen du grol ba padma 'dzin pa nyi ma'i gdan la nyi ma'i 'od can no //
translated: On the petal in the northeast, red Brihaspati, with hair streaming upward, holding a lotus, on a sun seat, with the radiance of the sun.

original: me'i 'dab ma la phur bu shin tu ser ba rin po che'i cod pan can be con 'dzin pa nyi ma'i gdan la nyi ma'i 'od can no //
analyzed: me'i 'dab ma la phur bu shin tu ser ba rin po che'i cod pan can be con 'dzin pa nyi ma'i gdan la nyi ma'i 'od can no //
translated: On the petal of fire, the very yellow Kila with a precious diadem and holding a club, on a sun seat, with the light of the sun.

original: bden bral gyi 'dab ma la spen pa nag po skra ser skya rtse gsum 'dzin pa nyi ma'i gdan la nyi ma'i 'od can no //
analyzed: bden bral gyi 'dab ma la spen pa nag po skra ser skya rtse gsum 'dzin pa nyi ma'i gdan la nyi ma'i 'od can no //
translated: On the petal of the direction of the Lord of the Dead, the black Śukra with yellow hair and holding a trident, on a sun seat, with the light of the sun.

original: rlung gi 'dab ma la sgra gcan dang mjug rings te cher gnag pa dang du ba'i mdog 'khor zhing 'khor bas bkug nas za ba'i rnam pa can gyi lag pa nyi ma'i gdan la nyi ma'i 'od can no //
analyzed: rlung gi 'dab ma la sgra gcan dang mjug rings te cher gnag pa dang du ba'i mdog 'khor zhing 'khor bas bkug nas za ba'i rnam pa can gyi lag pa nyi ma'i gdan la nyi ma'i 'od can no //
translated: On the petal of wind, Rāhu and Ketu, very black and the color of smoke, with the form of drawing in and devouring by circling around, on a sun seat, with the light of the sun.

original: padma 'dab ma brgyad pa'i ze'u 'bru'i dbus su tshangs pa ser po gdong bzhi pa lag pa bzhi pa dbyug gu gsum 'dzin pa dang mi 'jigs pa'i phyag / phyag lhag ma dag gis phreng ba dang @115a * //
analyzed: padma 'dab ma brgyad pa'i ze'u 'bru'i dbus su tshangs pa ser po gdong bzhi pa lag pa bzhi pa dbyug gu gsum 'dzin pa dang mi 'jigs pa'i phyag / phyag lhag ma dag gis phreng ba dang @115a * //
translated: In the center of the pericarp of the eight-petaled lotus, the yellow Brahmā with four faces and four arms, holding a triple stick and a mudrā of fearlessness, and with the remaining hands a rosary and a water vessel,

original: spyi blugs 'dzin pa la zhon pa zla ba'i gdan la zla ba'i 'od can mchod phyir thogs dang ldan pa thung zhing lus rgyas pa ral pa can te tshangs ris dang tshangs pa mdun na 'don dang tshangs chen la sogs pa nas 'og min gyi mthar thug pa
analyzed: spyi blugs 'dzin pa la zhon pa zla ba'i gdan la zla ba'i 'od can mchod phyir thogs dang ldan pa thung zhing lus rgyas pa ral pa can te tshangs ris dang tshangs pa mdun na 'don dang tshangs chen la sogs pa nas 'og min gyi mthar thug pa
translated: He is mounted on a moon seat holding a water-pot, with a moon-like radiance, wearing a sacred thread, short, with a stout body, and with matted hair. He is surrounded by Brahmakayikas, Brahmapurohitas, Mahabrahmans, and so on, up to Akanishthas.

original: rnams kyis tshangs pa la kun du bskor nas gnas par rnam par bsams nas aom yig gis sku rdo rje'i rnam par rdzogs par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnams kyis tshangs pa la kun du bskor nas gnas par rnam par bsams nas aom yig gis sku rdo rje'i rnam par rdzogs par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Surrounding Brahma, he should be imagined as standing. He should be seen as perfect in the form of Vajra Body with the syllable Om.

original: de'i rjes su 'og tu chos 'byung du gnas pa'i padma 'dab ma brgyad po rnams su phyogs dang phyogs bral gyi rim pas te de la /
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'og tu chos 'byung du gnas pa'i padma 'dab ma brgyad po rnams su phyogs dang phyogs bral gyi rim pas te de la /

analyzed: klu padma dkar po //

analyzed: klu stobs kyi rgyu dmar po //

original: klu 'jog po nag po //

analyzed: klu padma chen po sngo bsangs /

analyzed: brgyad po 'di rnams kyang rin po che'i cod pan can mi'i gdong can rgyan thams cad 'dzin pa mgo bor gdengs ka sa brgyan pa lha ma yin dang dmyal ba'i sems can dang bcas pa de'i ze'u 'bru la yang klu lhag ma dkar po rin po che'i cod
translated: On their anthers is the remaining white nāga, adorned with a jeweled diadem, a human face, and a hood.

translated: Having thus stabilized them, one should view them as the form of Vakvajra arisen from the transformation of the syllable āḥ, and one should apply them everywhere in the form of Śrī Heruka.

analyzed: yang na las thams cad pa'i don du phyag dang zhal dang sku mdog la sogs pa gsungs te /

analyzed: zhi ba la sogs pa'i las la bdag nyid gzugs ji lta ba de bzhin du de rnams kyi bya'o //

original: zhes pa 'dis @115b so ;
analyzed: zhes pa 'dis @115b so ;
translated: With this, “oṃ nīrī hūṃ khaṃ svāhā,” one should offer water for the mouth.

analyzed: de la yi ge brgya ba'i sngags ni 'di yin te aom shr'i he ru ka sa ma ya ma nu p'a la ya /

analyzed: he ru ka tve no pa tishtha dri dho me bha wa /

analyzed: su to shyo me bha wa /

translated: Hūṃ phaṭ

analyzed: nas rjes su brtse bas 'dod pa'i don gyi gsol ba btab ste gshegs su gsol lo //

analyzed: de la bden pa'i byin gyis brlab pa ni //

analyzed: lha mo tshad ma dam tshig tshad ma dang // des gsungs dag kyang tshad ma'i mchog yin te //

original: bden pa 'di yis lha mo de dag rnams //🔽bdag la rjes su 'dzin pa'i rgyur 'gyur shog / bdag la rjes su brtse ba ni //
analyzed: bden pa 'di yis lha mo de dag rnams // bdag la rjes su 'dzin pa'i rgyur 'gyur shog / bdag la rjes su brtse ba ni //

original: mgon po kun rtog chags bcom srid zhi mnyam la chags //
analyzed: mgon po kun rtog chags bcom srid zhi mnyam la chags //
translated: May the protector, who has conquered the attachment of conceptualization, be attached to the equality of existence and peace,

original: dngos kun ngo bo nyid kyi @116a * //
analyzed: dngos kun ngo bo nyid kyi @116a * //
translated: The nature of all entities is🔽

original: mkha' dang mtshungs par gzigs //
analyzed: mkha' dang mtshungs par gzigs //

original: shin tu lci ba'i snying rje'i chus brlan rgyas pa'i thugs //
analyzed: shin tu lci ba'i snying rje'i chus brlan rgyas pa'i thugs //
translated: The mind, moistened and expanded by the water of great compassion,

original: lha mo rnams kyis bdag la rjes brtser mdzod cig mdzod /
analyzed: lha mo rnams kyis bdag la rjes brtser mdzod cig mdzod /
translated: the goddesses, be compassionate to me!

original: gshegs pa ni /
analyzed: gshegs pa ni /
translated: The going is:

analyzed: aom badzra mu: aom a'a: h'u% phat phat phat ces pa 'di rnams kyi aom yig gis smon lam mo //
translated: Oṃ vajra muḥ. Oṃ āḥ hūṃ phaṭ phaṭ phaṭ. By these, the Oṃ syllable is the aspiration.

original: a'a:yig gis dgyes pa'o //
analyzed: a'a:yig gis dgyes pa'o //
translated: The āḥ syllable is the delight.

original: h'u% yig gis tshim par byed pa'o //
analyzed: h'u% yig gis tshim par byed pa'o //
translated: The hūṃ syllable is the satisfaction.

original: phat yig gsum gyis nye bar bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: phat yig gsum gyis nye bar bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The three phaṭ syllables are the withdrawal.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams dge slong gtor ma 'dis //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams dge slong gtor ma 'dis //
translated: If the yogis, with this offering of the oblation,

original: gal te 'byung po thams cad mchod byed pa //
analyzed: gal te 'byung po thams cad mchod byed pa //
translated: worship all the bhūtas,

original: de tshe de rnams dri med bder 'gyur te //
analyzed: de tshe de rnams dri med bder 'gyur te //

original: 'gro ba rnams su 'byor dang lha yang dga' //
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams su 'byor dang lha yang dga' //
translated: and the world will be prosperous and the gods pleased.🔽For the sake of these benefits—power, assault, destroying the enemy hordes,

analyzed: dbang dang mngon spyod dgra sde 'jig pa dang // bskrad pa dang ni gsad dang dgug pa dang // zhi rgyas bde ba 'di rnams don du ni //
translated: expelling, killing, summoning, pacifying, increasing, and happiness—

analyzed: 'byung po'i tshogs la rtag tu gtor ma sbyin //
translated: Always give sacrificial cakes to the hosts of spirits.

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: This is
