analyzed: las rgyal po mchog ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: the samadhi called “The King of Actions.”

original: de nas 'khor lo'i dbus su gnas pa'i sngags pa'i lte ba dang / snying ga dang / de bzhin du mgrin pa dang / dpral bar yang go rims bzhin du /
analyzed: de nas 'khor lo'i dbus su gnas pa'i sngags pa'i lte ba dang / snying ga dang / de bzhin du mgrin pa dang / dpral bar yang go rims bzhin du /
translated: Then, in the center of the wheel, the mantra practitioner should imagine four lotuses at the navel, heart, throat, and forehead, respectively,🔽with thirty-two petals, sixteen petals, eight petals, and sixty-four petals.

original: 'dab ma drug cu rtsa bzhi dang / brgyad dang / de bzhin du bcu drug dang / sum cu rtsa gnyis pa'i padma bzhi po bsams nas lte bar sa bon bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dab ma drug cu rtsa bzhi dang / brgyad dang / de bzhin du bcu drug dang / sum cu rtsa gnyis pa'i padma bzhi po bsams nas lte bar sa bon bsam par bya'o //
translated: The seed syllable should be imagined in the center.

original: gtum mo'i gzugs mar me'i rtse mo lta bur 'bar bas chos kyi 'khor lor gnas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa lnga rnams dang spyan ma la sogs pa yang bsregs nas a'a li dang k'a li dag 'byung ba dang rngub pa dang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i 'khor lo dang
analyzed: gtum mo'i gzugs mar me'i rtse mo lta bur 'bar bas chos kyi 'khor lor gnas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa lnga rnams dang spyan ma la sogs pa yang bsregs nas a'a li dang k'a li dag 'byung ba dang rngub pa dang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i 'khor lo dang
translated: The blazing form of candali, like the tip of a butter lamp, burns the five tathagatas residing in the dharmacakra and Locana and so forth.

original: bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo dang rnam par dag pa'i gzugs can ham yig kyang bsregs pa las /
analyzed: bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo dang rnam par dag pa'i gzugs can ham yig kyang bsregs pa las /
translated: The wheel of great bliss and the pure form of the syllable ham are also burned.

original: de nas bde ba chen po'i rgyur gyur pa'i byang chub sems blangs te bcom ldan 'das dang lhan cig tu de ltar ro gcig tu byas nas slar zla ba dang nyi ma dang thod pa yang bzung nas snying ga'i sa bon la rab tu gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bde ba chen po'i rgyur gyur pa'i byang chub sems blangs te bcom ldan 'das dang lhan cig tu de ltar ro gcig tu byas nas slar zla ba dang nyi ma dang thod pa yang bzung nas snying ga'i sa bon la rab tu gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Then, having taken up the bodhicitta that is the cause of great bliss, having made it of one taste with the Bhagavat in that way, one should again take up the moon, sun, and skull and enter them into the seed syllable in the heart.🔽That seed syllable of the blazing with the nada is the nature of the five tathagatas.

original: n'a da dang bcas pa'i 'bar ba'i sa bon de ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid du gyur pa ste bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: n'a da dang bcas pa'i 'bar ba'i sa bon de ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid du gyur pa ste bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
translated: The Bhagavat said:

original: thig le rdo rje sems dpar 'gyur //
analyzed: thig le rdo rje sems dpar 'gyur //
translated: The drop is Vajrasattva.

original: zla phyed rnam par snang mdzad 'dod //
analyzed: zla phyed rnam par snang mdzad 'dod //
translated: The half-moon is said to be Vairochana.

original: @116b re kh'a rin chan bdag po nyid //🔽nye yig gis ni 'od dpag med //
analyzed: @116b re kh'a rin chan bdag po nyid // nye yig gis ni 'od dpag med //
translated: The line is Ratnasambhava.🔽The near syllable is Amitabha.

original: au yig don yod grub par yang //
analyzed: au yig don yod grub par yang //
translated: The syllable u is Amoghasiddhi.

original: shes nas rgyal ba lnga bdag nyid //
analyzed: shes nas rgyal ba lnga bdag nyid //
translated: Knowing that, the nature of the five victors

original: ces so // slar yang n'a da mar me'i rtse mo lta bur phyung ste phrag dog gi rang bzhin can au yig ni chags pa'i rang bzhin can ha yig la'o //
analyzed: ces so // slar yang n'a da mar me'i rtse mo lta bur phyung ste phrag dog gi rang bzhin can au yig ni chags pa'i rang bzhin can ha yig la'o //
translated: Again, the nada is drawn up like the flame of a lamp, and the nada is placed in the letter ha, which has the nature of passion.

original: de'i rjes su ha yig ni ser sna'i bdag nyid can re kh'a la'o //🔽de nas re kh'a yang gti mug gi rang bzhin can zla ba phyed pa la'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes su ha yig ni ser sna'i bdag nyid can re kh'a la'o // de nas re kh'a yang gti mug gi rang bzhin can zla ba phyed pa la'o //
translated: After that, the letter ha is placed in the letter ra, which has the nature of miserliness.🔽Then, the letter ra is placed in the half moon, which has the nature of delusion.

original: zla ba phyed pa yang zhe sdang gi rang bzhin can thig le la ste /🔽thig le yang n'a da la bsdu bar bya zhing /
analyzed: zla ba phyed pa yang zhe sdang gi rang bzhin can thig le la ste / thig le yang n'a da la bsdu bar bya zhing /
translated: The half moon is placed in the drop, which has the nature of anger.🔽The drop is to be dissolved into the nada.

original: n'a da yang phra mo'i rtse mor bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: n'a da yang phra mo'i rtse mor bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The nada is to be meditated at the tip of the subtle [vajra].

original: 'dis sems brtan par gyur pa na lhun gyis grub pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i bkod pa dang / rnal 'byor ma'i dra ba dang / dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo yang rgyas par mtha' yas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams khyab par byed pa spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis sems brtan par gyur pa na lhun gyis grub pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i bkod pa dang / rnal 'byor ma'i dra ba dang / dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo yang rgyas par mtha' yas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams khyab par byed pa spro bar bya'o //
translated: When the mind becomes stable by this, then the array of the Tathagatas, the net of yoginis, and the mandala circle are to be emanated pervading the infinite world realms by the power of spontaneity.

original: 'di nyid dz'a landha ri ba'i zhabs kyis sbas pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di nyid dz'a landha ri ba'i zhabs kyis sbas pas gsungs pa /
translated: This is taught by the venerable Jālandhara.

original: 'di nyid las bzhengs nas chos kyi dbus su sna tshogs padma yang bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid las bzhengs nas chos kyi dbus su sna tshogs padma yang bsam par bya'o //
translated: Having arisen from this, one should imagine a variegated lotus in the middle of the Dharma.

original: de'i 'dab ma brgyad rnams su brgyad po rnams kyi dbang phyug kyang ste de'i thugs kar sa bon bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'dab ma brgyad rnams su brgyad po rnams kyi dbang phyug kyang ste de'i thugs kar sa bon bsam par bya'o //
translated: On its eight petals, one should imagine the eight lords. At its heart, one should imagine the seed.

original: sa bon las n'a da'i rtse mor mthar bsgom par bya zhing sems brtan par byed pa'i don du rtse mo phra ba'i mthar bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: sa bon las n'a da'i rtse mor mthar bsgom par bya zhing sems brtan par byed pa'i don du rtse mo phra ba'i mthar bsam par bya'o //
translated: From the seed, one should imagine the tip of the nāḍī, and at the tip of the subtle nāḍī, one should imagine the mind in order to stabilize it.

original: de yis lhan cig tu 'byung bas sems brtan par 'gyur ba la the tshom mi bya'o //
analyzed: de yis lhan cig tu 'byung bas sems brtan par 'gyur ba la the tshom mi bya'o //
translated: One should have no doubt that by that, the mind will be stabilized.

original: sems brtan pa tsam gyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i bkod pa dang rnal 'byor ma'i dra ba yang shin tu rgyas par mtha' yas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams khyab par byed pa spro bar bya ste gang las na /
analyzed: sems brtan pa tsam gyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i bkod pa dang rnal 'byor ma'i dra ba yang shin tu rgyas par mtha' yas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams khyab par byed pa spro bar bya ste gang las na /
translated: By merely stabilizing the mind, one should emanate the array of the tathāgatas and the net of yoginīs, which pervade the infinite world systems.

original: rang gi mtshan ma las spro ba ste bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i mgon po dkyil 'khor gyi bdag nyid can zhes so //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan ma las spro ba ste bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i mgon po dkyil 'khor gyi bdag nyid can zhes so //
translated: Emanating from his own sign, he is the inconceivable Lord, the nature of the mandala.

original: chos kyi sgras don rnam pa gnyis bstan te man ngag gi lta ba las khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sgras don rnam pa gnyis bstan te man ngag gi lta ba las khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The word “dharma” indicates two things, which should be understood from the view of the esoteric instructions.🔽The sign should be contemplated as being the size of a large mustard seed.

original: mtshan ma yang nyungs kar sbom po tsam du bsam par bya'o zhes bya ba phra mo'i rnal 'byor zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin du bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma yang nyungs kar sbom po tsam du bsam par bya'o zhes bya ba phra mo'i rnal 'byor zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin du bshad par bya'o //
translated: This is explained as the samādhi called “subtle yoga.”

original: 'di nyid las bzhengs pa las gal te rnal 'byor pa phyag gnyis pa kye rdo rje'i rnal 'byor gyis go cha gnyis byas nas gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid las bzhengs pa las gal te rnal 'byor pa phyag gnyis pa kye rdo rje'i rnal 'byor gyis go cha gnyis byas nas gnas par bya'o //
translated: If the yogin, having arisen from this very [samādhi], is in the yoga of two-armed Hevajra, he should perform the two armors and remain.🔽There, Akṣobhya in the form of a wheel is at the head,

original: de la 'khor lo'i gzugs kyis mi bskyod pa ni mgo bor @117a * //
analyzed: de la 'khor lo'i gzugs kyis mi bskyod pa ni mgo bor @117a * //
translated: in the shape of a crest jewel.

original: h'u% ngo // lha'i rna rgyan gyi rnam pas 'od dpag med ni rna ba dag la hr'i'o //
analyzed: h'u% ngo // lha'i rna rgyan gyi rnam pas 'od dpag med ni rna ba dag la hr'i'o //
translated: Amitābha in the form of a divine earring is at the ears, in the shape of hrīḥ.

original: mgul gyi phreng ba'i rnam pas rin chen dbang po ni mgrin par tr'am ngo //
analyzed: mgul gyi phreng ba'i rnam pas rin chen dbang po ni mgrin par tr'am ngo //
translated: Ratnasaṃbhava in the form of a necklace is at the throat, in the shape of traṃ.🔽Vairocana in the form of a topknot is at the crown protuberance, in the shape of oṃ.

original: lag gdub kyi rnam pas rnam par snang mdzad ni lag pa dag la aom mo //
analyzed: lag gdub kyi rnam pas rnam par snang mdzad ni lag pa dag la aom mo //
translated: In the form of bracelets, Vairochana is on the arms, Om.

original: ska rags kyi rnam pas don yod grub pa ni rked pa la kham ngo //
analyzed: ska rags kyi rnam pas don yod grub pa ni rked pa la kham ngo //
translated: In the form of a belt, Amoghasiddhi is on the hips, Kham.

original: thal ba'i rnam pas rdo rje sems dpa' ni yan lag thams cad la ham ste go cha bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: thal ba'i rnam pas rdo rje sems dpa' ni yan lag thams cad la ham ste go cha bsam par bya'o //
translated: In the form of ashes, Vajrasattva is on all the limbs, Ham. One should imagine the armor.

original: mig dag la ni gti mug rdo rje ma ni aam ngo //
analyzed: mig dag la ni gti mug rdo rje ma ni aam ngo //
translated: In the eyes, Mohavajra is Am.

original: rna ba dag la zhe sdang rdo rje ma ni a'am ngo //🔽sna la ser sna rdo rje ma ni aim du bshad do //
analyzed: rna ba dag la zhe sdang rdo rje ma ni a'am ngo // sna la ser sna rdo rje ma ni aim du bshad do //
translated: In the ears, Dveshavajra is Am.🔽In the nose, Mrakshavajra is Em.

original: kha la 'dod chags rdo rje ma ni aum ngo //
analyzed: kha la 'dod chags rdo rje ma ni aum ngo //
translated: In the mouth, Ragavajra is Om.

original: yid la bdag med rnal 'byor ma ni aam ngo //
analyzed: yid la bdag med rnal 'byor ma ni aam ngo //
translated: In the mind, NairatmayoginI is Am.

original: sems dpa' chen po go cha rnams kyis dbang po rnams kyi rnam par dag pa bya'o zhes pa ni dgod pa gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po go cha rnams kyis dbang po rnams kyi rnam par dag pa bya'o zhes pa ni dgod pa gnyis pa'o /
translated: The great being should purify the sense powers with the armors. This is the second placement.

original: // / de bzhin gshegs pa dang rdo rje rnal 'byor ma las bsgrubs pa 'dis lus la go cha gyon nas rnal 'byor pa seng ge bzhin du gnas par bya ste phyag gnyis pa'i kye rdo rje'i rnal 'byor gyis 'jig rten gsum gyi gzhal yas khang gi nang du'o
analyzed: // / de bzhin gshegs pa dang rdo rje rnal 'byor ma las bsgrubs pa 'dis lus la go cha gyon nas rnal 'byor pa seng ge bzhin du gnas par bya ste phyag gnyis pa'i kye rdo rje'i rnal 'byor gyis 'jig rten gsum gyi gzhal yas khang gi nang du'o
translated: Having donned the armor on the body with this accomplishment from the Tathāgata and Vajrayoginī, the yogin should remain like a lion.🔽🔽With the yoga of two-armed Hevajra, in the celestial mansion of the three worlds.

original: // de ltar yang klu sgrub zhabs kyis //
analyzed: // de ltar yang klu sgrub zhabs kyis //
translated: Thus, the yogī should live like a lion, having donned the armor on his body, accomplished from the Tathāgata and Vajrayoginī.🔽Nāgārjuna says:

original: srid gsum ma yin 'di ni khang brtsegs srog chags ma yin 'di rnams rgyal ba'o //
analyzed: srid gsum ma yin 'di ni khang brtsegs srog chags ma yin 'di rnams rgyal ba'o //
translated: The three worlds are not this, the palace is not these beings, the victors are not this.

original: bdag ni mi min 'khor lo'i dbang po yul min la dbang po la sa sogs min //
analyzed: bdag ni mi min 'khor lo'i dbang po yul min la dbang po la sa sogs min //
translated: I am not a human, the cakravartins are not objects, the elements are not the sense faculties.

original: bdag nyid gzugs la sogs dang chos nyid kyang min de slad de rnams dkyil 'khor pa //
analyzed: bdag nyid gzugs la sogs dang chos nyid kyang min de slad de rnams dkyil 'khor pa //
translated: I am not form and so on, nor am I the intrinsic nature, therefore, they are the maṇḍala.

original: sna tshogs 'di rnams dkyil 'khor 'khor lor bsdus phyir kye sems 'khrul par 'gyur ba ci //🔽zhes pa bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs 'di rnams dkyil 'khor 'khor lor bsdus phyir kye sems 'khrul par 'gyur ba ci //🔽zhes pa bzhugs pa'o //
translated: Since all of this is included in the maṇḍalacakra, how is the mind deluded?

original: de'i rjes su gang cung zad rnyed pa'i bza' ba dang bca' ba'am btung ba la sogs pa'i rdzas rnyed pa rnal 'byor pas sngar bzhin du sbyangs shing yi ge gsum gyis brlabs nas bdud rtsi myang ba'i cho gas bza' bar bya'o zhes pa bza' ba'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes su gang cung zad rnyed pa'i bza' ba dang bca' ba'am btung ba la sogs pa'i rdzas rnyed pa rnal 'byor pas sngar bzhin du sbyangs shing yi ge gsum gyis brlabs nas bdud rtsi myang ba'i cho gas bza' bar bya'o zhes pa bza' ba'o //
translated: After that, whatever substances of food and drink, etc., are obtained, the yogi should purify them as before, bless them with the three syllables, and eat them with the rite of tasting the elixir.🔽Following the Root Tantra, one should speak of the conduct of the stationary and the conduct of the moving.

original: rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'brangs nas gnas pa dang rgyu ba dag gis brjod par bya ste de ltar ni /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'brangs nas gnas pa dang rgyu ba dag gis brjod par bya ste de ltar ni /
translated: Thus:

original: brkam dang rgongs dang 'jigs dang khro /
analyzed: brkam dang rgongs dang 'jigs dang khro /
translated: Abandon greed, intoxication, fear, and anger,

original: ngo tsha'i bya ba'ang rnam spang bya //
analyzed: ngo tsha'i bya ba'ang rnam spang bya //
translated: and also the actions of shame.

original: bdag nyid gnyid ni spangs nas ni //
analyzed: bdag nyid gnyid ni spangs nas ni //
translated: Having abandoned sleep,

original: the tshom med par spyod pa bya //
analyzed: the tshom med par spyod pa bya //
translated: practice without doubt.

original: 'di nyid lus kyi sbyin pa byin nas ni //
analyzed: 'di nyid lus kyi sbyin pa byin nas ni //
translated: Having given the gift of one’s body,

original: phyi nas spyod pa kun du brtsam //
analyzed: phyi nas spyod pa kun du brtsam //
translated: one should commence all conduct.

original: skal dang skal med @117b rnam dpyad pas //
analyzed: skal dang skal med @117b rnam dpyad pas //
translated: Having analyzed who is worthy and unworthy,

original: de las sbyin dang sbyin bya min //🔽bza' bca' de bzhin btung ba ni //
analyzed: de las sbyin dang sbyin bya min // bza' bca' de bzhin btung ba ni //
translated: give to some and not to others.🔽Eat whatever food and drink,

original: ji ltar rnyed pa'ang bza' bar bya //
analyzed: ji ltar rnyed pa'ang bza' bar bya //
translated: and whatever is obtained.

original: 'dod dang mi 'dod rnam rtog phyir //
analyzed: 'dod dang mi 'dod rnam rtog phyir //
translated: Because of the concepts of desire and non-desire,

original: 'dzin pa'i cha ni bya ba min //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i cha ni bya ba min //
translated: the aspect of grasping is not the action.

original: rigs lnga po ni mnyam sbyor bar //
analyzed: rigs lnga po ni mnyam sbyor bar //
translated: The five clans are united in union,

original: rigs gcig tu ni brtag par bya //🔽rigs ni du ma nyid kyis ni //
analyzed: rigs gcig tu ni brtag par bya // rigs ni du ma nyid kyis ni //
translated: and should be considered as one clan.🔽The many clans

original: ji bzhin dbye ba bskyed bya min //
analyzed: ji bzhin dbye ba bskyed bya min //
translated: should not be generated as a division just as it is.🔽In a solitary place, or a charnel ground,

original: shing gcig gam ni dur khrod dang // de bzhin mtshan mo ma mo'i khyim //
analyzed: shing gcig gam ni dur khrod dang // de bzhin mtshan mo ma mo'i khyim //
translated: or at night, in a house of the Mothers,🔽or in a place without people,

original: yang na skye bo med pa dang // bas mthar bsgom pa dge bar brjod //
analyzed: yang na skye bo med pa dang // bas mthar bsgom pa dge bar brjod //
translated: in a remote place, meditation is said to be virtuous.

original: gal te spyod pa byed 'dod na //
analyzed: gal te spyod pa byed 'dod na //
translated: If one wishes to perform the conduct,

original: drod ni cung zad thob pa na'o //
analyzed: drod ni cung zad thob pa na'o //
translated: it is when one has attained a little warmth.

original: gal te dngos grub 'gyur 'dod yod //
analyzed: gal te dngos grub 'gyur 'dod yod //
translated: If there is a wish for spiritual powers,

original: 'dis ni spyod pa spyad par bya //
analyzed: 'dis ni spyod pa spyad par bya //
translated: one should perform the conduct with this.

original: zhes rgyas par ro //🔽spyod do zhes pa ni spyod pa dang kun du spyod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes rgyas par ro // spyod do zhes pa ni spyod pa dang kun du spyod pa'o //
translated: Thus it is extensive.🔽The phrase one should perform the conduct refers to the conduct and the complete conduct.

original: gnas pa'i tha snyad ni kun du spyod pa zhes pa'i tha tshig go /
analyzed: gnas pa'i tha snyad ni kun du spyod pa zhes pa'i tha tshig go /
translated: The convention of abiding is synonymous with complete conduct.

original: drod cung zad thob pa la ltos pa yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: drod cung zad thob pa la ltos pa yang gsungs pa /
translated: It is also said to depend on attaining a little warmth:🔽The conduct should be performed by one who has attained a little warmth.

original: rnal 'byor pa thams cad kyang mtshan mo rang gi gnas su shin tu spyod pa bya ste ji srid cung zad thob par gyur par ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa thams cad kyang mtshan mo rang gi gnas su shin tu spyod pa bya ste ji srid cung zad thob par gyur par ro //
translated: All yogis should practice well at night in their own place until they attain something.

original: 'di gang las she na /🔽ji bzhin dbye ba bskyed bya min //
analyzed: 'di gang las she na / ji bzhin dbye ba bskyed bya min //
translated: From where is this?

original: zhes pa'i gsung las so //🔽thob pa na bya ba'am /
analyzed: zhes pa'i gsung las so // thob pa na bya ba'am /
translated: From the statement: “The division should not be generated as it is.”

original: mi bya ba ni rang dbang nyid de 'di ni spyod pa'o //
analyzed: mi bya ba ni rang dbang nyid de 'di ni spyod pa'o //
translated: When attained, the action or non-action is the very independence. This is the practice.

original: de nas thun mtshams gzhan la nyal bar 'dod pas dpal he ru ka'i rnal 'byor la mngon du phyogs par byas nas seng ge bzhin du nyal bar bya'o zhes pa nyal ba'o //
analyzed: de nas thun mtshams gzhan la nyal bar 'dod pas dpal he ru ka'i rnal 'byor la mngon du phyogs par byas nas seng ge bzhin du nyal bar bya'o zhes pa nyal ba'o //
translated: Then, desiring to sleep in another session, facing the yoga of glorious Heruka, one should sleep like a lion. This is sleeping.

original: ldang ba'i dus su yang pukka s'i la sogs pa'i glus bskul ba las langs pa na sngar bshad pa'i rim nyid kyis mchod pa'i 'khor lo la sogs pa nas spyod pa'i mthar thug pa thams cad thun gsum du bya ste ji srid dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rnam
analyzed: ldang ba'i dus su yang pukka s'i la sogs pa'i glus bskul ba las langs pa na sngar bshad pa'i rim nyid kyis mchod pa'i 'khor lo la sogs pa nas spyod pa'i mthar thug pa thams cad thun gsum du bya ste ji srid dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rnam
translated: At the time of rising, having arisen from the urging by the song of Pukkasī and so forth, one should perform all the offerings, such as the wheel of offerings, and so forth up to the practice, in three sessions, by the very stages explained previously, until the mandala wheel is seen.

original: pa mngon sum du byas pa las las dang po pa'i rnal 'byor pa sa brgyad kyi dbang phyug sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro zhing 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: pa mngon sum du byas pa las las dang po pa'i rnal 'byor pa sa brgyad kyi dbang phyug sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro zhing 'ong ba'o //
translated: The yogi/nī who has actualized the stage of completion goes to and comes from the buddha-fields, having become a master of the eight masteries.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang gsungs pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang gsungs pa /
translated: The Bhagavān also says:

original: ji srid bsgom la sbyor 'gyur ba ;
analyzed: ji srid bsgom la sbyor 'gyur ba ;
translated: As long as one is engaged in meditation,

original: / de srid dang po'i las can yin //
analyzed: / de srid dang po'i las can yin //
translated: one is a beginner.

original: dang po'i las kyi sbyor bas kyang //
analyzed: dang po'i las kyi sbyor bas kyang //
translated: Even the beginner, engaged in meditation,

original: sa brgyad pa ni thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa ni thob par 'gyur //
translated: attains the eighth stage.

original: zhes pa slar yang langs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa slar yang langs pa'o //
translated: This is the arising.

original: 'di rnams kyis ni sgrub pa'i thabs kyi mdo sum cu rtsa gnyis rnam par bshad do //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyis ni sgrub pa'i thabs kyi mdo sum cu rtsa gnyis rnam par bshad do //
translated: By these, the thirty-two topics of the method of practice are explained.

original: de la mdo gang zhe na 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la mdo gang zhe na 'di lta ste /
translated: What are the topics? They are as follows:

original: mchod pa'i 'khor @118a * //
analyzed: mchod pa'i 'khor @118a * //
translated: the worship cakra,

original: lo dang / tshangs pa'i gnas pa bzhi dang / mchog dang / lhan cig skyes pa dang / rang gi 'dod pa'i lha dang / srung ba'i 'khor lo dang / stong pa nyid du mos pa dang / dur khrod dang / khang pa brtsegs pa dang /
analyzed: lo dang / tshangs pa'i gnas pa bzhi dang / mchog dang / lhan cig skyes pa dang / rang gi 'dod pa'i lha dang / srung ba'i 'khor lo dang / stong pa nyid du mos pa dang / dur khrod dang / khang pa brtsegs pa dang /
translated: the four divine abodes, the supreme, the innate, one’s desired deity, the protection cakra, the aspiration for emptiness, the charnel ground, the tower,

original: rgyu'i dkyil 'khor dang / zhu ba lhung ba dang / bzhengs pa dang / dgod pa dang / zhe sdang gi bdag nyid dang / spro ba dang / ye shes kyi 'khor lo dang / dbang bskur ba dang / rgyas gdab pa dang / bdud rtsi myang ba dang /
analyzed: rgyu'i dkyil 'khor dang / zhu ba lhung ba dang / bzhengs pa dang / dgod pa dang / zhe sdang gi bdag nyid dang / spro ba dang / ye shes kyi 'khor lo dang / dbang bskur ba dang / rgyas gdab pa dang / bdud rtsi myang ba dang /
translated: the causal maṇḍala, the descent of the bodhicitta, the arising, the emission, the nature of wrath, the emanation, the gnosis maṇḍala, the conferral of initiation, the seal impression, the tasting of elixir,

original: 'gro ba'i don dang / yan lag drug dang / 'od gsal ba dang / bzhengs pa dang / sngags bzlas pa dang / gtor ma'i de kho na nyid dang / phra mo'i rnal 'byor dang / dgod pa gnyis pa dang / bzhugs pa dang / bza' ba dang /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i don dang / yan lag drug dang / 'od gsal ba dang / bzhengs pa dang / sngags bzlas pa dang / gtor ma'i de kho na nyid dang / phra mo'i rnal 'byor dang / dgod pa gnyis pa dang / bzhugs pa dang / bza' ba dang /
translated: the benefit of migrating beings, the six limbs, the clear light, the arising, the mantra recitation, the reality of the bali offering, the subtle yoga, the second emission, the abiding, the eating,

original: spyod pa dang / nyal ba dang / slar yang langs pa'o //
analyzed: spyod pa dang / nyal ba dang / slar yang langs pa'o //
translated: the conduct, the sleeping, and the rising again.

original: de nas rdzogs pa'i rim pa bri bar bya ste /
analyzed: de nas rdzogs pa'i rim pa bri bar bya ste /
translated: Then, the completion stage should be written.

original: chos kyi sgras don rnam pa gnyis bstan te man ngag ji lta ba las khong du chud par bya'o zhes gang gsungs pa 'di'i don to //
analyzed: chos kyi sgras don rnam pa gnyis bstan te man ngag ji lta ba las khong du chud par bya'o zhes gang gsungs pa 'di'i don to //
translated: The meaning of this is what is stated: “The meaning of the Dharma is taught by the word ‘meaning’ in two ways, which should be understood according to the esoteric instructions.”

original: man ngag kyang 'di yin te bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor gyis sems brtan par byed pa'i don du rdo rje'i bu gar mtshan ma nyungs kar sbom po tsam du rnam par bsams nas dkyil 'khor gyi dbang phyug bsam par bya'o //🔽rim pa 'di nyid kyis rdzogs pa'i rim pa bsgom pa po zla ba dang nyi ma dang thob pa dang sa bon la sogs pa la mi ltos par skad cig gi rnam pas rang gi 'dod pa'i lha'i rnam par rdzogs pa'i gzugs su rdzogs par byas nas chos
analyzed: man ngag kyang 'di yin te bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor gyis sems brtan par byed pa'i don du rdo rje'i bu gar mtshan ma nyungs kar sbom po tsam du rnam par bsams nas dkyil 'khor gyi dbang phyug bsam par bya'o // rim pa 'di nyid kyis rdzogs pa'i rim pa bsgom pa po zla ba dang nyi ma dang thob pa dang sa bon la sogs pa la mi ltos par skad cig gi rnam pas rang gi 'dod pa'i lha'i rnam par rdzogs pa'i gzugs su rdzogs par byas nas chos
translated: The esoteric instruction is this: in order to stabilize the mind by the yoga of the creation stage, one should imagine the sign in the vajra aperture, the size of a large mustard seed, and imagine the Lord of the Mandala.

original: las steng du sna'i rtse mor nyung kar bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: las steng du sna'i rtse mor nyung kar bsam par bya'o //
translated: By this very stage, the one who cultivates the completion stage, without relying on the moon, sun, attainment, seed, etc., should complete the form of the perfect deity with the aspect of an instant, and then imagine the sign in the vajra aperture, the size of a small mustard seed.

original: nyungs kar zhes pa ni srog rtsol gyi kun du rtog pa ste de yang nyin mtshan du rgyu ba'i rim pas khrig phrag gnyis dang brgya phrag bcu drug tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyungs kar zhes pa ni srog rtsol gyi kun du rtog pa ste de yang nyin mtshan du rgyu ba'i rim pas khrig phrag gnyis dang brgya phrag bcu drug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: The small mustard seed is the conception of prāṇāyāma, which is two hundred and sixteen thousand in the course of day and night.

original: de bsgom pa rab kyi mthar thug pa'i rim pa de nyid kyis srog rtsol 'gog pa'i phyir gzung ba la sogs pa'i rnam pas de'i rang bzhin brgyad cu dang bcas pa 'gog ste med par dgag pa'i 'jug pas so //
analyzed: de bsgom pa rab kyi mthar thug pa'i rim pa de nyid kyis srog rtsol 'gog pa'i phyir gzung ba la sogs pa'i rnam pas de'i rang bzhin brgyad cu dang bcas pa 'gog ste med par dgag pa'i 'jug pas so //
translated: By the very same process of the culmination of the best meditation, he stops the life-force and exertion, and so stops the eighty natures of that, along with their retinue, by the engagement of the negation of non-existence.

original: de nas yang spro ba dang sdud pa'i sku rdo rje 'chang 'byung ba yin te 'di ni med par dgag pa dang ma yin par dgag pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de nas yang spro ba dang sdud pa'i sku rdo rje 'chang 'byung ba yin te 'di ni med par dgag pa dang ma yin par dgag pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: Then again, the body of emanation and withdrawal arises as Vajradhara, and this is the nature of the negation of non-existence and the negation of existence.

original: de dang 'dis kyang sa brgyad kyi dbang phyug nyid du rab tu grub bo //
analyzed: de dang 'dis kyang sa brgyad kyi dbang phyug nyid du rab tu grub bo //
translated: And by this, he is well established as the lord of the eighth stage.

original: dz'a landha ri pa'i zhabs kyis de gsungs pa /
analyzed: dz'a landha ri pa'i zhabs kyis de gsungs pa /
translated: The venerable Jalandhari says this:

original: de'i rjes su lta ba @118b las steng du 'gro bar bsam par bya ste /🔽ji ltar 'dod pas dmigs pa med par sna las rngub pa bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes su lta ba @118b las steng du 'gro bar bsam par bya ste / ji ltar 'dod pas dmigs pa med par sna las rngub pa bsam par bya'o //
translated: After that, one should imagine the movement upward from the view.🔽As one wishes, one should imagine the inhalation from the nose without a focus.

original: de bzhin kho nar dbyung ba na 'og tu dmigs pa med pa ji srid par ro //
analyzed: de bzhin kho nar dbyung ba na 'og tu dmigs pa med pa ji srid par ro //
translated: In the same way, when exhaling, one should imagine the downward movement without a focus.

original: ji ltar 'dod pa'i sgra ni rtogs pa ste de lta bu'i man ngag ni shin tu sbas pa yin no zhes pa rdo rje bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa'i sgra ni rtogs pa ste de lta bu'i man ngag ni shin tu sbas pa yin no zhes pa rdo rje bzlas pa'o //
translated: The sound of desire is the realization, and such an instruction is very hidden.

original: 'dis 'di gsungs pa yin te bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa dag gis lus dang ngag dang sems brdzun pa nyid du rtogs pa la brten nas stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i byang chub kyi sems la 'jug go //
analyzed: 'dis 'di gsungs pa yin te bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa dag gis lus dang ngag dang sems brdzun pa nyid du rtogs pa la brten nas stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i byang chub kyi sems la 'jug go //
translated: This is taught by this: based on the realization of the body, speech, and mind as false by means of the creation and completion stages, one enters into the mind of enlightenment, the inseparability of emptiness and compassion.

original: des bdag byin gyis brlabs pa yang khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: des bdag byin gyis brlabs pa yang khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: By that, one should understand the self-consecration.

original: kye rdo rjer yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: kye rdo rjer yang gsungs pa /
translated: It is also said in the Hevajra Tantra:

original: rdo rje snying pos gsol ba /
analyzed: rdo rje snying pos gsol ba /
translated: Vajragarbha asked:

original: thabs gang gis byang chub kyi sems bskyed par bgyi ba lags /
analyzed: thabs gang gis byang chub kyi sems bskyed par bgyi ba lags /
translated: By what method should the mind of enlightenment be generated?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān replied:

original: dkyil 'khor 'khor lo sogs thabs dang // bdag byin brlab pa'i rim pas kyang //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor 'khor lo sogs thabs dang // bdag byin brlab pa'i rim pas kyang //
translated: By the method of the maṇḍala wheel, and so on, and by the stage of self-consecration.

original: zhes pa rdo rje'i bzlas pa ste rim pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa rdo rje'i bzlas pa ste rim pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the vajra recitation, the second stage.

original: da ni bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa rtogs par bya ste de la dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la sogs pa'i thabs rtogs par byas pa las brdzun pa'i lus dang ngag dang sems ni bdag gi sgras mngon par brjod par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: da ni bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa rtogs par bya ste de la dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo la sogs pa'i thabs rtogs par byas pa las brdzun pa'i lus dang ngag dang sems ni bdag gi sgras mngon par brjod par bya ba yin la /
translated: Now, one should understand the stage of self-consecration. Therein, the false body, speech, and mind, which are to be understood as the method of the circle of deities, etc., are to be expressed by the word self.

original: de rnams kyi byin gyis brlab pa ni phan tshun so so ma yin pa'i rnam pas skyes pa'i lus la sogs pa dbyer med pa gang mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang dpe byad brgyad cus brgyan pa'i sku dmigs pa med pa'i bde ba'i khang pa khyad par dga'
analyzed: de rnams kyi byin gyis brlab pa ni phan tshun so so ma yin pa'i rnam pas skyes pa'i lus la sogs pa dbyer med pa gang mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang dpe byad brgyad cus brgyan pa'i sku dmigs pa med pa'i bde ba'i khang pa khyad par dga'
translated: Their consecration is the body, etc., which are not different from each other, indivisible, adorned with the body of the thirty-two and the eighty minor marks, the abode of non-objectivized bliss, the characteristic of the special joy of

original: ba'i mtshan nyid sgyu ma lta bu'i ye shes lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i ye shes rnam par dag pa de ni bdag byin gyis brlab par brjod de longs spyod rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: ba'i mtshan nyid sgyu ma lta bu'i ye shes lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i ye shes rnam par dag pa de ni bdag byin gyis brlab par brjod de longs spyod rdzogs pa'o //
translated: the illusion-like intuition, the intuition of innate joy, the pure self-consecration, which is the beatific body.

original: ci ltar na de'i lus la sogs pa dbyer med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar na de'i lus la sogs pa dbyer med pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that the body, etc., are indivisible?

original: brtag pa gnyis pa'i le'u bzhi par gsungs pa /
analyzed: brtag pa gnyis pa'i le'u bzhi par gsungs pa /
translated: The second chapter of the Two-Part Hevajra Tantra says:

original: lus spangs nas ni gzhan du na //
analyzed: lus spangs nas ni gzhan du na //
translated: Without the body,

original: sems ni mdzes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems ni mdzes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: the mind is not beautiful.

original: sems spangs nas kyang gzhan du na //
analyzed: sems spangs nas kyang gzhan du na //
translated: Without the mind,

original: lus ni gnas pa mthong mi 'gyur //
analyzed: lus ni gnas pa mthong mi 'gyur //
translated: the body is not seen to exist.

original: dpal 'dus par yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: dpal 'dus par yang gsungs pa /
translated: The glorious Guhyasamaja Tantra also says:

original: lus kyi rnam pas sems dang / sems kyi rnam pas lus dang ngag tu brjod pas sems su khyed kyis @119a * //
analyzed: lus kyi rnam pas sems dang / sems kyi rnam pas lus dang ngag tu brjod pas sems su khyed kyis @119a * //
translated: The body is the aspect of the mind, and the mind is the aspect of the body and speech.

original: bskyed cig ces so //
analyzed: bskyed cig ces so //
translated: Therefore, you should generate the mind.

original: 'phags pa lha'i zhabs kyis kyang lam gyi snying po las gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa lha'i zhabs kyis kyang lam gyi snying po las gsungs pa /
translated: Noble Lord also says in the Essence of the Path:

original: gang zhig rang bdag nyid kyis 'gyur //
analyzed: gang zhig rang bdag nyid kyis 'gyur //
translated: That which is transformed by itself

original: de 'dir rang byin brlab pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dir rang byin brlab pa'o //
translated: is here called “self-consecration.”

original: gnyis med nyid las nges grol ba //
analyzed: gnyis med nyid las nges grol ba //
translated: It is called “self” because it is definitely liberated from nonduality.

original: bdag gi sgra yis mngon brjod bya //
analyzed: bdag gi sgra yis mngon brjod bya //
translated: The term “self” is used to express this.

original: dz'a landha ri pa'i zhabs kyis kyang //
analyzed: dz'a landha ri pa'i zhabs kyis kyang //
translated: The venerable Jalandhari

original: rigs kyi le'u las phyung nas longs spyod rdzogs pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rigs kyi le'u las phyung nas longs spyod rdzogs pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: also says in the chapter on the family of the Samputa Tantra:

original: lus la ye shes chen po gnas //
analyzed: lus la ye shes chen po gnas //
translated: Great wisdom abides in the body.

original: kun du rtog pa thams cad spangs //
analyzed: kun du rtog pa thams cad spangs //
translated: It is the abandonment of all conceptual thoughts.

original: dngos po kun la khyab byed pa //
analyzed: dngos po kun la khyab byed pa //
translated: It pervades all things.

original: lus la gnas kyang lus skyes min //
analyzed: lus la gnas kyang lus skyes min //
translated: It abides in the body, but is not born from the body.

original: le'u brgyad par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: le'u brgyad par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
translated: In the eighth chapter, the Bhagavān said:

original: rang rig 'di ni ye shes te //
analyzed: rang rig 'di ni ye shes te //
translated: This self-awareness is wisdom,

original: ngag gi lam 'das spyod yul lo //
analyzed: ngag gi lam 'das spyod yul lo //
translated: Beyond the path of speech, its domain.

original: 'dis ni byin rlabs rim pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'dis ni byin rlabs rim pa'i phyir //
translated: By this, through the stage of consecration,

original: kun mkhyen ye shes de rang bzhin //
analyzed: kun mkhyen ye shes de rang bzhin //
translated: The wisdom of the Omniscient One has that nature.

original: bdag byin gyis brlab pa nyid bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa sna tshogs la ltos nas ming gzhan gyis gsungs te /
analyzed: bdag byin gyis brlab pa nyid bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa sna tshogs la ltos nas ming gzhan gyis gsungs te /
translated: The Bhagavān taught self-consecration itself using other names, depending on the various teachings.
